prototypes.name: AccumulatorPrototype
prototypes.description: Entity with energy source with specialised animation for charging/discharging. Used for the [accumulator](https://wiki.factorio.com/Accumulator) entity.
examples:
```
{
  type = "accumulator",
  name = "accumulator",
  icon = "__base__/graphics/icons/accumulator.png",
  flags = {"placeable-neutral", "player-creation"},
  minable = {mining_time = 0.1, result = "accumulator"},
  fast_replaceable_group = "accumulator",
  max_health = 150,
  corpse = "accumulator-remnants",
  collision_box = {{-0.9, -0.9}, {0.9, 0.9}},
  selection_box = {{-1, -1}, {1, 1}},
  energy_source =
  {
    type = "electric",
    buffer_capacity = "5MJ",
    usage_priority = "tertiary",
    input_flow_limit = "300kW",
    output_flow_limit = "300kW"
  },
  chargable_graphics =
  {
    picture = accumulator_picture(),
    charge_animation = accumulator_charge(),
    charge_cooldown = 30,
    discharge_animation = accumulator_discharge(),
    discharge_cooldown = 60
  },
  water_reflection = accumulator_reflection(),
  working_sound =
  {
    main_sounds =
    {
      {
        sound = {filename = "__base__/sound/accumulator-working.ogg", volume = 0.4, modifiers = volume_multiplier("main-menu", 1.44)},
        match_volume_to_activity = true,
        activity_to_volume_modifiers = {offset = 2, inverted = true},
        fade_in_ticks = 4,
        fade_out_ticks = 20
      },
      {
        sound = {filename = "__base__/sound/accumulator-discharging.ogg", volume = 0.4, modifiers = volume_multiplier("main-menu", 1.44)},
        match_volume_to_activity = true,
        activity_to_volume_modifiers = {offset = 1},
        fade_in_ticks = 4,
        fade_out_ticks = 20
      }
    },
    idle_sound = {filename = "__base__/sound/accumulator-idle.ogg", volume = 0.35},
    max_sounds_per_prototype = 3,
    audible_distance_modifier = 0.5
  },

  circuit_connector = circuit_connector_definitions["accumulator"],
  circuit_wire_max_distance = default_circuit_wire_max_distance,

  default_output_signal = {type = "virtual", name = "signal-A"}
}
```

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

properties.name: default_output_signal
properties.description: The name of the signal that is the default for when an accumulator is connected to the circuit network.

properties.name: energy_source
properties.description: The capacity of the energy source buffer specifies the capacity of the accumulator.

prototypes.name: AchievementPrototype
prototypes.description: This prototype definition is used for the in-game achievements.

properties.name: allowed_without_fight
properties.description: If this is set to `false`, it is not possible to complete the achievement on the peaceful difficulty setting or when the enemy base generation settings have been changed.

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Path to the icon file.

Mandatory if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icon_size
properties.description:
The size of the square icon, in pixels. E.g. `32` for a 32px by 32px icon. Must be larger than `0`.

The base game uses 128px icons for achievements.

Only loaded if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icons
properties.description: Can't be an empty array.

properties.name: steam_stats_name
properties.description: Unusable by mods, as this refers to unlocking the achievement through Steam.

properties.name: objective_condition
properties.description: The condition that needs to be met to receive the achievement. Required for `"complete-objective-achievement"`, `"dont-build-entity-achievement"`, and `"dont-craft-manually-achievement"`. Not allowed for `"dont-kill-manually-achievement"` and `"dont-research-before-researching-achievement"`. Only allowed for `"dont-use-entity-in-energy-production-achievement"` if `"last_hour_only"` is `false`.

prototypes.name: ActiveDefenseEquipmentPrototype
prototypes.description: Used by [discharge defense](https://wiki.factorio.com/Discharge_defense) and [personal laser defense](https://wiki.factorio.com/Personal_laser_defense).

prototypes.name: ActiveTriggerPrototype
prototypes.description: The abstract base of all active trigger prototypes. Active triggers are a special type of trigger delivery mechanism that function of a period of time and do not result in the creation or deletion of entities to function. They are intended to be short-lived objects associated with a surface and cannot be cancelled until they self-destruct. Active triggers support migrations and prototype changes, but require their own named prototype to function.

properties.name: accepted_seeds
properties.description: When missing, all items with [plant result](prototype:ItemPrototype::plant_result) will be accepted. When provided, only items on this list that have plant result will be accepted.

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

properties.name: crane_energy_usage
properties.description: The amount of energy this agricultural tower uses while the crane is moving.

properties.name: energy_usage
properties.description: The amount of energy this agricultural tower uses for each planted or harvested [plant](prototype:PlantPrototype).

properties.name: growth_area_radius
properties.description:
The minimum radius of empty space a [plant](prototype:PlantPrototype) requires around it to be planted.

Must be >= 0 and <= growth_grid_tile_size / 2

properties.name: growth_grid_tile_size
properties.description:
The size of one grid tile a [plant](prototype:PlantPrototype) is planted into.

Must be positive.

properties.name: radius
properties.description:
The radius represents [grid tiles](prototype:AgriculturalTowerPrototype::growth_grid_tile_size) which are created around the agricultural tower from its [collision box](prototype:EntityPrototype::collision_box).

Must be positive.

properties.name: random_growth_offset
properties.description:
The maximum offset from the grid tile center which will be applied to the planting spot selected by this agricultural tower.

Must be >= 0 and < 1.

properties.name: randomize_planting_tile
properties.description: Whether the agricultural tower will start from a random grid tile when given a planting task.

prototypes.name: AirbornePollutantPrototype
prototypes.description: A type of pollution that can spread throughout the chunks of a map.

properties.name: affects_water_tint
properties.description: If true, large amounts of this pollution will cause water tiles to turn a sickly green.

properties.name: damages_trees
properties.description: If true, trees will occasionally take damage from this pollutant type. When they do, some amount of pollution is removed from the chunk equal to the map's `pollution_restored_per_tree_damage` setting.

properties.name: localised_name_with_amount
properties.description: The translated plural string key to use when displaying this pollution's name with an amount. See [Tutorial:Localisation](https://wiki.factorio.com/Tutorial:Localisation).

prototypes.name: AmbientSound
prototypes.description: This prototype is used to make sound while playing the game. This includes the game's [music](https://store.steampowered.com/app/436090/Factorio__Soundtrack/), composed by Daniel James Taylor.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Unique textual identification of the prototype.

properties.name: planet
properties.description: Track without a planet is bound to space platforms.

properties.name: sound
properties.description:
Static music track.

One of `sound` or `variable_sound` must be defined. Both cannot be defined together.

properties.name: type
properties.description: Specification of the type of the prototype.

properties.name: variable_sound
properties.description:
Variable music track.

One of `sound` or `variable_sound` must be defined. Both cannot be defined together.

properties.name: weight
properties.description:
Cannot be less than zero.

Cannot be defined if `track_type` is `"hero-track"`.

prototypes.name: AmmoCategory
prototypes.description: An ammo category. Each weapon has an ammo category, and can use any ammo with the same ammo category. Ammo categories can also be upgraded by technologies.

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Path to the icon file.

Only loaded if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icon_size
properties.description:
The size of the square icon, in pixels. E.g. `32` for a 32px by 32px icon. Must be larger than `0`.

Only loaded if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icons
properties.description: Can't be an empty array.

prototypes.name: AmmoItemPrototype
prototypes.description: Ammo used for a gun.

properties.name: ammo_type
properties.description:
When using a plain [AmmoType](prototype:AmmoType) (no array), the ammo type applies to everything (`"default"`).

When using an array of AmmoTypes, they have the additional [AmmoType::source_type](prototype:AmmoType::source_type) property.

properties.name: magazine_size
properties.description: Number of shots before ammo item is consumed. Must be >= `1`.

properties.name: reload_time
properties.description: Amount of extra time (in ticks) it takes to reload the weapon after depleting the magazine. Must be >= `0`.

prototypes.name: AmmoTurretPrototype
prototypes.description: A turret that consumes [ammo items](prototype:AmmoItemPrototype).

properties.name: automated_ammo_count
properties.description: Shift of the "alt-mode icon" relative to the turret's position.

prototypes.name: AnimationPrototype
prototypes.description: Specifies an animation that can be used with [LuaRendering::draw_animation](runtime:LuaRendering::draw_animation) at runtime.

properties.name: allow_forced_downscale
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

If `true`, the sprite may be downsampled to half its size on load even when 'Sprite quality' graphics setting is set to 'High'. Whether downsampling happens depends on detected hardware and other graphics settings.

properties.name: animation_speed
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Modifier of the animation playing speed, the default of `1` means one animation frame per tick (60 fps). The speed of playing can often vary depending on the usage (output of steam engine for example). Has to be greater than `0`.

If `layers` are used, the `animation_speed` only has to be defined in one layer. All layers will run at the same speed.

properties.name: apply_runtime_tint
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: apply_special_effect
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: blend_mode
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: dice
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: dice_x
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: dice_y
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: draw_as_glow
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Only one of `draw_as_shadow`, `draw_as_glow` and `draw_as_light` can be true. This takes precedence over `draw_as_light`.

Draws first as a normal sprite, then again as a light layer. See [https://forums.factorio.com/91682](https://forums.factorio.com/91682).

properties.name: draw_as_light
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Only one of `draw_as_shadow`, `draw_as_glow` and `draw_as_light` can be true.

properties.name: draw_as_shadow
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Only one of `draw_as_shadow`, `draw_as_glow` and `draw_as_light` can be true. This takes precedence over `draw_as_glow` and `draw_as_light`.

properties.name: filename
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined. Mandatory if neither `stripes` nor `filenames` are defined.

The path to the sprite file to use.

properties.name: filenames
properties.description: Only loaded if neither `layers` nor `stripes` are defined.

properties.name: flags
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: frame_count
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Can't be `0`.

properties.name: frame_sequence
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: generate_sdf
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Unused.

properties.name: height
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined. Mandatory if `size` is not defined.

Height of one frame in pixels, from 0-4096.

properties.name: invert_colors
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: layers
properties.description:
If this property is present, all Animation definitions have to be placed as entries in the array, and they will all be loaded from there. `layers` may not be an empty table. Each definition in the array may also have the `layers` property.

`animation_speed` and `max_advance` of the first layer are used for all layers. All layers will run at the same speed.

If this property is present, all other properties besides `name` and `type` are ignored.

properties.name: line_length
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Once the specified number of pictures is loaded, other pictures are loaded on other line. This is to allow having longer animations in matrix, to input files with too high width. The game engine limits the width of any input files to 8192px, so it is compatible with most graphics cards. `0` means that all the pictures are in one horizontal line.

properties.name: lines_per_file
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined. Mandatory if `filenames` is defined.

properties.name: load_in_minimal_mode
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Minimal mode is entered when mod loading fails. You are in it when you see the gray box after (part of) the loading screen that tells you a mod error. Modders can ignore this property.

properties.name: max_advance
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

If `layers` are used, `max_advance` of the first layer is used for all layers.

Maximum amount of frames the animation can move forward in one update.

properties.name: mipmap_count
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Only loaded if this is an icon, that is it has the flag `"group=icon"` or `"group=gui"`.

Note that `mipmap_count` doesn't make sense in an animation, as it is not possible to layout mipmaps in a way that would load both the animation and the mipmaps correctly (besides animations with just one frame). See [here](https://forums.factorio.com/viewtopic.php?p=549058#p549058).

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the animation. Can be used with [LuaRendering::draw_animation](runtime:LuaRendering::draw_animation) at runtime.

properties.name: position
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Loaded only when `x` and `y` are both `0`. The first member of the tuple is `x` and the second is `y`.

properties.name: premul_alpha
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Whether alpha should be pre-multiplied.

properties.name: priority
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: repeat_count
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

How many times to repeat the animation to complete an animation cycle. E.g. if one layer is 10 frames, a second layer of 1 frame would need `repeat_count = 10` to match the complete cycle.

properties.name: rotate_shift
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: run_mode
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: scale
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Values other than `1` specify the scale of the sprite on default zoom. A scale of `2` means that the picture will be two times bigger on screen (and thus more pixelated).

properties.name: shift
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

The shift in tiles. `util.by_pixel()` can be used to divide the shift by 32 which is the usual pixel height/width of 1 tile in normal resolution. Note that 32 pixel tile height/width is not enforced anywhere - any other tile height or width is also possible.

properties.name: size
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

The width and height of one frame. If this is a tuple, the first member of the tuple is the width and the second is the height. Otherwise the size is both width and height. Width and height may only be in the range of 0-4096.

properties.name: slice
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined and if `filenames` is defined.

properties.name: stripes
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: surface
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Provides hint to sprite atlas system, so it can try to put sprites that are intended to be used at the same locations to the same sprite atlas.

properties.name: tint
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: tint_as_overlay
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: usage
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Provides hint to sprite atlas system, so it can pack sprites that are related to each other to the same sprite atlas.

properties.name: width
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined. Mandatory if `size` is not defined.

Width of one frame in pixels, from 0-4096.

properties.name: x
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Horizontal position of the animation in the source file in pixels.

properties.name: y
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Vertical position of the animation in the source file in pixels.

```
  type = "arrow",
  name = "orange-arrow-with-circle",

  circle_picture =

    priority = "low",
    width = 50,
    height = 50
  }
}
```

prototypes.name: AssemblingMachinePrototype
prototypes.description: An assembling machine - like the assembling machines 1/2/3 in the game, but you can use your own recipe categories.

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

properties.name: disabled_when_recipe_not_researched
properties.description: Defaults to true if fixed_recipe is not given.

properties.name: fixed_quality
properties.description: Only loaded when fixed_recipe is provided.

properties.name: fixed_recipe
properties.description: The preset recipe of this machine. This machine does not show a recipe selection if this is set. The base game uses this for the [rocket silo](https://wiki.factorio.com/Rocket_silo).

properties.name: gui_title_key
properties.description: The locale key of the title of the GUI that is shown when the player opens the assembling machine. May not be longer than 200 characters.

properties.name: ingredient_count
properties.description:
Sets the maximum number of ingredients this machine can craft with. Any recipe with more ingredients than this will be unavailable in this machine.

This only counts item ingredients, not fluid ingredients! This means if ingredient count is 2, and the recipe has 2 item ingredients and 1 fluid ingredient, it can still be crafted in the machine.

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Path to the icon file.

Mandatory if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icon_size
properties.description:
The size of the square icon, in pixels. E.g. `32` for a 32px by 32px icon. Must be larger than `0`.

Only loaded if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icons
properties.description: Can't be an empty array.

properties.name: arm_slow_energy_usage
properties.description: If `arm_energy_usage` is not met, attempts to move slower at the cost of `arm_slow_energy_usage`.

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

properties.name: collection_radius
properties.description: Must be positive.

properties.name: emissions_per_second
properties.description: Emissions cannot be larger than zero, asteroids cannot produce pollution.

prototypes.name: AutoplaceControl
prototypes.description: A setting in the map creation GUI. Used by the [autoplace system](prototype:AutoplaceSpecification::control).

properties.name: can_be_disabled
properties.description: Whether there is an "enable" checkbox for the autoplace control in the map generator GUI. If this is false, the autoplace control cannot be disabled from the GUI.

properties.name: category
properties.description: Controls in what tab the autoplace is shown in the map generator GUI.

properties.name: related_to_fight_achievements
properties.description: Whether this settings being lower than default disables fight related achievements

properties.name: richness
properties.description:
Sets whether this control's richness can be changed. The map generator GUI will only show the richness slider when the `category` is `"resource"`.

If the autoplace control is used to generate ores, you probably want this to be true.

prototypes.name: BatteryEquipmentPrototype
prototypes.description: Used by [personal battery](https://wiki.factorio.com/Personal_battery).

prototypes.name: BeaconPrototype
prototypes.description: Entity with the ability to transfer [module](prototype:ModulePrototype) effects to its neighboring entities.

properties.name: allowed_effects
properties.description: The types of [modules](prototype:ModulePrototype) that a player can place inside of the beacon.

properties.name: allowed_module_categories
properties.description: Sets the [module categories](prototype:ModuleCategory) that are allowed to be inserted into this machine.

properties.name: animation
properties.description:
Only loaded if `graphics_set` is not defined.

The animation for the beacon, when in use.

properties.name: base_picture
properties.description:
Only loaded if `graphics_set` is not defined.

The picture of the beacon when it is not on.

properties.name: beacon_counter
properties.description: The beacon counter used by effect receiver when deciding which sample to take from `profile`.

properties.name: distribution_effectivity
properties.description: The multiplier of the module's effects, when shared between neighbors.

properties.name: distribution_effectivity_bonus_per_quality_level
properties.description: Must be 0 or positive.

properties.name: energy_usage
properties.description: The constant power usage of this beacon.

properties.name: graphics_set
properties.description: The graphics for the beacon.

properties.name: module_slots
properties.description: The number of module slots in this beacon.

properties.name: perceived_performance
properties.description: Affects animation speed.

properties.name: profile
properties.description:
Extra multiplier applied to the effects received from beacon by the effect receiver based on amount of beacons that are in range of that effect receiver.

If there are more beacons that reach the effect receiver than there are entries in this array, then the last entry in the array is used for the multiplier.

If this is not defined, then an implicit profile of `{1}` will be used.
examples:
```
profile = {1, 0} -- entities do not receive any effects when they are in range of more than one beacon
```

properties.name: supply_area_distance
properties.description: The maximum distance that this beacon can supply its neighbors with its module's effects. Max distance is 64.

prototypes.name: BeamPrototype
prototypes.description: Used as a laser beam.

properties.name: action_triggered_automatically
properties.description: Whether this beams should trigger its action every `damage_interval`. If false, the action is instead triggered when its owner triggers shooting.

properties.name: damage_interval
properties.description: Damage interval can't be 0. A value of 1 will cause the attack to be applied each tick.

properties.description: If the item will draw its label when held in the cursor in place of the item count.

properties.description: The inventory size of the item.

properties.name: stack_size
properties.description: Count of items of the same name that can be stored in one inventory slot. Must be 1 when the `"not-stackable"` flag is set.

prototypes.name: BlueprintItemPrototype
prototypes.description: A [blueprint](https://wiki.factorio.com/Blueprint).

properties.name: alt_select
properties.description:
The [SelectionModeData::mode](prototype:SelectionModeData::mode) is hardcoded to `"blueprint"`.

The filters are parsed, but then ignored and forced to be empty.

properties.name: always_include_tiles
properties.description: This property is hardcoded to `false`.

properties.name: draw_label_for_cursor_render
properties.description: Whether the item will draw its label when held in the cursor in place of the item count.

properties.name: select
properties.description:
The [SelectionModeData::mode](prototype:SelectionModeData::mode) is hardcoded to `"blueprint"`.

The filters are parsed, but then ignored and forced to be empty.

properties.name: stack_size
properties.description: Count of items of the same name that can be stored in one inventory slot. Must be 1 when the `"not-stackable"` flag is set.

prototypes.name: BoilerPrototype
prototypes.description: A [boiler](https://wiki.factorio.com/Boiler). It heats fluid and optionally outputs it as a different fluid.

properties.name: burning_cooldown
properties.description:
Controls for how many ticks the boiler will show the fire and fire_glow after the energy source runs out of energy.

Note that `fire` and `fire_glow` alpha is set to the light intensity of the energy source, so 0 light intensity means the fire is invisible. For burner energy sources, the light intensity will reach zero rather quickly after the boiler runs out of fuel, effectively capping the time that `fire` and `fire_glow` will be shown after the boiler runs out of fuel.

properties.name: fire_flicker_enabled
properties.description: If this is set to false, `fire` alpha is always 1 instead of being controlled by the light intensity of the energy source.

properties.name: fire_glow_flicker_enabled
properties.description: If this is set to false, `fire_glow` alpha is always 1 instead of being controlled by the light intensity of the energy source.

properties.name: fluid_box
properties.description:
The input fluid box.

If `mode` is `"heat-fluid-inside"`, the fluid is heated up directly in this fluidbox.

properties.name: mode
properties.description:
In the `"heat-fluid-inside"` mode, fluid in the `fluid_box` is continuously heated from the input temperature up to its [FluidPrototype::max_temperature](prototype:FluidPrototype::max_temperature).

In the `"output-to-separate-pipe"` mode, fluid is transferred from the `fluid_box` to the `output_fluid_box` when enough energy is available to [heat](prototype:FluidPrototype::heat_capacity) the input fluid to the `target_temperature`. Setting a filter on the `output_fluid_box` means that instead of the heated input fluid getting moved to the output, it is converted to the filtered fluid in a 1:1 ratio.

properties.name: output_fluid_box
properties.description:
The output fluid box.

If `mode` is `"output-to-separate-pipe"` and this has a [filter](prototype:FluidBox::filter), the heated input fluid is converted to the output fluid that is set in the filter (in a 1:1 ratio).

If `mode` is `"heat-fluid-inside"`, this fluidbox is unused.

properties.name: target_temperature
properties.description: Only loaded, and mandatory if `mode` is `"output-to-separate-pipe"`. This is the temperature that the input fluid must reach to be moved to the output fluid box.

prototypes.name: BuildEntityAchievementPrototype
prototypes.description: This prototype is used for receiving an achievement when the player builds an entity.

properties.name: amount
properties.description: How many entities need to be built.

properties.name: limited_to_one_game
properties.description: If this is false, the player carries over their statistics from this achievement through all their saves.

properties.name: to_build
properties.description: This will trigger the achievement, if this entity is placed.

properties.name: within
properties.description: The achievement must be completed within this time limit.

prototypes.name: BurnerGeneratorPrototype
prototypes.description: An entity that produces power from a burner energy source.

properties.name: always_draw_idle_animation
properties.description: Whether the `idle_animation` should also play when the generator is active.

properties.name: animation
properties.description: Plays when the generator is active. `idle_animation` must have the same frame count as animation.

properties.name: burner
properties.description: The input energy source of the generator.

properties.name: energy_source
properties.description: The output energy source of the generator. Any emissions specified on this energy source are ignored, they must be specified on `burner`.

properties.name: idle_animation
properties.description: Plays when the generator is inactive. Idle animation must have the same frame count as `animation`.

properties.name: max_power_output
properties.description: How much energy this generator can produce.

properties.name: perceived_performance
properties.description: Affects animation speed and working sound.

prototypes.name: BurnerUsagePrototype
prototypes.description: Set of data affecting tooltips, looks of gui slots etc when [burner](prototype:BurnerEnergySource) is not supposed to be burning items but eating them.

prototypes.name: CapsulePrototype
prototypes.description: A capsule, for example a [combat robot capsule](https://wiki.factorio.com/Combat_robot_capsules) or the [raw fish](https://wiki.factorio.com/Raw_fish).

properties.name: radius_color
properties.description: Color of the range radius that is shown around the player when they hold the capsule.

properties.name: capture_speed
properties.description: Must be >= 0.001.

properties.name: search_radius
properties.description: Must be >= 0.0.

prototypes.name: CarPrototype
prototypes.description: Entity with specialized properties for acceleration, braking, and turning.

properties.name: animation
properties.description: Animation speed 1 means 1 frame per tile.

properties.name: auto_sort_inventory
properties.description: If this car prototype keeps the trunk inventory sorted.

properties.name: effectivity
properties.description: Modifies the efficiency of energy transfer from burner output to wheels.

properties.name: guns
properties.description: The names of the  [GunPrototype](prototype:GunPrototype)s this car prototype uses.

properties.name: has_belt_immunity
properties.description: If this car is immune to movement by belts.

properties.name: immune_to_cliff_impacts
properties.description: If this car gets damaged by driving against [cliffs](prototype:CliffPrototype).

properties.name: immune_to_rock_impacts
properties.description: If this car gets damaged by driving over/against [rocks](prototype:SimpleEntityPrototype::count_as_rock_for_filtered_deconstruction).

properties.name: immune_to_tree_impacts
properties.description: If this car gets damaged by driving over/against [trees](prototype:TreePrototype).

properties.name: inventory_size
properties.description: Size of the car inventory.

properties.name: light_animation
properties.description: Must have the same frame count as `animation`.

properties.name: rotation_snap_angle
properties.description: Vehicle will snap the vertical, horizontal or diagonal axis if it's within this angle

properties.name: tank_driving
properties.description: If this car prototype uses tank controls to drive.

properties.name: trash_inventory_size
properties.description: If set to 0 then the car will not have a Logistics tab.

properties.name: turret_animation
properties.description: Animation speed 1 means 1 frame per tile.

properties.name: turret_return_timeout
properties.description: Timeout in ticks specifying how long the turret must be inactive to return to the default position.

properties.name: build_grid_size
properties.description: Has to be 2 for 2x2 grid.

properties.name: inventory_size_bonus
properties.description: Cannot be 0.

properties.name: platform_graphics_set
properties.description: A special variant which renders on space platforms. If not specified, the game will fall back to the regular graphics set.

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

properties.name: robot_animation
properties.description: Drawn when a robot brings/takes items from this landing pad.

properties.name: robot_animation_sound
properties.description: Played when a robot brings/takes items from this landing pad. Ignored if `robot_animation` is not defined.

properties.name: robot_landing_location_offset
properties.description: The offset from the center of this landing pad where a robot visually brings/takes items.

properties.name: default_graphic
properties.description: Has to be of type 'pod-catalogue'.

properties.name: default_shadow_graphic
properties.description: Has to be of type 'pod-catalogue'.

prototypes.name: CargoWagonPrototype
prototypes.description: A [cargo wagon](https://wiki.factorio.com/Cargo_wagon).

properties.name: inventory_size
properties.description: Size of the inventory of the wagon. The inventory can be limited using the red bar and filtered. This functionality cannot be turned off.

prototypes.name: ChainActiveTriggerPrototype
prototypes.description: Jumps between targets and applies a [Trigger](prototype:Trigger) to them.

properties.name: action
properties.description: The trigger to apply when jumping to a new target.

properties.name: fork_chance
properties.description:
Chance that a new fork will spawn after each jump. `0` for 0% chance and `1` for 100% chance.

Must be between 0 and 1.

properties.name: jump_delay_ticks
properties.description: Tick delay between each jump. `0` means that all jumps are instantaneous.

properties.name: max_forks
properties.description: Maximum number of forks allowed to spawn for the entire chain.

properties.name: max_forks_per_jump
properties.description: Maximum number of forks that can spawn from a single jump.

properties.name: max_jumps
properties.description: Max number of jumps per trigger.

properties.name: max_range
properties.description: Max distance jumps are allowed to travel away from the original target.

properties.name: max_range_per_jump
properties.description: Max length of jumps.

prototypes.name: ChangedSurfaceAchievementPrototype
prototypes.description: This prototype is used for receiving an achievement when the player changes to a surface.

properties.name: surface
properties.description: This will trigger the achievement, if the player changes to this surface.

prototypes.name: CharacterCorpsePrototype
prototypes.description: The corpse of a [CharacterPrototype](prototype:CharacterPrototype).

properties.name: armor_picture_mapping
properties.description: Table of key value pairs, the keys are armor names and the values are numbers. The number is the Animation that is associated with the armor, e.g. using `1` will associate the armor with the first Animation in the pictures table.

properties.name: picture
properties.description: Mandatory if `pictures` is not defined.

properties.name: pictures
properties.description: Mandatory if `picture` is not defined.

properties.name: time_to_live
properties.description: 0 for infinite.

prototypes.name: CharacterPrototype
prototypes.description: Entity that you move around on the screen during the campaign and freeplay.

properties.name: character_corpse
properties.description: Name of the character corpse that is spawned when this character dies.

properties.name: crafting_categories
properties.description: Names of the crafting categories the character can craft recipes from. The built-in categories can be found [here](https://wiki.factorio.com/Data.raw#recipe-category). See also [RecipeCategory](prototype:RecipeCategory).

properties.name: eat
properties.description: The sound played when the character eats (fish for example).

properties.name: enter_vehicle_distance
properties.description: Must be >= 0.

properties.name: flying_collision_mask
properties.description:
This collision mask is used when the character is flying.

Defaults to the mask from [UtilityConstants::default_collision_masks](prototype:UtilityConstants::default_collision_masks) when indexed by `"character/flying"`.

properties.name: footprint_particles
properties.description: Triggered when the running animation (`animations`) rolls over the frames defined in `right_footprint_frames` and `left_footprint_frames`.

properties.name: footstep_particle_triggers
properties.description: Triggered every tick of the running animation.

properties.name: grounded_landing_search_radius
properties.description: The search radius for a non-colliding position to move the player to if they are grounded mid-flight. Must be >= 0.

properties.name: guns_inventory_size
properties.description: Must be between 1 and 15.

properties.name: has_belt_immunity
properties.description: Whether this character is moved by belts when standing on them.

properties.name: heartbeat
properties.description: The sound played when the character's health is low.

properties.name: inventory_size
properties.description: Number of slots in the main inventory. May be 0.

properties.name: is_military_target
properties.description: Whether this prototype should be a high priority target for enemy forces. See [Military units and structures](https://wiki.factorio.com/Military_units_and_structures).

properties.name: left_footprint_frames
properties.description: The frames in the running animation (`animations`) where the left foot touches the ground.

properties.name: left_footprint_offset
properties.description: Offset from the center of the entity for the left footprint. Used by `footprint_particles`.

properties.name: mining_categories
properties.description: Names of the resource categories the character can mine resources from.

properties.name: mining_with_tool_particles_animation_positions
properties.description: List of positions in the mining with tool animation when the mining sound and mining particles are created.

properties.name: respawn_time
properties.description: Time in seconds. Must be positive

properties.name: right_footprint_frames
properties.description: The frames in the running animation (`animations`) where the right foot touches the ground.

properties.name: right_footprint_offset
properties.description: Offset from the center of the entity for the right footprint. Used by `footprint_particles`.

properties.name: running_sound_animation_positions
properties.description: List of positions in the running animation when the walking sound is played.

properties.name: synced_footstep_particle_triggers
properties.description: Triggered when the running animation (`animations`) rolls over the frames defined in `right_footprint_frames` and `left_footprint_frames`.

properties.name: cliff_explosive

prototypes.name: CollisionLayerPrototype

A collision layer. Used for [collision masks](prototype:CollisionMaskConnector).

It's recommend to use underscores instead of dashes in `name` so that the name can easily be used as a table key when defining collision masks.

prototypes.name: CombatRobotCountAchievementPrototype

prototypes.name: CombatRobotPrototype
prototypes.description: A combat robot. Can attack enemies.

properties.name: destroy_action

prototypes.name: CombinatorPrototype

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

properties.name: emissions_per_second
properties.description: Emissions cannot be larger than zero, combinators cannot produce pollution.

properties.name: energy_source
properties.description: Defines how this combinator gets energy. The emissions set on the energy source are ignored so combinators cannot produce pollution.

properties.name: within

prototypes.name: ConstantCombinatorPrototype

properties.name: limited_to_one_game

prototypes.description: A [construction robot](https://wiki.factorio.com/Construction_robot).

properties.name: collision_box
properties.description: Must have a collision box size of zero.

prototypes.name: ContainerPrototype
prototypes.description: A generic container, such as a chest. Cannot be rotated.

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this container.

properties.name: inventory_size
properties.description: The number of slots in this container.

properties.name: inventory_type
properties.description: Whether the inventory of this container can be filtered (like cargo wagons) or not.

properties.name: picture
properties.description: The picture displayed for this entity.

prototypes.name: CopyPasteToolPrototype
prototypes.description: A copy-paste or cut-paste tool.

properties.name: alt_select
properties.description: The filters are parsed, but then ignored and forced to be empty.

properties.name: always_include_tiles
properties.description: This property is hardcoded to `false`.

properties.name: select
properties.description: The filters are parsed, but then ignored and forced to be empty.

properties.name: stack_size
properties.description: Count of items of the same name that can be stored in one inventory slot. Must be 1 when the `"not-stackable"` flag is set.

prototypes.name: CorpsePrototype
prototypes.description: Used for corpses, for example the remnants when destroying buildings.

properties.name: animation
properties.description: The dying animation.

properties.name: animation_overlay
properties.description: Variation count must be the same as `animation` variation count. Direction count must be the same as `animation` direction count. Frame count must be the same as `animation` frame count.

properties.name: auto_setup_collision_box
properties.description: If true, and the collision box is unset, this will take the collision box of the first entity that uses this corpse.

properties.name: direction_shuffle
properties.description: An array of arrays of integers. The inner arrays are called "groups" and must all have the same size.

properties.name: dying_speed
properties.description:
Multiplier for `time_before_shading_off` and `time_before_removed`. Must be positive.

Controls the speed of the animation: `1  dying_speed = duration of the animation`

properties.name: splash_speed
properties.description: Controls the speed of the splash animation: `1  splash_speed = duration of the splash animation`

properties.name: time_before_removed
properties.description: Time in ticks this corpse lasts. May not be 0.

properties.name: time_before_shading_off
properties.description: Controls how long the corpse takes to fade, as in how long it takes to get from no transparency to full transparency/removed. This time is *not* added to `time_before_removed`, it is instead subtracted from it. So by default, the corpse starts fading about 15 seconds before it gets removed.

prototypes.name: CraftingMachinePrototype
prototypes.description:
The abstract basis of the assembling machines and furnaces. Contains the properties that both of them have.

Note that a crafting machine cannot be rotated unless it has at least one of the following: a fluid box, a heat energy source, a fluid energy source, or a non-square collision box. Crafting machines with non-square collision boxes can only be rotated before placement, not after.

properties.name: allowed_effects
properties.description: Sets the [modules](prototype:ModulePrototype) and [beacon](prototype:BeaconPrototype) effects that are allowed to be used on this machine.

properties.name: allowed_module_categories
properties.description: Sets the [module categories](prototype:ModuleCategory) that are allowed to be inserted into this machine.

properties.name: crafting_categories
properties.description: A list of [recipe categories](prototype:RecipeCategory) this crafting machine can use.

properties.name: crafting_speed
properties.description:
How fast this crafting machine can craft. 1 means that for example a 1 second long recipe take 1 second to craft. 0.5 means it takes 2 seconds, and 2 means it takes 0.5 seconds.

Crafting speed has to be positive.

properties.name: draw_entity_info_icon_background
properties.description: Whether the "alt-mode icon" should have a black background.

properties.name: energy_source
properties.description:
Defines how the crafting machine is powered.

When using an electric energy source and `drain` is not specified, it will be set to `energy_usage  30` automatically.

properties.name: energy_usage
properties.description: Sets how much energy this machine uses while crafting. Energy usage has to be positive.

properties.name: fluid_boxes
properties.description: The crafting machine's fluid boxes. If an assembling machine has fluid boxes *and* [AssemblingMachinePrototype::fluid_boxes_off_when_no_fluid_recipe](prototype:AssemblingMachinePrototype::fluid_boxes_off_when_no_fluid_recipe) is true, the assembling machine can only be rotated when a recipe consuming or producing fluid is set, or if it has one of the other properties listed at the top of this page.

properties.name: match_animation_speed_to_activity
properties.description: Whether the speed of the animation and working visualization should be based on the machine's speed (boosted or slowed by modules).

properties.name: module_slots
properties.description: The number of module slots in this machine.

properties.name: perceived_performance
properties.description: Affects animation speed.

properties.name: return_ingredients_on_change
properties.description: Controls whether the ingredients of an in-progress recipe are destroyed when mining the machine/changing the recipe. If set to true, the ingredients do not get destroyed. This affects only the ingredients of the recipe that is currently in progress, so those that visually have already been consumed while their resulting product has not yet been produced.

properties.name: show_recipe_icon
properties.description: Whether the "alt-mode icon" should be drawn at all.

properties.name: show_recipe_icon_on_map
properties.description: Whether the recipe icon should be shown on the map.

prototypes.name: CreatePlatformAchievementPrototype
prototypes.description: This prototype is used for receiving an achievement when the player creates a space platform.

properties.name: amount
properties.description: How many space platforms need to be created.

prototypes.name: CurvedRailAPrototype
prototypes.description: A curved-A rail.

properties.name: collision_box
properties.description: The [collision_box](prototype:EntityPrototype::collision_box) of straight rail is hardcoded to `{{-0.7, -2.516}, {0.7, 2.516}}`.

prototypes.name: CurvedRailBPrototype
prototypes.description: A curved-B rail.

properties.name: collision_box
properties.description: The [collision_box](prototype:EntityPrototype::collision_box) of straight rail is hardcoded to `{{-0.7, -2.441}, {0.7, 2.441}}`.

prototypes.name: CustomEventPrototype
prototypes.description: Custom events share the same namespace as custom inputs and built-in events for subscribing to and raising them.

prototypes.name: CustomInputPrototype
prototypes.description: Used for custom keyboard shortcuts/key bindings in mods. The key associated with the custom input can be changed in the options. This means that `key_sequence` is simply the default key binding.

properties.name: action
properties.description: A [Lua event](runtime:CustomInputEvent) is only raised if the action is "lua".

properties.name: alternative_key_sequence
properties.description: The alternative key binding for this control. See `key_sequence` for the format.

properties.name: block_modifiers
properties.description: If `true`, when the shortcut is activated, the modifiers used for this shortcut can't be re-used to press something else until unpressed. The example where this is useful is ALT+A to activate spidertron remote, where ALT is consumed, so pressing right mouse button before the ALT is unpressed will not trigger pin creation (ALT + right mouse button), but send the selected unit instead.

properties.name: consuming
properties.description: Sets whether internal game events associated with the same key sequence should be fired or blocked. If they are fired ("none"), then the custom input event will happen before the internal game event.

properties.name: controller_alternative_key_sequence
properties.description: The alternative controller (game pad) keybinding for this control. See `controller_key_sequence` for the format.

properties.name: controller_key_sequence
properties.description:
The controller (game pad) keybinding for this control. Use `""` (empty string) for unassigned.

As modifier buttons, these names are used: `"controller-righttrigger"`, `"controller-lefttrigger"`.

`" + "` is used to separate modifier buttons from normal buttons, like so: `"controller-righttrigger + controller-a"`. A key binding can contain any amount of individual modifier buttons, but only a single normal button (listed below).
lists:
Available names for the normal controller buttons

- controller-a
- controller-b
- controller-x
- controller-y
- controller-back
- controller-guide
- controller-start
- controller-leftstick (pressing left joy stick)
- controller-left-stick (moving left joy stick)
- controller-rightstick (pressing right joy stick)
- controller-right-stick (moving right joy stick)
- controller-leftshoulder
- controller-rightshoulder
- controller-dpup
- controller-dpdown
- controller-dpleft
- controller-dpright
- controller-misc1
- controller-paddle1
- controller-paddle2
- controller-paddle3
- controller-paddle4
- controller-touchpad

properties.name: enabled
properties.description: If this custom input is enabled. Disabled custom inputs exist but are not used by the game. If disabled, no event is raised when the input is used.

properties.name: include_selected_prototype
properties.description:
If true, the type and name of the currently selected prototype will be provided as "selected_prototype" in the raised [Lua event](runtime:CustomInputEvent). [This also works in GUIs](https://forums.factorio.com/96125), not just the game world.

This will also return an item in the cursor such as copper-wire or rail-planner, if nothing is beneath the cursor.

properties.name: item_to_spawn
properties.description: The item will be created when this input is pressed and action is set to "spawn-item". The item must have the [spawnable](prototype:ItemPrototypeFlags::spawnable) flag set.

properties.name: key_sequence
properties.description:
The default key sequence for this custom input. Use `""` (empty string) for unassigned.

As modifier keys, these names are used: `"CONTROL"`, `"SHIFT"`, `"COMMAND"`, `"ALT"`. Note that `"COMMAND"` is loaded as `"CONTROL"` on Windows and Linux.

`" + "` is used to separate modifier keys from normal keys, like so: `"ALT + G"`. A key binding can contain any amount of individual modifier keys, but only a single normal mouse button or keyboard key (listed below).
lists:
Available names for the normal mouse button

- `mouse-button-1` (left)
- `mouse-button-2` (right)

properties.name: linked_game_control
properties.description: When a custom-input is linked to a game control it won't show up in the control-settings GUI and will fire when the linked control is pressed.

properties.name: name
properties.description:
Unique textual identification of the prototype. May only contain alphanumeric characters, dashes and underscores. May not exceed a length of 200 characters.

For a list of all names used in vanilla, see [data.raw](https://wiki.factorio.com/Data.raw).

It is also the name for the event that is raised when they key (combination) is pressed and action is `"lua"`, see [Tutorial:Script interfaces](https://wiki.factorio.com/Tutorial:Script_interfaces#Custom_input).

prototypes.name: DamageType
prototypes.description: A damage type. This is used in the [damage system](https://wiki.factorio.com/Damage). [A list of built-in damage types can be found here](https://wiki.factorio.com/Damage#Damage_types).

prototypes.name: DeciderCombinatorPrototype
prototypes.description: A [decider combinator](https://wiki.factorio.com/Decider_combinator).

prototypes.name: DeconstructWithRobotsAchievementPrototype
prototypes.description: This prototype is used for receiving an achievement when the player deconstructs enough entities with construction robots.

properties.name: amount
properties.description: This will trigger the achievement, if enough entities were deconstructed using construction robots.

prototypes.name: DeconstructibleTileProxyPrototype
prototypes.description: Entity used to signify that the tile below it should be deconstructed.

prototypes.name: DeconstructionItemPrototype
prototypes.description: A [deconstruction planner](https://wiki.factorio.com/Deconstruction_planner).

properties.name: alt_select
properties.description:
The [SelectionModeData::mode](prototype:SelectionModeData::mode) is hardcoded to `"cancel-deconstruct"`.

The filters are parsed, but then ignored and forced to be empty.

properties.name: always_include_tiles
properties.description: This property is hardcoded to `false`.

properties.name: entity_filter_count
properties.description: Can't be > 255.

properties.name: select
properties.description:
The [SelectionModeData::mode](prototype:SelectionModeData::mode) is hardcoded to `"deconstruct"`.

The filters are parsed, but then ignored and forced to be empty.

properties.name: stack_size
properties.description: Count of items of the same name that can be stored in one inventory slot. Must be 1 when the `"not-stackable"` flag is set.

properties.name: tile_filter_count
properties.description: Can't be > 255.

prototypes.name: DecorativePrototype
prototypes.description: Simple decorative purpose objects on the map, they have no health and some of them are removed when the player builds over. Usually used for grass patches, roots, small plants etc.

properties.name: collision_box
properties.description: Must contain the [0,0] point. Max radius of the collision box is 8.

properties.name: collision_mask
properties.description: Defaults to the mask from [UtilityConstants::default_collision_masks](prototype:UtilityConstants::default_collision_masks) when indexed by `"decorative"`.

properties.name: decal_overdraw_priority
properties.description: Loaded only if `render_layer` = "decals". When decoratives are being spawned by [EnemySpawnerPrototype::spawn_decoration](prototype:EnemySpawnerPrototype::spawn_decoration) or [TurretPrototype::spawn_decoration](prototype:TurretPrototype::spawn_decoration), decals with `decal_overdraw_priority` greater than 0 will be filtered such that they don't overlap too much. If two or more decals would overlap, only the one with the largest value of `decal_overdraw_priority` is placed.

properties.name: opacity_over_water
properties.description: Loaded only if `render_layer` = "decals". Value lower than 1 enables masking by water for decals with `tile_layer` greater or equal to [UtilityConstants::capture_water_mask_at_layer](prototype:UtilityConstants::capture_water_mask_at_layer). Water tiles must use water `tile-effect` with [WaterTileEffectParameters::lightmap_alpha](prototype:WaterTileEffectParameters::lightmap_alpha) set to 0 or value less than 1. Graphics option `Occlude light sprites` must be enabled, as water mask is captured into terrain lightmap alpha channel. Tiles rendered in layer between [UtilityConstants::capture_water_mask_at_layer](prototype:UtilityConstants::capture_water_mask_at_layer) and decal's `tile_layer` will likely also mask decals in some way, as water mask will likely be 0 at their position, but this is considered undefined behavior.

properties.name: pictures
properties.description: Must contain at least 1 picture.

properties.name: render_layer
properties.description: When "decals" render layer is used, the decorative is treated as decal. That means it will be rendered within tile layers instead of normal sprite layers.

properties.name: stateless_visualisation
properties.description: Can be defined only when decorative is not "decal" (see `render_layer`).

properties.name: stateless_visualisation_variations
properties.description: Only loaded if `stateless_visualisation` is not defined. Can be defined only when decorative is not "decal" (see `render_layer`).

properties.name: tile_layer
properties.description: Mandatory if `render_layer` = "decals". This int16 is converted to a [TileRenderLayer](prototype:TileRenderLayer) internally. It is offset from `ground-natural`.

properties.name: trigger_effect
properties.description: Called by [DestroyDecorativesTriggerEffectItem](prototype:DestroyDecorativesTriggerEffectItem).

prototypes.name: DelayedActiveTriggerPrototype
prototypes.description: Delays the delivery of triggered effect by some number of ticks.

properties.name: action
properties.description: The trigger to apply after `delay` has elapsed.

properties.name: cancel_when_source_is_destroyed
properties.description: If true, the delayed trigger is cancelled if the source entity is destroyed.

properties.name: delay
properties.description: The number of ticks to delay the delivery of the triggered effect. Must be greater than 0.

properties.name: repeat_count
properties.description: The number of times to repeat the delayed trigger.

properties.name: repeat_delay
properties.description: The number of ticks between repeat deliveries of the triggered effect. Must be greater than 0.

prototypes.name: DeliverByRobotsAchievementPrototype
prototypes.description: This prototype is used for receiving an achievement, when the player requests and receives enough items using logistic robots.

properties.name: amount
properties.description: This will trigger the achievement, when the player receives enough items through logistic robots.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the deliver category.

prototypes.name: DeliverImpactCombination

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the deliver impact combination.

prototypes.name: DepleteResourceAchievementPrototype
prototypes.description: This prototype is used for receiving an achievement when a resource entity is depleted.

properties.name: amount
properties.description: How many resource entities need to be depleted.

properties.name: limited_to_one_game
properties.description: If this is false, the player carries over their statistics from this achievement through all their saves.

properties.name: limited_to_one_game
properties.description: If this is false, the player carries over their statistics from this achievement through all their saves.

prototypes.name: DisplayPanelPrototype
prototypes.description: A display panel prototype to provide a prototype for display panels.

properties.name: background_color
properties.description: The background color of the display panel text.

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

properties.name: max_text_width
properties.description: The maximum width of the text on the display panel.

properties.name: sprites
properties.description: The display panel's graphics.

properties.name: text_color
properties.description: The color of the text on the display panel.

properties.name: text_shift
properties.description: The shift of the text on the display panel.

prototypes.name: DontBuildEntityAchievementPrototype
prototypes.description: This prototype is used for receiving an achievement when the player finishes the game without building a specific entity.

properties.name: dont_build
properties.description: This will disable the achievement, if this entity is placed. If you finish the game without building this entity, you receive the achievement.

properties.name: research_with
properties.description: If you research technology using one of specified items before building entity, you receive the achievement.

prototypes.name: DontCraftManuallyAchievementPrototype
prototypes.description: This prototype is used for receiving an achievement when the player finishes the game without crafting more than a set amount.

properties.name: amount
properties.description: This will disable the achievement, if the player crafts more than this.

prototypes.name: DontKillManuallyAchievementPrototype
prototypes.description: This prototype is used for receiving an achievement when the player kill first entity using artillery.

properties.name: to_kill
properties.description: This will disable the achievement, if this entity is killed manually. If you kill this entity with artillery first, you receive the achievement.

properties.name: type_not_to_kill
properties.description: This will disable the achievement, if this entity type is killed manually. If you kill this entity type with artillery first, you receive the achievement.

prototypes.name: DontResearchBeforeResearchingAchievementPrototype
prototypes.description: This prototype is used for receiving an achievement when the player researches with a specific science pack before unlocking another.

properties.name: dont_research
properties.description: This will disable the achievement, if technology unlocking this item is researched before meeting requirements.

properties.name: research_with
properties.description: If you research technology using one of specified items, you receive the achievement.

prototypes.name: DontUseEntityInEnergyProductionAchievementPrototype
prototypes.description: This prototype is used for receiving an achievement when the player finishes the game without receiving energy from a specific energy source.

properties.name: excluded
properties.description: This will **not** disable the achievement, if this entity is placed, and you have received any amount of power from it.

properties.name: included
properties.description: This will disable the achievement, if this entity is placed, and you have received any amount of power from it. If you finish the game without receiving power from this entity, you receive the achievement.

properties.name: last_hour_only
properties.description: If `true`, the achievements will only be checked for the last hour of the game, independently of finishing the game.

properties.name: minimum_energy_produced
properties.description: The minimum amount of energy that needs to be produced by the allowed entities to trigger the achievement.

prototypes.name: EditorControllerPrototype
prototypes.description: Properties of the editor controller.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the editor controller. Base game uses "default".

prototypes.name: ElectricEnergyInterfacePrototype
prototypes.description: Entity with electric energy source with that can have some of its values changed runtime. Useful for modding in energy consumers/producers.

properties.name: animation
properties.description: Only loaded if both `picture` and `pictures` are not defined.

properties.name: animations
properties.description: Only loaded if `picture`, `pictures`, and `animation` are not defined.

properties.name: continuous_animation
properties.description: Whether the electric energy interface animation always runs instead of being scaled to activity.

properties.name: light
properties.description: The light that this electric energy interface emits.

properties.name: pictures
properties.description: Only loaded if `picture` is not defined.

prototypes.name: ElectricPolePrototype
prototypes.description: An electric pole - part of the [electric system](https://wiki.factorio.com/Electric_system).

properties.name: active_picture
properties.description: Drawn above the `pictures` when the electric pole is connected to an electric network.

properties.name: auto_connect_up_to_n_wires
properties.description: `0` means disable auto-connect.

properties.name: light
properties.description: Drawn when the electric pole is connected to an electric network.

properties.name: maximum_wire_distance
properties.description:
The maximum distance between this pole and any other connected pole - if two poles are farther apart than this, they cannot be connected together directly. Corresponds to "wire reach" in the item tooltip.

Max value is 64.

properties.name: supply_area_distance
properties.description:
The "radius" of this pole's supply area. Corresponds to *half* of the "supply area" in the item tooltip. If this is 3.5, the pole will have a 7x7 supply area.

Max value is 64.

prototypes.name: ElectricTurretPrototype
prototypes.description: A turret that uses electricity as ammunition.

prototypes.name: ElevatedCurvedRailAPrototype
prototypes.description: An elevated curved-A rail.

prototypes.name: ElevatedCurvedRailBPrototype
prototypes.description: An elevated curved-B rail.

prototypes.name: ElevatedHalfDiagonalRailPrototype
prototypes.description: An elevated half diagonal rail.

prototypes.name: ElevatedStraightRailPrototype
prototypes.description: An elevated straight rail.

prototypes.name: EnemySpawnerPrototype
prototypes.description: Can spawn entities. Used for biter/spitter nests.

properties.name: allow_run_time_change_of_is_military_target
properties.description: If this is true, this entities `is_military_target property` can be changed runtime (on the entity, not on the prototype itself).

properties.name: is_military_target
properties.description: Whether this prototype should be a high priority target for enemy forces. See [Military units and structures](https://wiki.factorio.com/Military_units_and_structures).

properties.name: max_count_of_owned_defensive_units
properties.description: Count of defensive enemies this spawner can sustain. Defensive units are units with [UnitAISettings::join_attacks](prototype:UnitAISettings::join_attacks) set to false. If set below [EnemySpawnerPrototype::max_count_of_owned_units](prototype:EnemySpawnerPrototype::max_count_of_owned_units), the difference will be the space reserved for non-defensive units.

properties.name: max_count_of_owned_units
properties.description: Count of enemies this spawner can sustain.

properties.name: max_defensive_friends_around_to_spawn
properties.description: How many friendly defensive units are required within the [EnemySpawnerPrototype::spawning_radius](prototype:EnemySpawnerPrototype::spawning_radius) of this spawner for it to stop producing more units. Defensive units are units with [UnitAISettings::join_attacks](prototype:UnitAISettings::join_attacks) set to false. If set below [EnemySpawnerPrototype::max_friends_around_to_spawn](prototype:EnemySpawnerPrototype::max_friends_around_to_spawn), the difference will be the space reserved for non-defensive units.

properties.name: max_friends_around_to_spawn
properties.description: How many friendly units are required within the [EnemySpawnerPrototype::spawning_radius](prototype:EnemySpawnerPrototype::spawning_radius) of this spawner for it to stop producing more units.

properties.name: max_richness_for_spawn_shift
properties.description: Max richness to determine spawn shift. Spawn shift is linear interpolation between 0 and max_spawn_shift.

properties.name: max_spawn_shift
properties.description: Caps how much richness can be added on top of evolution when spawning units. [See also](https://www.reddit.com/r/factorio/comments/8pjscm/friday_facts_246_the_gui_update_part_3/e0bttnp/)

properties.name: result_units
properties.description: Array of the [entities](prototype:EntityPrototype) that this spawner can spawn and their spawn probabilities. The sum of probabilities is expected to be 1.0. The array must not be empty.

properties.name: spawn_decoration
properties.description: Decoratives to be created when the spawner is created by the [map generator](https://wiki.factorio.com/Map_generator). Placed when enemies expand if `spawn_decorations_on_expansion` is set to true.

properties.name: spawn_decorations_on_expansion
properties.description: Whether `spawn_decoration` should be spawned when enemies [expand](https://wiki.factorio.com/Enemies#Expansions).

properties.name: spawning_cooldown
properties.description: Ticks for cooldown after unit is spawned. The first member of the tuple is min, the second member of the tuple is max.

properties.name: spawning_radius
properties.description: How far from the spawner can the units be spawned.

properties.name: spawning_spacing
properties.description: What spaces should be between the spawned units.

prototypes.name: EnergyShieldEquipmentPrototype
prototypes.description: Used by [energy shield](https://wiki.factorio.com/Energy_shield).

prototypes.name: EntityGhostPrototype
prototypes.description: The entity used for ghosts of entities. In-game, the inner entity (the entity this is a ghost of) is rendered with a [UtilityConstants::ghost_tint](prototype:UtilityConstants::ghost_tint).
examples:
```
{
  type = "entity-ghost",
  name = "entity-ghost",
  icon = "__core__/graphics/icons/mip/ghost-entity.png",
  icon_size = 64,
  build_sound = { { filename = "__core__/sound/build-ghost-small.ogg",  volume = 0.6 } },
  medium_build_sound = { { filename = "__core__/sound/build-ghost-medium.ogg",  volume = 0.7 } },
  large_build_sound = { { filename = "__core__/sound/build-ghost-large.ogg",  volume = 0.7 } },
  minable = { mining_time = 0, results = {} },
  mined_sound = { { filename = "__core__/sound/deconstruct-ghost.ogg",  volume = 0.4 } }
}
```

prototypes.name: EntityPrototype
prototypes.description:
Abstract base of all entities in the game. Entity is nearly everything that can be on the map (except tiles).

For in game script access to entity, take a look at [LuaEntity](runtime:LuaEntity).
examples:
```
{
  type = "container",
  name = "wooden-chest",
  icon = "__base__/graphics/icons/wooden-chest.png",
  flags = { "placeable-neutral", "player-creation" },
  minable = { mining_time = 1, result = "wooden-chest" },
  max_health = 100,
  corpse = "small-remnants",
  collision_box = { {-0.35, -0.35}, {0.35, 0.35} },
  fast_replaceable_group = "container",
  selection_box = { {-0.5, -0.5}, {0.5, 0.5} },
  inventory_size = 16,
  open_sound = { filename = "__base__/sound/wooden-chest-open.ogg" },
  close_sound = { filename = "__base__/sound/wooden-chest-close.ogg" },
  picture =
  {
    filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/wooden-chest/wooden-chest.png",
    priority = "extra-high",
    width = 46,
    height = 33,
    shift = {0.25, 0.015625}
  }
}
```

properties.name: additional_pastable_entities
properties.description:
Names of the entity prototypes this entity prototype can be pasted on to in addition to the standard supported types.

This is used to allow copying between types that aren't compatible on the C++ code side, by allowing mods to receive the [on_entity_settings_pasted](runtime:on_entity_settings_pasted) event for the given entity and do the setting pasting via script.

properties.name: autoplace
properties.description: Used to specify the rules for placing this entity during map generation.

properties.name: build_grid_size
properties.description:
Supported values are 1 (for 1x1 grid) and 2 (for 2x2 grid, like rails).

Internally forced to be `2` for [RailPrototype](prototype:RailPrototype), [RailRemnantsPrototype](prototype:RailRemnantsPrototype) and [TrainStopPrototype](prototype:TrainStopPrototype).

properties.name: collision_box
properties.description:
Specification of the entity collision boundaries. Empty collision box means no collision and is used for smoke, projectiles, particles, explosions etc.

The `{0,0}` coordinate in the collision box will match the entity position. It should be near the center of the collision box, to keep correct entity drawing order. The bounding box must include the `{0,0}` coordinate.

Note, that for buildings, it is customary to leave 0.1 wide border between the edge of the tile and the edge of the building, this lets the player move between the building and electric poles/inserters etc.

properties.name: collision_mask
properties.description: Defaults to the mask from [UtilityConstants::default_collision_masks](prototype:UtilityConstants::default_collision_masks) when indexed by the entity type.

properties.name: created_effect
properties.description: The effect/trigger that happens when the entity is placed.

properties.name: created_smoke
properties.description: The smoke that is shown when the entity is placed.

properties.name: deconstruction_alternative
properties.description: Used to merge multiple entities into one entry in the deconstruction planner.

properties.name: drawing_box_vertical_extension
properties.description: Specification of extra vertical space needed to see the whole entity in GUIs. This is used to calculate the correct zoom and positioning in the entity info gui, for example in the entity tooltip.

properties.name: emissions_per_second
properties.description: Amount of emissions created (positive number) or cleaned (negative number) every second by the entity. This is passive and currently used just for trees and fires. This is independent of the [emissions of energy sources](prototype:BaseEnergySource::emissions_per_minute) used by machines, which are created actively depending on the power consumption.

properties.name: fast_replaceable_group
properties.description:
This allows you to replace an entity that's already placed, with a different one in your inventory. For example, replacing a burner inserter with a fast inserter. The replacement entity can be a different rotation to the replaced entity and you can replace an entity with the same type.

This is simply a string, so any string can be used here. The entity that should be replaced simply has to use the same string here.

properties.name: hit_visualization_box
properties.description: Where beams should hit the entity. Useful if the bounding box only covers part of the entity (e.g. feet of the character) and beams only hitting there would look weird.

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Path to the icon file.

Either this or `icons` is mandatory for entities that have at least one of these flags active: `"placeable-neutral"`, `"placeable-player`", `"placeable-enemy"`.

Only loaded if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icon_draw_specification
properties.description: Used to specify where and how should be the alt-mode icons of entities should be drawn.

properties.name: icon_size
properties.description:
The size of the square icon, in pixels. E.g. `32` for a 32px by 32px icon. Must be larger than `0`.

Only loaded if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icons
properties.description:
This will be used in the electric network statistics, editor building selection, and the bonus gui. Can't be an empty array.

Either this or `icon` is mandatory for entities that have at least one of these flags active: `"placeable-neutral"`, `"placeable-player`", `"placeable-enemy"`.

properties.name: icons_positioning
impact_category
properties.description: Name of a [ImpactCategory](prototype:ImpactCategory).

properties.name: map_generator_bounding_box
properties.description: Used instead of the collision box during map generation. Allows space entities differently during map generation, for example if the box is bigger, the entities will be placed farther apart.

properties.name: minable
properties.description: The item given to the player when they mine the entity and other properties relevant to mining this entity.

properties.name: next_upgrade
properties.description:
Name of the entity that will be automatically selected as the upgrade of this entity when using the [upgrade planner](https://wiki.factorio.com/Upgrade_planner) without configuration.

This entity may not have "not-upgradable" flag set and must be minable. This entity mining result must not contain item product with "hidden" flag set. Mining results with no item products are allowed. This entity may not be a [RollingStockPrototype](prototype:RollingStockPrototype).

The upgrade target entity needs to have the same bounding box, collision mask, and fast replaceable group as this entity. The upgrade target entity must have least 1 item that builds it that isn't hidden.

properties.name: order
properties.description:
Used to order prototypes in inventory, recipes and GUIs. May not exceed a length of 200 characters.

The order string is taken from the items in `placeable_by` if they exist, or from an item that has its [place_result](prototype:ItemPrototype::place_result) set to this entity.

properties.name: placeable_by
properties.description:
Item that when placed creates this entity. Determines which item is picked when "Q" (smart pipette) is used on this entity. Determines which item and item amount is needed in a blueprint of this entity and to revive a ghost of this entity.

The item count specified here can't be larger than the stack size of that item.

properties.name: protected_from_tile_building
properties.description: When this is true, this entity prototype should be included during tile collision checks with tiles that have [TilePrototype::check_collision_with_entities](prototype:TilePrototype::check_collision_with_entities) set to true.

properties.name: remains_when_mined
properties.description: The entity that remains when this one is mined, deconstructed or fast-replaced. The entity wont actually be spawned if it would collide with the entity that is in the process of being mined.

properties.name: remove_decoratives
properties.description: Whether this entity should remove decoratives that collide with it when this entity is built. When set to "automatic", if the entity type is considered [a building](runtime:LuaEntityPrototype::is_building) (e.g. an assembling machine or a wall) it will remove decoratives.

properties.name: selection_box
properties.description:
Specification of the entity selection area. When empty the entity will have no selection area (and thus is not selectable).

The selection box is usually a little bit bigger than the collision box. For tileable entities (like buildings) it should match the tile size of the building.

properties.name: selection_priority
properties.description: The entity with the higher number is selectable before the entity with the lower number.

properties.name: shooting_cursor_size
properties.description: The cursor size used when shooting at this entity.

properties.name: sticker_box
properties.description: Used to set the area of the entity that can have stickers on it, currently only used for units to specify the area where the green slow down stickers can appear.

properties.name: tile_height
properties.default: calculated by the collision box height rounded up.

properties.name: tile_width
properties.description:
Used to determine how the center of the entity should be positioned when building (unless the off-grid [flag](prototype:EntityPrototypeFlags) is specified).

When the tile width is odd, the center will be in the center of the tile, when it is even, the center is on the tile transition.
