properties.default: calculated by the collision box width rounded up.

properties.name: trigger_target_mask
properties.description: Defaults to the mask from [UtilityConstants::default_trigger_target_mask_by_type](prototype:UtilityConstants::default_trigger_target_mask_by_type).

properties.name: water_reflection
properties.description:
May also be defined inside `graphics_set` instead of directly in the entity prototype. This is useful for entities that use a `graphics_set` property to define their graphics, because then all graphics can be defined in one place.

[Currently only renders](https://forums.factorio.com/100703) for [EntityWithHealthPrototype](prototype:EntityWithHealthPrototype) and [CorpsePrototype](prototype:CorpsePrototype).

properties.name: working_sound
properties.description: Will also work on entities that don't actually do work.

prototypes.name: EntityWithHealthPrototype
prototypes.description: Abstract base of all entities with health in the game.
examples:
```
{
  type = "container",
  name = "wooden-chest",
  icon = "__base__/graphics/icons/wooden-chest.png",
  flags = { "placeable-neutral", "player-creation" },
  minable = { mining_time = 1, result = "wooden-chest" },
  max_health = 100,
  corpse = "small-remnants",
  collision_box = { {-0.35, -0.35}, {0.35, 0.35} },
  fast_replaceable_group = "container",
  selection_box = { {-0.5, -0.5}, {0.5, 0.5} },
  inventory_size = 16,
  open_sound = { filename = "__base__/sound/wooden-chest-open.ogg" },
  close_sound = { filename = "__base__/sound/wooden-chest-close.ogg" },
  picture =
  {
    filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/wooden-chest/wooden-chest.png",
    priority = "extra-high",
    width = 46,
    height = 33,
    shift = {0.25, 0.015625}
  }
}
```

properties.name: corpse
properties.description: Specifies the names of the [CorpsePrototype](prototype:CorpsePrototype) to be used when this entity dies.

properties.name: dying_explosion
properties.description: The entities that are spawned in place of this one when it dies.

properties.name: healing_per_tick
properties.description: The amount of health automatically regenerated per tick. The entity must be active for this to work.

properties.name: hide_resistances
properties.description: Whether the resistances of this entity should be hidden in the entity tooltip.

properties.name: integration_patch
properties.description:
May also be defined inside `graphics_set` instead of directly in the entity prototype. This is useful for entities that use a `graphics_set` property to define their graphics, because then all graphics can be defined in one place.

Sprite drawn on ground under the entity to make it feel more integrated into the ground.

properties.name: integration_patch_render_layer
properties.description: May also be defined inside `graphics_set` instead of directly in the entity prototype. This is useful for entities that use a `graphics_set` property to define their graphics, because then all graphics can be defined in one place.

properties.name: loot
properties.description: The loot is dropped on the ground when the entity is killed.

properties.name: max_health
properties.description: The unit health can never go over the maximum. Default health of units on creation is set to max. Must be greater than 0.

properties.name: overkill_fraction
properties.description: Fraction of health by which predicted damage must be exceeded before entity is considered as "predicted to die" causing turrets (and others) to stop shooting more projectiles. If entity is healing it is better to keep larger margin to avoid cases where not enough projectiles goes towards a target and it heals causing it to survive all the incoming projectiles. If entity does not heal, margin may be reduced. Must be >= 0.

properties.name: repair_sound
properties.description: Played when this entity is repaired with a [RepairToolPrototype](prototype:RepairToolPrototype).

properties.name: repair_speed_modifier
properties.description: Multiplier of [RepairToolPrototype::speed](prototype:RepairToolPrototype::speed) for this entity prototype.

properties.name: resistances
properties.description: See [damage](https://wiki.factorio.com/Damage).

prototypes.name: EntityWithOwnerPrototype
prototypes.description: Abstract base of all entities with a force in the game. These entities have a [LuaEntity::unit_number](runtime:LuaEntity::unit_number) during runtime. Can be high priority [military targets](https://wiki.factorio.com/Military_units_and_structures).

properties.name: allow_run_time_change_of_is_military_target
properties.description: If this is true, this entity's `is_military_target` property can be changed during runtime (on the entity, not on the prototype itself).

properties.name: is_military_target
properties.description: Whether this prototype should be a high priority target for enemy forces. See [Military units and structures](https://wiki.factorio.com/Military_units_and_structures).

properties.name: quality_indicator_scale
properties.description: The default scale is based on the tile distance of the shorter dimension. Where size 3 results into scale 1. The default minimum is 0.5 and maximum 1.0.
properties.default: Calculated based on entity tile_width and height

properties.name: quality_indicator_shift
properties.description: The shift from the bottom left corner of the selection box.

prototypes.name: EquipArmorAchievementPrototype
prototypes.description: This prototype is used for receiving an achievement when the player equips armor.

properties.name: alternative_armor
properties.description: The achievement will trigger if this armor or the other armor is equipped.

properties.name: amount
properties.description: How many armors need to be equipped.

properties.name: armor
properties.description: The achievement will trigger if this armor or the alternative armor is equipped.

properties.name: limited_to_one_game
properties.description: If this is false, the player carries over their statistics from this achievement through all their saves.

prototypes.name: EquipmentCategory
prototypes.description: Defines a category to be available to [equipment](prototype:EquipmentPrototype) and [equipment grids](prototype:EquipmentGridPrototype).

prototypes.name: EquipmentGhostPrototype
prototypes.description: The equipment used for ghosts of equipment.

properties.name: categories
properties.description: Not loaded for equipment ghosts.

properties.name: energy_source
properties.description: Not loaded for equipment ghosts.

properties.name: shape
properties.description: Not loaded for equipment ghosts.

properties.name: take_result
properties.description: Not loaded for equipment ghosts.

prototypes.name: EquipmentGridPrototype
prototypes.description: The prototype of an equipment grid, for example the one used in a [power armor](https://wiki.factorio.com/Power_armor).

properties.name: equipment_categories
properties.description: Only [equipment](prototype:EquipmentPrototype) with at least one of these [categories](prototype:EquipmentCategory) can be inserted into the grid.

properties.name: locked
properties.description: Whether this locked from user interaction which means that the user cannot put equipment into or take equipment from this equipment grid.

prototypes.name: EquipmentPrototype
prototypes.description: Abstract base of all equipment modules. Equipment modules can be inserted into [equipment grids](prototype:EquipmentGridPrototype).

properties.name: background_border_color
properties.description: The color that the border of the background of this equipment should have when shown inside an equipment grid.

properties.name: background_color
properties.description: The color that the background of this equipment should have when shown inside an equipment grid.

properties.name: categories
properties.description: Sets the categories of the equipment. It can only be inserted into [grids](prototype:EquipmentGridPrototype::equipment_categories) with at least one matching category.

properties.name: grabbed_background_color
properties.description: The color that the background of this equipment should have when held in the players hand and hovering over an equipment grid.

properties.name: shape
properties.description: How big this equipment should be in the grid and whether it should be one solid rectangle or of a custom shape.

properties.name: sprite
properties.description: The graphics to use when this equipment is shown inside an equipment grid.

properties.name: take_result
properties.description: Name of the item prototype that should be returned to the player when they remove this equipment from an equipment grid.

prototypes.name: ExplosionPrototype
prototypes.description: Used to play an animation and a sound.

properties.name: delay
properties.description: Number of ticks to delay the explosion effects by.

properties.name: delay_deviation
properties.description: The maximum number of ticks to randomly delay the explosion effects by. In addition to the number of ticks defined by `delay`, the explosion will be delayed by a random number of ticks between 0 and `delay_deviation` (inclusive).

properties.name: explosion_effect
properties.description: The effect/trigger that happens when the explosion effect triggers after the initial delay as defined by `delay` and `delay_deviation`.

properties.name: light_intensity_factor_final
properties.description: Silently clamped to be between 0 and 1.

properties.name: light_intensity_factor_initial
properties.description: Silently clamped to be between 0 and 1.

properties.name: light_size_factor_final
properties.description: Silently clamped to be between 0 and 1.

properties.name: light_size_factor_initial
properties.description: Silently clamped to be between 0 and 1.

properties.name: smoke
properties.description: Mandatory if `smoke_count` > 0.

prototypes.name: FireFlamePrototype
prototypes.description: A fire.

properties.name: flame_alpha
properties.description: Only loaded if `uses_alternative_behavior` is false.

properties.name: flame_alpha_deviation
properties.description: Only loaded if `uses_alternative_behavior` is false.

properties.name: initial_flame_count
properties.description:
Spawns this many `secondary_pictures` around the entity when it first spawns. It waits `delay_between_initial_flames` between each spawned `secondary_pictures`. This can be used to make fires look less repetitive.

For example, spitters use this to make several smaller splashes around the main one.

properties.name: particle_alpha
properties.description: Only loaded if `uses_alternative_behavior` is true.

properties.name: particle_alpha_deviation
properties.description: Only loaded if `uses_alternative_behavior` is true.

properties.name: uses_alternative_behavior
properties.description:
If `false`, then all animations loop. If `true`, they run once and stay on the final frame. Also changes the behavior of several other fire properties as mentioned in their descriptions.

For example, spitters use alternate behavior, flamethrower flames don't.

prototypes.name: FishPrototype
prototypes.description: Entity that spawns in water tiles, which can be mined. Moves around unless deactivated with [LuaEntity::active](runtime:LuaEntity::active) = false.
examples:
```
{
  type = "fish",
  name = "fish",
  icon = "__base__/graphics/icons/fish.png",
  icon_size = 64,
  flags = { "placeable-neutral", "not-on-map" },
  minable = { mining_time = 1, result = "raw-fish", count = 5 },
  max_health = 20,
  subgroup = "creatures",
  order = "b-a",
  collision_box = { {-0.75, -0.75}, {0.75, 0.75} },
  selection_box = { {-0.5, -0.3}, {0.5, 0.3} },
  pictures =
  {
    {
      filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/fish/fish-1.png",
      priority = "extra-high",
      width = 22,
      height = 36
    },
    {
      filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/fish/fish-2.png",
      priority = "extra-high",
      width = 32,
      height = 32
    }
  },
  autoplace = { influence = 0.01 },
  protected_from_tile_building = false
}
```

prototypes.name: FluidPrototype
prototypes.description: A fluid.
examples:
```
{
  type = "fluid",
  name = "water",
  default_temperature = 15,
  max_temperature = 100,
  heat_capacity = "0.2kJ",
  base_color = { r = 0, g = 0.34, b = 0.6 },
  flow_color = { r = 0.7, g = 0.7, b = 0.7 },
  icon = "__base__/graphics/icons/fluid/water.png",
  icon_size = 64,
  order = "a[fluid]-a[water]"
}
```

properties.name: auto_barrel
properties.description:
Whether the fluid should be included in the barrel recipes automatically generated by the base mod.

This property is not read by the game engine itself, but the base mod's data-updates.lua file. This means it is discarded by the game engine after loading finishes.

properties.name: base_color
properties.description: Used by bars that show the fluid color, like the flamethrower turret fill bar in the tooltip, or the fill bar for the fluid wagon tooltip; and for the pipe windows and storage tank fill gauges.

properties.name: default_temperature
properties.description: Also the minimum temperature of the fluid. Has to be lower than `max_temperature`.

properties.name: emissions_multiplier
properties.description: Scales pollution generated when the fluid is consumed.

properties.name: flow_color
properties.description: Used only for pipe windows or storage tank fill gauges.

properties.name: gas_temperature
properties.description: Above this temperature the `gas_flow` animation is used to display the fluid inside storage tanks and pipes.

properties.name: heat_capacity
properties.description: Joule needed to heat 1 Unit by 1 C.

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Path to the icon file.

Mandatory if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icon_size
properties.description:
The size of the square icon, in pixels. E.g. `32` for a 32px by 32px icon. Must be larger than `0`.

Only loaded if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icons
properties.description: Can't be an empty array.

properties.name: visualization_color
properties.description:
Color to use for visualization. This color should be vibrant and easily distinguished.

If not specified, this will be auto-generated from `base_color` by converting to HSV, decreasing saturation by 10% and setting value to 80%.

prototypes.name: FluidStreamPrototype
prototypes.description: Used for example for the handheld flamethrower.

properties.name: action
properties.description: Action that is triggered every time a particle lands. Not triggered for the first particle if `initial_action` is non-empty.

properties.name: initial_action
properties.description: Action that is triggered when the first particle lands.

properties.name: particle_buffer_size
properties.description: Number of spawned child particles of the stream. Must be greater than 0 and less than 256.

properties.name: particle_fade_out_duration
properties.description: Will be set to 1 by the game if less than 1.

properties.name: particle_fade_out_threshold
properties.description: Value between 0 and 1.

properties.name: particle_horizontal_speed
properties.description: Must be larger than 0. `particle_horizontal_speed` has to be greater than `particle_horizontal_speed_deviation`.

properties.name: particle_loop_exit_threshold
properties.description: Value between 0 and 1.

properties.name: particle_loop_frame_count
properties.description: Will be set to 1 by the game if less than 1.

properties.name: particle_spawn_interval
properties.description: The stream will spawn one particle every `particle_spawn_interval` ticks until the `particle_spawn_timeout` is reached. The first particle will trigger an `initial_action` upon landing. Each particle triggers an `action` upon landing. Particles spawned within a single `particle_spawn_timeout` interval will be connected by a stretched `spine_animation`.

properties.name: progress_to_create_smoke
properties.description: The point in the particles projectile arc to start spawning smoke. 0.5 (the default) starts spawning smoke at the halfway point between the source and target.

properties.name: smoke_sources
properties.description: Smoke spawning is controlled by `progress_to_create_smoke`.

prototypes.name: FluidTurretPrototype
prototypes.description: A turret that uses [fluid](prototype:FluidPrototype) as ammunition.

properties.name: activation_buffer_ratio
properties.description: Before an turret that was out of fluid ammunition is able to fire again, the `fluid_buffer_size` must fill to this proportion.

properties.name: attack_parameters
properties.description: Requires ammo_type in attack_parameters.

properties.name: out_of_ammo_alert_icon
properties.description: The sprite will be drawn on top of fluid turrets that are out of fluid ammunition. If the `out_of_ammo_alert_icon` is not set, [UtilitySprites::fluid_icon](prototype:UtilitySprites::fluid_icon) will be used instead.

properties.name: turret_base_has_direction
properties.description: Always `true`, forcing the turret's collision box to be affected by its rotation.

prototypes.name: FluidWagonPrototype
prototypes.description: A [fluid wagon](https://wiki.factorio.com/Fluid_wagon).

properties.name: tank_count
properties.description: Must be 1, 2 or 3.

prototypes.name: FlyingRobotPrototype
prototypes.description: Abstract base for construction/logistics and combat robots.

properties.name: energy_per_move
properties.description:
How much energy does it cost to move 1 tile.

Used only by [robots with logistic interface](prototype:RobotWithLogisticInterfacePrototype).

properties.name: energy_per_tick
properties.description:
How much energy does it cost to fly for 1 tick.

Used only by [robots with logistic interface](prototype:RobotWithLogisticInterfacePrototype).

properties.name: is_military_target
properties.description: Whether this prototype should be a high priority target for enemy forces. See [Military units and structures](https://wiki.factorio.com/Military_units_and_structures).

properties.name: max_energy
properties.description:
How much energy can be stored in the batteries.

Used only by [robots with logistic interface](prototype:RobotWithLogisticInterfacePrototype).

properties.name: max_speed
properties.description: The maximum flying speed of the robot, including bonuses, in tiles/tick. Useful to limit the impact of [worker robot speed research](prototype:WorkerRobotSpeedModifier).

properties.name: max_to_charge
properties.description:
If the robot's battery fill ratio is more than this, it does not need to charge before stationing.

Used only by [robots with logistic interface](prototype:RobotWithLogisticInterfacePrototype).

properties.name: min_to_charge
properties.description:
The robot will go to charge when its battery fill ratio is less than this.

Used only by [robots with logistic interface](prototype:RobotWithLogisticInterfacePrototype).

properties.name: speed
properties.description: The flying speed of the robot, in tiles/tick.

properties.name: speed_multiplier_when_out_of_energy
properties.description:
Some robots simply crash, some slowdown but keep going. 0 means crash.

Used only by [robots with logistic interface](prototype:RobotWithLogisticInterfacePrototype).

prototypes.name: FontPrototype
prototypes.description: Fonts are used in all GUIs in the game.

properties.name: border
properties.description: Whether the font has a border.

properties.name: border_color
properties.description: The color of the border, if enabled.

properties.name: from
properties.description: The name of the fonts .ttf descriptor. This descriptor must be defined in the locale info.json. Refer to `data/core/locale/_language_/info.json` for examples.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the font.

properties.name: size
properties.description: Size of the font.

prototypes.name: FuelCategory
prototypes.description: Each item which has a fuel_value must have a fuel category. The fuel categories are used to allow only certain fuels to be used in [EnergySource](prototype:EnergySource).

prototypes.name: FurnacePrototype
prototypes.description: A furnace. Normal furnaces only process "smelting" category recipes, but you can make furnaces that process other [recipe categories](prototype:RecipeCategory). The difference to assembling machines is that furnaces automatically choose their recipe based on input.

properties.name: cant_insert_at_source_message_key
properties.description:
The locale key of the message shown when the player attempts to insert an item into the furnace that cannot be processed by that furnace. In-game, the locale is provided the `__1__` parameter, which is the localised name of the item.

The locale key is also used with an `_until` suffix for items that cannot be processed until they recipe is unlocked by a technology.

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

properties.name: custom_input_slot_tooltip_key
properties.description: The locale key of the tooltip to be shown in the input slot instead of the automatically generated list of items that fit there

properties.name: result_inventory_size
properties.description: The number of output slots.

properties.name: source_inventory_size
properties.description: The number of input slots, but not more than 1.

properties.name: energy_source
properties.description: `output_flow_limit` is mandatory and must be positive.

properties.name: input_fluid_box
properties.description: [filter](prototype:FluidBox::filter) is mandatory.

properties.name: max_fluid_usage
properties.description: Must be positive.

properties.name: output_fluid_box
properties.description: [filter](prototype:FluidBox::filter) is mandatory.

properties.name: perceived_performance
properties.description: Affects animation speed and working sound.

prototypes.name: FusionReactorPrototype
prototypes.description: Fusion reactor. Consumes fluid, fuel and additional energy to produce other fluid. Kind of advanced boiler. Can also have neighbour bonus.

properties.name: burner
properties.description: Second energy source for the process: provides fuel

properties.name: energy_source
properties.description: First energy source for the process: provides energy

properties.name: input_fluid_box
properties.description:
The input fluid box.

[filter](prototype:FluidBox::filter) is mandatory.

properties.name: max_fluid_usage
properties.description:
Maximum amount of fluid converted from `input_fluid_box` to `output_fluid_box` within a single tick.

Must be positive.

properties.name: neighbour_connectable
properties.description: Defines connection points to neighbours used to compute neighbour bonus.

properties.name: output_fluid_box
properties.description:
The output fluid box.

[filter](prototype:FluidBox::filter) is mandatory.

properties.name: perceived_performance
properties.description: Affects working sound.

properties.name: power_input
properties.description:
Power input consumed from first energy source at full performance.

Cannot be negative.

properties.name: target_temperature
properties.description: The temperature of the fluid to output. If not defined, the default temperature of the output fluid will be used.

properties.name: two_direction_only
properties.description: If set to true, only North and East direction will be buildable.

prototypes.name: GatePrototype
prototypes.description: A [gate](https://wiki.factorio.com/Gate).

properties.name: closing_sound
properties.description: Played when the gate closes.

properties.name: opened_collision_mask
properties.description:
This collision mask is used when the gate is open.

Defaults to the mask from [UtilityConstants::default_collision_masks](prototype:UtilityConstants::default_collision_masks) when indexed by `"gate/opened"`.

properties.name: opening_sound
properties.description: Played when the gate opens.

prototypes.name: GeneratorEquipmentPrototype
prototypes.description: Used by [portable fusion reactor](https://wiki.factorio.com/Portable_fusion_reactor). Provides power in equipment grids. Can produce power for free or use a burner energy source.

properties.name: burner
properties.description: If not defined, this equipment produces power for free.

properties.name: power
properties.description: The power output of this equipment.

prototypes.name: GeneratorPrototype
prototypes.description: An entity that produces power from fluids, for example a [steam engine](https://wiki.factorio.com/Steam_engine).

properties.name: burns_fluid
properties.description: If set to true, the available power output is based on the [FluidPrototype::fuel_value](prototype:FluidPrototype::fuel_value). Otherwise, the available power output will be based on the fluid temperature.

properties.name: destroy_non_fuel_fluid
properties.description:
This property is used when `burns_fluid` is true and the fluid has a [fuel_value](prototype:FluidPrototype::fuel_value) of 0.

This property is also used when `burns_fluid` is false and the fluid is at default temperature.

In these cases, this property determines whether the fluid should be destroyed, meaning that the fluid is consumed at the rate of `fluid_usage_per_tick`, without producing any power.

properties.name: effectivity
properties.description: How much energy the generator produces compared to how much energy it consumes. For example, an effectivity of 0.5 means that half of the consumed energy is output as power.

properties.name: fluid_box
properties.description: This must have a filter if `max_power_output` is not defined.

properties.name: fluid_usage_per_tick
properties.description: The number of fluid units the generator uses per tick.

properties.name: max_power_output
properties.description:
The power production of the generator is capped to this value. This is also the value that is shown as the maximum power output in the tooltip of the generator.

`fluid_box` must have a filter if this is not defined.

properties.name: maximum_temperature
properties.description:
The maximum temperature to which the efficiency can increase. At this temperature the generator will run at 100% efficiency. Note: Higher temperature fluid can still be consumed.

Used to calculate the `max_power_output` if it is not defined and `burns_fluid` is false. Then, the max power output is `(min(fluid_max_temp, maximum_temperature) - fluid_default_temp)  fluid_usage_per_tick  fluid_heat_capacity  effectivity`, the fluid is the filter specified on the `fluid_box`.

properties.name: perceived_performance
properties.description: Affects animation speed and working sound.

properties.name: scale_fluid_usage
properties.description:
Scales the generator's fluid usage to its maximum power output.

Setting this to true prevents the generator from overconsuming fluid, for example when higher than`maximum_temperature` fluid is fed to the generator.

If scale_fluid_usage is false, the generator consumes the full `fluid_usage_per_tick` and any of the extra energy in the fluid (in the form of higher temperature) is wasted. The [steam engine](https://wiki.factorio.com/Steam_engine) exhibits this behavior when fed steam from [heat exchangers](https://wiki.factorio.com/Heat_exchanger).

prototypes.name: GodControllerPrototype
prototypes.description: Properties of the god controller.

properties.name: crafting_categories
properties.description: Names of the crafting categories the player can craft recipes from.

properties.name: mining_categories
properties.description: Names of the resource categories the player can mine resources from.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the god-controller. Base game uses "default".

prototypes.name: GroupAttackAchievementPrototype
prototypes.description: This prototype is used for receiving an achievement when the player gets attacked due to pollution.

properties.name: amount
properties.description: This will trigger the achievement, if the player receives this amount of attacks. **Note**: The default achievement "it stinks and they don't like it" uses the amount of 1. (As in getting attacked once.)

properties.name: attack_type
properties.description: The type of attack that triggers this achievement. "autonomous" attacks are triggered in response to pollution or a territory disturbance. "distraction" attacks are in response to taking damage or seeing a nearby enemy. "scripted" attacks are triggered from mods.

properties.name: entities
properties.description: The achievement is only triggered if the attacking group of enemies contains at least one of the entities listed here.

prototypes.name: GuiStyle
prototypes.description: The available GUI styles.

custom_properties.description:
Styles are defined as uniquely named [StyleSpecification](prototype:StyleSpecification) properties of the prototype.

Styles with certain names are mandatory, as they are used by the base game GUI. A list is found below.
examples:
```
-- Adding a custom frame_style-type style
data.raw["gui-style"]["default"]["custom_style_for_a_frame"] =
{
  type = "frame_style",
  parent = "frame",
  use_header_filler = false,
  drag_by_title = false
}
```

prototypes.name: GunPrototype
prototypes.description: A gun. A weapon to deal damage to entities.

properties.name: attack_parameters
properties.description: The information the item needs to know in order to know what ammo it requires, the sounds, and range.

prototypes.name: HalfDiagonalRailPrototype
prototypes.description: A half diagonal rail.

properties.name: collision_box
properties.description: The [collision_box](prototype:EntityPrototype::collision_box) of straight rail is hardcoded to `{{-0.75, -1.9}, {0.75, 1.9}}`.

prototypes.name: HeatInterfacePrototype
prototypes.description: This entity produces or consumes heat. Its heat settings can be changed runtime.

prototypes.name: HeatPipePrototype
prototypes.description: A [heat pipe](https://wiki.factorio.com/Heat_pipe).

properties.name: heating_radius
properties.description: Must be >= 0.

prototypes.name: HighlightBoxEntityPrototype
prototypes.description:
Used to attach graphics for [cursor boxes](prototype:CursorBoxType) to entities during runtime. HighlightBoxEntity can also be independent from entities so it is simply drawn somewhere in the world. See [LuaSurface::create_entity](runtime:LuaSurface::create_entity) for the available options for type "highlight-box".

The [collision_box](prototype:EntityPrototype::collision_box) of the highlight box prototype is ignored during runtime, instead the "bounding_box" given in create_entity() or the selection box of the target entity is used.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the impact category.

prototypes.name: InfinityCargoWagonPrototype
prototypes.description: A cargo wagon that can spawn or void items at will.

properties.name: gui_mode
properties.description: Controls which players can control what the chest spawns.

properties.name: preserve_contents_when_created
properties.description: When true, items created inside the infinity cargo wagon will not start to spoil until they have been removed from the wagon.

prototypes.name: InfinityContainerPrototype
prototypes.description: A generic container, such as a chest, that can spawn or void items and interact with the logistics network.

properties.name: gui_mode
properties.description: Controls which players can control what the chest spawns.

properties.name: inventory_size
properties.description: The number of slots in this container. May not be zero.

properties.name: logistic_mode
properties.description: The way this chest interacts with the logistic network.

properties.name: preserve_contents_when_created
properties.description: When true, items created inside the infinity chest will not start to spoil until they have been removed from the chest.

properties.name: render_not_in_network_icon
properties.description: Whether the "no network" icon should be rendered on this entity if the entity is not within a logistics network.

prototypes.name: InfinityPipePrototype
prototypes.description: This entity produces or consumes fluids. Its fluid settings can be changed runtime.

prototypes.name: InserterPrototype
prototypes.description: An [inserter](https://wiki.factorio.com/Inserter).

properties.name: allow_burner_leech
properties.description: Whether this burner inserter can fuel itself from the fuel inventory of the entity it is picking up items from.

properties.name: allow_custom_vectors
properties.description: Whether pickup and insert position can be set run-time.

properties.name: bulk
properties.description: Whether this inserter is considered a bulk inserter. Relevant for determining how [inserter capacity bonus (research)](https://wiki.factorio.com/Inserter_capacity_bonus_(research)) applies to the inserter.

properties.name: chases_belt_items
properties.description: Whether the inserter hand should move to the items it picks up from belts, leading to item chasing behaviour. If this is off, the inserter hand will stay in the center of the belt and any items picked up from the edges of the belt "teleport" to the inserter hand.

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

properties.name: draw_held_item
properties.description: Whether the item that the inserter is holding should be drawn.

properties.name: draw_inserter_arrow
properties.description: Whether the yellow arrow that indicates the drop point of the inserter and the line that indicates the pickup position should be drawn.

properties.name: energy_source
properties.description: Defines how this inserter gets energy. The emissions set on the energy source are ignored so inserters cannot produce pollution.

properties.name: enter_drop_mode_if_held_stack_spoiled
properties.description: If inserter waits for full hand it could become stuck when item in hand changed because of spoiling. If this flag is set then inserter will start dropping held stack even if it was waiting for full hand.

properties.name: filter_count
properties.description: How many filters this inserter has. Maximum count of filtered items in inserter is 5.

properties.name: grab_less_to_match_belt_stack
properties.description: If drop target is belt, inserter may grab less so that it does not drop partial stacks unless it is forced to drop partial.

properties.name: hand_size
properties.description: Used to determine how long the arm of the inserter is when drawing it. Does not affect gameplay. The lower the value, the straighter the arm. Increasing the value will give the inserter a bigger bend due to its longer parts.

properties.name: max_belt_stack_size
properties.description: This inserter will not create stacks on belt with more than this amount of items. Must be >= 1.

properties.name: stack_size_bonus
properties.description: Stack size bonus that is inherent to the prototype without having to be researched.

properties.name: use_easter_egg
properties.description: Whether the inserter should be able to fish [fish](https://wiki.factorio.com/Raw_fish).

properties.name: wait_for_full_hand
properties.description: Inserter will wait until its hand is full.

prototypes.name: ItemEntityPrototype
prototypes.description: The entity used for items on the ground.

properties.name: collision_box
properties.description:
Item entity collision box has to have same width as height.

Specification of the entity collision boundaries. Empty collision box means no collision and is used for smoke, projectiles, particles, explosions etc.

The `{0,0}` coordinate in the collision box will match the entity position. It should be near the center of the collision box, to keep correct entity drawing order. The bounding box must include the `{0,0}` coordinate.

Note, that for buildings, it is customary to leave 0.1 wide border between the edge of the tile and the edge of the building, this lets the player move between the building and electric poles/inserters etc.

prototypes.name: ItemGroup
prototypes.description:
An item group. Item groups are the tabs shown above the list of craftable items in the player's inventory GUI. The built-in groups are "logistics", "production", "intermediate-products" and "combat" but mods can define their own.

Items are sorted into item groups by sorting them into a [subgroup](prototype:ItemPrototype::subgroup) which then belongs to an [item group](prototype:ItemSubGroup::group).

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Path to the icon that is shown to represent this item group.

Mandatory if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icon_size
properties.description:
The size of the square icon, in pixels. E.g. `32` for a 32px by 32px icon. Must be larger than `0`.

The base game uses 128px icons for item groups.

Only loaded if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icons
properties.description: The icon that is shown to represent this item group. Can't be an empty array.

properties.name: order_in_recipe
properties.description: Item ingredients in recipes are ordered by item group. The `order_in_recipe` property can be used to specify the ordering in recipes without affecting the inventory order.

prototypes.name: ItemPrototype
prototypes.description: Possible configuration for all items.

properties.name: auto_recycle
properties.description:
Whether the item should be included in the self-recycling recipes automatically generated by the quality mod.

This property is not read by the game engine itself, but the quality mod's data-updates.lua file. This means it is discarded by the game engine after loading finishes.

properties.name: burnt_result
properties.description: The item that is the result when this item gets burned as fuel.

properties.name: color_hint
properties.description: Only used by hidden setting, support may be limited.

properties.name: dark_background_icon
properties.description:
If this is set, it is used to show items in alt-mode instead of the normal item icon. This can be useful to increase the contrast of the icon with the dark alt-mode [icon outline](prototype:UtilityConstants::item_outline_color).

Path to the icon file.

Only loaded if `dark_background_icons` is not defined.

properties.name: dark_background_icon_size
properties.description:
The size of the square icon, in pixels. E.g. `32` for a 32px by 32px icon. Must be larger than `0`.

Only loaded if `dark_background_icons` is not defined.

properties.name: dark_background_icons
properties.description: Can't be an empty array.

properties.name: destroyed_by_dropping_trigger
properties.description:
The effect/trigger that happens when an item is destroyed by being dropped on a [TilePrototype](prototype:TilePrototype) marked as destroying dropped items.

This overrides the [TilePrototype::default_destroyed_dropped_item_trigger](prototype:TilePrototype::default_destroyed_dropped_item_trigger) from the tile.

properties.name: flags
properties.description: Specifies some properties of the item.

properties.name: fuel_acceleration_multiplier
properties.description: Must be 0 or positive.

properties.name: fuel_acceleration_multiplier_quality_bonus
properties.description:
Additional fuel acceleration multiplier per quality level. Defaults to 30% of `fuel_acceleration_multiplier - 1` if `fuel_acceleration_multiplier` is larger than 1. Otherwise defaults to 0.

Must be 0 or positive.

properties.name: fuel_category
properties.description: Must exist when a nonzero fuel_value is defined.

properties.name: fuel_glow_color
properties.description: Colors the glow of the burner energy source when this fuel is burned. Can also be used to color the glow of reactors burning the fuel, see [ReactorPrototype::use_fuel_glow_color](prototype:ReactorPrototype::use_fuel_glow_color).

properties.name: fuel_top_speed_multiplier
properties.description: Must be 0 or positive.

properties.name: fuel_top_speed_multiplier_quality_bonus
properties.description:
Additional fuel top speed multiplier per quality level. Defaults to 30% of `fuel_top_speed_multiplier - 1` if `fuel_top_speed_multiplier` is larger than 1. Otherwise defaults to 0.

Must be 0 or positive.

properties.name: fuel_value
properties.description:
Amount of energy the item gives when used as fuel.

Mandatory if `fuel_acceleration_multiplier`, `fuel_top_speed_multiplier` or `fuel_emissions_multiplier` or `fuel_glow_color` are used.

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Path to the icon file.

Mandatory if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icon_size
properties.description:
The size of the square icon, in pixels. E.g. `32` for a 32px by 32px icon. Must be larger than `0`.

Only loaded if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icons
properties.description: Can't be an empty array.

properties.name: moved_to_hub_when_building
properties.description: Whether this item should be moved to the hub when space platform performs building, upgrade or deconstruction and is left with this item. The following items are considered valuable and moved to hub by default: [Modules](prototype:ModulePrototype), [items that build entities](prototype:ItemPrototype::place_result), [items that build tiles](prototype:ItemPrototype::place_as_tile) and items [not obtainable from asteroid chunks](prototype:AsteroidChunkPrototype::minable) that have [subgroup](prototype:PrototypeBase::subgroup) from a [group](prototype:ItemSubGroup::group) other than `"intermediate-products"`.

properties.name: pictures
properties.description:
Used to give the item multiple different icons so that they look less uniform on belts. For inventory icons and similar, `icon/icons` will be used. Maximum number of variations is 16.

When using sprites of size `64` (same as base game icons), the `scale` should be set to 0.5.

properties.name: place_result
properties.description:
Name of the [EntityPrototype](prototype:EntityPrototype) that can be built using this item. If this item should be the one that construction bots use to build the specified `place_result`, set the `"primary-place-result"` [item flag](prototype:ItemPrototypeFlags).

The localised name of the entity will be used as the in-game item name. This behavior can be overwritten by specifying `localised_name` on this item, it will be used instead.

properties.name: random_tint_color
properties.description: Randomly tints item instances on belts and in the world. 0 no tinting. 1 full tint.

properties.name: send_to_orbit_mode
properties.description:
The way this item works when we try to send it to the orbit on its own.

When "manual" is set, it can only be launched by pressing the launch button in the rocket silo.

When "automated" is set, it will force the existence of "launch to orbit automatically" checkbox in the rocket silo which will then force the silo to automatically send the item to orbit when present.

properties.name: spoil_level
properties.description: Used by Inserters with spoil priority. Item with higher spoil level is considered more spoiled than item with lower spoil level regardless of progress of spoiling.

properties.name: stack_size
properties.description: Count of items of the same name that can be stored in one inventory slot. Must be 1 when the `"not-stackable"` flag is set.

properties.name: weight
properties.description:
The default weight is calculated automatically from recipes and falls back to [UtilityConstants::default_item_weight](prototype:UtilityConstants::default_item_weight).

More information on how item weight is determined can be found on its [auxiliary page](runtime:item-weight).

prototypes.name: ItemRequestProxyPrototype
prototypes.description: Entity used to signify that an entity is requesting items, for example modules for an assembling machine after it was blueprinted with modules inside.

prototypes.name: ItemSubGroup
prototypes.description:
An item subgroup. Item subgroups are the rows in the recipe list in the player's inventory GUI. The subgroup of a prototype also determines its item [group](prototype:ItemGroup::group) (tab in the recipe list).

The built-in subgroups can be found [here](https://wiki.factorio.com/Data.raw#item-subgroup). See [ItemPrototype::subgroup](prototype:ItemPrototype::subgroup) for setting the subgroup of an item.

properties.name: group
properties.description: The item group this subgroup is located in.

prototypes.name: ItemWithEntityDataPrototype
prototypes.description: ItemWithEntityData saves data associated with the entity that it represents, for example the content of the equipment grid of a car.

properties.name: icon_tintable
properties.description:
Path to the icon file.

Only loaded if `icon_tintables` is not defined.

properties.name: icon_tintable_mask
properties.description:
Path to the icon file.

Only loaded if `icon_tintable_masks` is not defined and `icon_tintable` is defined.

properties.name: icon_tintable_mask_size
properties.description:
The size of the square icon, in pixels. E.g. `32` for a 32px by 32px icon. Must be larger than `0`.

Only loaded if `icon_tintable_masks` is not defined and `icon_tintable` is defined.

properties.name: icon_tintable_masks
properties.description:
Can't be an empty array.

Only loaded if `icon_tintable` is defined.

properties.name: icon_tintable_size
properties.description:
The size of the square icon, in pixels. E.g. `32` for a 32px by 32px icon. Must be larger than `0`.

Only loaded if `icon_tintables` is not defined and `icon_tintable` is defined.

properties.name: icon_tintables
properties.description:
Can't be an empty array.

Only loaded if `icon_tintable` is defined (`icon_tintables` takes precedence over `icon_tintable`).

prototypes.name: ItemWithInventoryPrototype
prototypes.description: The inventory allows setting player defined filters similar to cargo wagon inventories.

properties.name: filter_message_key
properties.description: The locale key used when the player attempts to put an item that doesn't match the filter rules into the item-with-inventory.

properties.name: filter_mode
properties.description: This determines how filters are applied. If no filters are defined this is automatically set to "none".

properties.name: inventory_size
properties.description: The inventory size of the item.

properties.name: item_filters
properties.description: A list of explicit item names to be used as filters.

properties.name: item_group_filters
properties.description: A list of explicit item group names to be used as filters.

properties.name: item_subgroup_filters
properties.description: A list of explicit [item subgroup](prototype:ItemSubGroup) names to be used as filters.

properties.name: stack_size
properties.description: Count of items of the same name that can be stored in one inventory slot. Must be 1 when the `"not-stackable"` flag is set.

prototypes.name: ItemWithLabelPrototype
prototypes.description: Like a normal item but with the ability to have a colored label.

properties.name: default_label_color
properties.description: The default label color the item will use.

properties.name: draw_label_for_cursor_render
properties.description: If the item will draw its label when held in the cursor in place of the item count.

prototypes.name: ItemWithTagsPrototype
prototypes.description: Item type that can store any basic arbitrary Lua data, see [LuaItemStack::tags](runtime:LuaItemStack::tags).

prototypes.name: KillAchievementPrototype
prototypes.description: This prototype is used for receiving an achievement when the player destroys a certain amount of an entity, with a specific damage type.

properties.name: amount
properties.description: This is the amount of entity of the specified type the player needs to destroy to receive the achievement.

properties.name: damage_dealer
properties.description: The killer of the entity must be one of these entities.

properties.name: damage_type
properties.description: This defines how the player needs to destroy the specific entity.

properties.name: in_vehicle
properties.description: This defines if the player needs to be in a vehicle.

properties.name: personally
properties.description: This defines to make sure you are the one driving, for instance, in a tank rather than an automated train.

properties.name: to_kill
properties.description: This defines which entity needs to be destroyed in order to receive the achievement.

properties.name: type_to_kill
properties.description: This defines what entity type needs to be destroyed in order to receive the achievement.

prototypes.name: LabPrototype
prototypes.description: A [lab](https://wiki.factorio.com/Lab). It consumes [science packs](prototype:ToolPrototype) to research [technologies](prototype:TechnologyPrototype).

properties.name: allowed_effects
properties.description: Sets the [modules](prototype:ModulePrototype) and [beacon](prototype:BeaconPrototype) effects that are allowed to be used on this lab.
properties.default: All effects except quality are allowed

properties.name: allowed_module_categories
properties.description: Sets the [module categories](prototype:ModuleCategory) that are allowed to be inserted into this machine.

properties.name: energy_source
properties.description: Defines how this lab gets energy.

properties.name: energy_usage
properties.description: The amount of energy this lab uses.

properties.name: inputs
properties.description:
A list of the names of science packs that can be used in this lab.

If a technology requires other types of science packs, it cannot be researched in this lab.

properties.name: module_slots
properties.description: The number of module slots in this lab.

properties.name: off_animation
properties.description: The animation that plays when the lab is idle.

properties.name: on_animation
properties.description: The animation that plays when the lab is active.

properties.name: science_pack_drain_rate_percent
properties.description: May not be `0` or larger than `100`.

properties.name: uses_quality_drain_modifier
properties.description: Whether the [QualityPrototype::science_pack_drain_multiplier](prototype:QualityPrototype::science_pack_drain_multiplier) of the quality of the science pack should be considered by the lab.

prototypes.name: LampPrototype
prototypes.description: A [lamp](https://wiki.factorio.com/Lamp) to provide light, using energy.
examples:
```
{
  type = "lamp",
  name = "small-lamp",
  icon = "__base__/graphics/icons/small-lamp.png",
  icon_size = 64,
  flags = {"placeable-neutral", "player-creation"},
  minable = {mining_time = 0.1, result = "small-lamp"},
  max_health = 100,
  corpse = "lamp-remnants",
  dying_explosion = "lamp-explosion",
  collision_box = {{-0.15, -0.15}, {0.15, 0.15}},
  selection_box = {{-0.5, -0.5}, {0.5, 0.5}},
  energy_source =
  {
    type = "electric",
    usage_priority = "lamp"
  },
  energy_usage_per_tick = "5kW",
  darkness_for_all_lamps_on = 0.5,
  darkness_for_all_lamps_off = 0.3,
  light = {intensity = 0.9, size = 40, color = {r=1.0, g=1.0, b=0.75}},
  light_when_colored = {intensity = 0, size = 6, color = {r=1.0, g=1.0, b=0.75}},
  glow_size = 6,
  glow_color_intensity = 1,
  glow_render_mode = "multiplicative",
  picture_off =
  {
    layers =
    {
      {
        filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/small-lamp/lamp.png",
        priority = "high",
        width = 42,
        height = 36,
        frame_count = 1,
        axially_symmetrical = false,
        direction_count = 1,
        shift = util.by_pixel(0,3)
      },
      {
        filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/small-lamp/lamp-shadow.png",
        priority = "high",
        width = 38,
        height = 24,
        frame_count = 1,
        axially_symmetrical = false,
        direction_count = 1,
        shift = util.by_pixel(4,5),
        draw_as_shadow = true
      }
    }
  },
  picture_on =
  {
    filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/small-lamp/lamp-light.png",
    priority = "high",
    width = 46,
    height = 40,
    frame_count = 1,
    axially_symmetrical = false,
    direction_count = 1,
    shift = util.by_pixel(0, -7)
  },
  signal_to_color_mapping =
  {
    {type = "virtual", name = "signal-red",    color = {r = 1, g = 0, b = 0}},
    {type = "virtual", name = "signal-green",  color = {r = 0, g = 1, b = 0}},
    {type = "virtual", name = "signal-blue",   color = {r = 0, g = 0, b = 1}},
    {type = "virtual", name = "signal-yellow", color = {r = 1, g = 1, b = 0}},
    {type = "virtual", name = "signal-pink",   color = {r = 1, g = 0, b = 1}},
    {type = "virtual", name = "signal-cyan",   color = {r = 0, g = 1, b = 1}},
    {type = "virtual", name = "signal-white",  color = {r = 1, g = 1, b = 1}}
  },

  circuit_connector = circuit_connector_definitions["lamp"],
  circuit_wire_max_distance = default_circuit_wire_max_distance
}
```

properties.name: always_on
properties.description: Whether the lamp should always be on.

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

properties.name: darkness_for_all_lamps_off
properties.description: darkness_for_all_lamps_on must be > darkness_for_all_lamps_off. Values must be between 0 and 1.

properties.name: darkness_for_all_lamps_on
properties.description: darkness_for_all_lamps_on must be > darkness_for_all_lamps_off. Values must be between 0 and 1.

properties.name: energy_source
properties.description: The emissions set on the energy source are ignored so lamps cannot produce pollution.

properties.name: energy_usage_per_tick
properties.description: The amount of energy the lamp uses. Must be greater than > 0.

properties.name: light
properties.description: What color the lamp will be when it is on, and receiving power.

properties.name: light_when_colored
properties.description: This refers to when the light is in a circuit network, and is lit a certain color based on a signal value.

properties.name: picture_off
properties.description: The lamps graphics when it's off.

properties.name: picture_on
properties.description: The lamps graphics when it's on.

prototypes.name: LandMinePrototype
prototypes.description: A [land mine](https://wiki.factorio.com/Land_mine).

properties.name: force_die_on_attack
properties.description: Force the landmine to kill itself when exploding.

properties.name: is_military_target
properties.description: Whether this prototype should be a high priority target for enemy forces. See [Military units and structures](https://wiki.factorio.com/Military_units_and_structures).

properties.name: picture_safe
properties.description: The sprite of the landmine before it is armed (just after placing).

properties.name: picture_set
properties.description: The sprite of the landmine of a friendly force when it is armed.

properties.name: picture_set_enemy
properties.description: The sprite of the landmine of an enemy force when it is armed.

properties.name: timeout
properties.description: Time between placing and the landmine being armed, in ticks.

properties.name: trigger_collision_mask
properties.description: Collision mask that another entity must collide with to make this landmine blow up.

properties.name: trigger_interval
properties.description: Time between checks to detonate due to nearby enemies. A larger time will be more performant.

prototypes.name: LegacyCurvedRailPrototype
prototypes.description: A legacy curved rail.

properties.name: collision_box
properties.description:
The [collision_box](prototype:EntityPrototype::collision_box) of legacy curved rail is hardcoded to `{{-0.75, -0.55}, {0.75, 1.6}}`.

The secondary collision box of legacy curved rail is hardcoded to `{{-0.68, -2.7}, {0.68, 2.7}}`.

prototypes.name: LegacyStraightRailPrototype
prototypes.description: A legacy straight rail.

properties.name: collision_box
properties.description: The [collision_box](prototype:EntityPrototype::collision_box) of legacy straight rail is hardcoded to `{{-0.7, -0.99}, {0.7, 0.99}}`.

properties.name: efficiency
properties.description: Cannot be less than 0.

properties.name: energy_source
properties.description: Mandatory if `efficiency` is larger than 0. May not be defined if `efficiency` is 0.

properties.name: time_to_damage
properties.description: Must be less than or equal to `effect_duration`.

prototypes.name: LinkedBeltPrototype
prototypes.description: A belt that can be connected to a belt anywhere else, including on a different surface. The linked belts have to be [connected with console commands](https://wiki.factorio.com/Console#Connect_linked_belts) or runtime scripting in mods or scenarios. [LuaEntity::connect_linked_belts](runtime:LuaEntity::connect_linked_belts) and other runtime functions.

prototypes.name: LinkedContainerPrototype
prototypes.description: A container that shares its inventory with containers with the same [link_id](runtime:LuaEntity::link_id), which can be set via the GUI. The link IDs are per prototype and force, so only containers with the **same ID**, **same prototype name** and **same force** will share inventories.

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this linked container.

properties.name: gui_mode
properties.description: Players that can access the GUI to change the link ID.

properties.name: inventory_size
properties.description: Must be > 0.

properties.name: inventory_type
properties.description: Whether the inventory of this container can be filtered (like cargo wagons) or not.

prototypes.name: Loader1x1Prototype
prototypes.description:
Continuously loads and unloads machines, as an alternative to inserters.

This loader type is identical to [Loader1x2Prototype](prototype:Loader1x2Prototype) with the exception of its hardcoded belt_distance. The belt_distance of the loader determines the distance between the position of this loader and the tile of the loader's belt target.

This loader type always has a belt_distance of 0, meaning by default it is 1 tile long in total. For a loader type with a belt_distance of 0.5, see [Loader1x2Prototype](prototype:Loader1x2Prototype).

prototypes.name: Loader1x2Prototype
prototypes.description:
Continuously loads and unloads machines, as an alternative to inserters.

This loader type is identical to [Loader1x1Prototype](prototype:Loader1x1Prototype) with the exception of its hardcoded belt_distance. The belt_distance of the loader determines the distance between the position of this loader and the tile of the loader's belt target.

This loader type always has a belt_distance of 0.5, meaning by default it is 2 tiles long in total. For a loader type with a belt_distance of 0, see [Loader1x1Prototype](prototype:Loader1x1Prototype).

prototypes.name: LoaderPrototype
prototypes.description: Continuously loads and unloads machines, as an alternative to inserters.

properties.name: adjustable_belt_stack_size
properties.description: Loader belt stack size can be adjusted at runtime. Requires [LoaderPrototype::max_belt_stack_size](prototype:LoaderPrototype::max_belt_stack_size) to be > 1.

properties.name: allow_container_interaction
properties.description: Whether this loader can load and unload stationary inventories such as containers and crafting machines.

properties.name: allow_rail_interaction
properties.description: Whether this loader can load and unload [RollingStockPrototype](prototype:RollingStockPrototype).

properties.name: belt_length
properties.description: How long this loader's belt is. Should be the same as belt_distance, which is hardcoded to `0.5` for [Loader1x2Prototype](prototype:Loader1x2Prototype) and to 0 for [Loader1x1Prototype](prototype:Loader1x1Prototype). See the linked prototypes for an explanation of belt_distance.

properties.name: circuit_connector
properties.description: First the four cardinal directions for `direction_out`, followed by the four directions for `direction_in`.

properties.name: circuit_connector_layer
properties.description: Render layer for all directions of the circuit connectors.

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

properties.name: container_distance
properties.description: The distance between the position of this loader and the tile of the loader's container target.

properties.name: energy_per_item
properties.description: Energy in Joules. Can't be negative.

properties.name: filter_count
properties.description: How many item filters this loader has. Maximum count of filtered items in loader is 5.

properties.name: max_belt_stack_size
properties.description: Loader will not create stacks on belt that are larger than this value. Must be >= 1.

properties.name: per_lane_filters
properties.description: If filters are per lane. Can only be set to true if filter_count is equal to 2.

prototypes.name: LocomotivePrototype
prototypes.description: A [locomotive](https://wiki.factorio.com/Locomotive).

properties.name: max_snap_to_train_stop_distance
properties.description: In tiles. A locomotive will snap to a nearby train stop when the player places it within this distance to the stop.

prototypes.name: LogisticContainerPrototype
prototypes.description: A generic container, such as a chest, that interacts with the logistics network.

properties.name: animation
properties.description: Drawn when a robot brings/takes items from this container.

properties.name: animation_sound
properties.description: Played when a robot brings/takes items from this container. Ignored if `animation` is not defined.

properties.name: landing_location_offset
properties.description: The offset from the center of this container where a robot visually brings/takes items.

properties.name: logistic_mode

prototypes.name: MiningDrillPrototype
prototypes.description: A mining drill for automatically extracting resources from [resource entities](prototype:ResourceEntityPrototype). This prototype type is used by [burner mining drill](https://wiki.factorio.com/Burner_mining_drill), [electric mining drill](https://wiki.factorio.com/Electric_mining_drill) and [pumpjack](https://wiki.factorio.com/Pumpjack) in vanilla.

properties.name: allowed_effects
properties.description: Sets the [modules](prototype:ModulePrototype) and [beacon](prototype:BeaconPrototype) effects that are allowed to be used on this mining drill.

properties.name: allowed_module_categories
properties.description: Sets the [module categories](prototype:ModuleCategory) that are allowed to be inserted into this machine.

properties.name: base_picture
properties.description: Used by the [pumpjack](https://wiki.factorio.com/Pumpjack) to have a static 4 way sprite.

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

properties.name: energy_source
properties.description: The energy source of this mining drill.

properties.name: energy_usage
properties.description: The amount of energy used by the drill while mining. Can't be less than or equal to 0.

properties.name: filter_count
properties.description: How many filters this mining drill has. Maximum count of filtered resources in a mining drill is 5.

properties.name: mining_speed
properties.description: The speed of this drill.

properties.name: module_slots
properties.description: The number of module slots in this machine.

properties.name: monitor_visualization_tint
properties.description: When this mining drill is connected to the circuit network, the resource that it is reading (either the entire resource patch, or the resource in the mining area of the drill, depending on circuit network setting), is tinted in this color when mousing over the mining drill.

properties.name: perceived_performance
properties.description: Affects animation speed.

properties.name: radius_visualisation_picture
properties.description: The sprite used to show the range of the mining drill.

properties.name: resource_categories
properties.description:
The names of the [ResourceCategory](prototype:ResourceCategory) that can be mined by this drill. For a list of built-in categories, see [here](https://wiki.factorio.com/Data.raw#resource-category).

Note: Categories containing resources which produce items, fluids, or items+fluids may be combined on the same entity, but may not work as expected. Examples: Miner does not rotate fluid-resulting resources until depletion. Fluid isn't output (fluid resource change and fluidbox matches previous fluid). Miner with no `vector_to_place_result` can't output an item result and halts.

properties.name: resource_drain_rate_percent
properties.description: May not be `0` or larger than `100`.

properties.name: resource_searching_radius
properties.description:
The distance from the centre of the mining drill to search for resources in.

This is 2.49 for electric mining drills (a 5x5 area) and 0.99 for burner mining drills (a 2x2 area). The drill searches resource outside its natural boundary box, which is 0.01 (the middle of the entity); making it 2.5 and 1.0 gives it another block radius.

properties.name: vector_to_place_result
properties.description: The position where any item results are placed, when the mining drill is facing north (default direction). If the drill does not produce any solid items but uses a fluidbox output instead (e.g. pumpjacks), a vector of `{0,0}` disables the yellow arrow alt-mode indicator for the placed item location.

properties.name: effect

properties.name: tier

properties.name: movement_bonus

prototypes.name: NamedNoiseExpression
prototypes.description:
A [NoiseExpression](prototype:NoiseExpression) with a name. The base game uses named noise expressions to specify functions for many map properties to be used in map generation; e.g. the "elevation" expression is used to calculate elevation for every point on a map. For a list of the built-in named noise expressions, see [data.raw](https://wiki.factorio.com/Data.raw#noise-expression).

Named noise expressions can be used by [MapGenSettings](prototype:MapGenSettings) and [MapGenPreset](prototype:MapGenPreset) to override which named expression is used to calculate a given property by having an entry in `property_expression_names`, e.g. `elevation = "elevation_island"`.

Alternate expressions can be made available in the map generator GUI by setting their `intended_property` to the name of the property they should override.

Named noise expressions can also be used as [noise variables](runtime:noise-expressions) e.g. `var("my-noise-expression")`.
examples:
```
{
  type = "noise-expression",
  name = "distance",
  expression = "distance_from_nearest_point{x = x, y = y, points = starting_positions}"
}
```

properties.name: expression
properties.description: The noise expression itself. This is where most of the noise magic happens.

properties.name: intended_property
properties.description:
Names the property that this expression is intended to provide a value for, if any. This will make the expression show up as an option in the map generator GUI, unless it is the only expression with that intended property, in which case it will be hidden and selected by default.

For example if a noise expression is intended to be used as an alternative temperature generator, `intended_property` should be "temperature".

properties.name: local_expressions
properties.description:
A map of expression name to expression.

Local expressions are meant to store data locally similar to local variables in Lua. Their purpose is to hold noise expressions used multiple times in the named noise expression, or just to tell the reader that the local expression has a specific purpose. Local expressions can access other local definitions, but recursive definitions aren't supported.

properties.name: local_functions
properties.description:
A map of function name to function.

Local functions serve the same purpose as local expressions - they aren't visible outside of the specific prototype and they have access to other local definitions.

properties.name: order
properties.description:
Used to order alternative expressions in the map generator GUI. For a given property (e.g. 'temperature'), the NamedNoiseExpression with that property's name as its `intended_property` with the lowest order will be chosen as the default in the GUI.

If no order is specified, it defaults to "2000" if the property name matches the expression name (making it the 'technical default' generator for the property if none is specified in MapGenSettings), or "3000" otherwise. A generator defined with an order less than "2000" but with a unique name can thereby override the default generator used when creating a new map through the GUI without automatically overriding the 'technical default' generator, which is probably used by existing maps.

prototypes.name: NamedNoiseFunction
prototypes.description:
Named noise functions are defined in the same way as [NamedNoiseExpression](prototype:NamedNoiseExpression) except that they also have parameters.

Named noise functions are available to be used in [NoiseExpressions](prototype:NoiseExpression).
examples:
```
{
  type = "noise-function",
  name = "random_between",
  parameters = {"from", "to"},
  expression = "random_penalty{x = x, y = y, source = to, amplitude = to - from}"
}
```

properties.name: local_expressions
properties.description:
A map of expression name to expression.

Local expressions are meant to store data locally similar to local variables in Lua. Their purpose is to hold noise expressions used multiple times in the named noise expression, or just to tell the reader that the local expression has a specific purpose. Local expressions can access other local definitions and also function parameters, but recursive definitions aren't supported.

properties.name: local_functions
properties.description:
A map of function name to function.

Local functions serve the same purpose as local expressions - they aren't visible outside of the specific prototype and they have access to other local definitions.

properties.name: parameters
properties.description:
The order of the parameters matters because functions can also be called with positional arguments.

A function can't have more than 255 parameters.

properties.name: darkness_to_turn_on

properties.name: energy_source

Defines how the offshore pump is powered.

When using an electric energy source and `drain` is not specified, it will be set to `energy_usage  30` automatically.

properties.name: energy_usage
properties.description: Sets how much energy this offshore pump consumes. Energy usage has to be positive.

properties.name: perceived_performance
properties.description: Affects animation speed.

properties.name: pumping_speed
properties.description: How many units of fluid are produced per tick. Must be > 0.

prototypes.name: ParticlePrototype
prototypes.description: An entity with a limited lifetime that can use trigger effects.

properties.name: fade_away_duration

properties.name: pictures

properties.name: shadows

properties.name: vertical_acceleration

prototypes.name: ParticleSourcePrototype

properties.name: particle

properties.name: smoke

properties.name: fluid_box

properties.name: limited_to_one_game
properties.description: If this is false, the player carries over their statistics from this achievement through all their saves.

properties.name: growth_ticks
properties.description: Must be positive.

properties.name: harvest_emissions
properties.description: The burst of pollution to emit when the plant is harvested.

prototypes.name: PlayerDamagedAchievementPrototype
prototypes.description: This prototype is used for receiving an achievement when the player receives damage.

properties.name: minimum_damage
properties.description: This will trigger the achievement, if the amount of damage taken by the dealer, is more than this.

properties.name: should_survive
properties.description: This sets the achievement to only trigger, if you survive the minimum amount of damage. If you don't need to survive, false.

properties.name: type_of_dealer
properties.description: This will trigger the achievement, if the player takes damage from this specific entity type.

prototypes.name: PlayerPortPrototype
prototypes.description: Deprecated in 2.0.

prototypes.name: PowerSwitchPrototype
prototypes.description: A [power switch](https://wiki.factorio.com/Power_switch).

prototypes.name: ProcessionLayerInheritanceGroup
prototypes.description: Helps [ProcessionLayers](prototype:ProcessionLayer) pass properties between subsequent transitions if they belong to the same group.

prototypes.name: ProcessionPrototype
prototypes.description: Describes the duration and visuals of a departure, arrival or an intermezzo while traveling between surfaces. Usually provided inside of a [ProcessionSet](prototype:ProcessionSet).

properties.name: ground_timeline
properties.description: Used alternatively when landing to ground.

properties.name: procession_style
properties.description: Indexes used to match transitions from different surfaces together. Only a single intermezzo of a given procession_style may exist.
examples:
```
Going from Surface A -> Surface B
Surface A has departures: [1, 3, 4]
Surface B has arrivals:   [2, 3, 5]
This trip will select:
Departure 3 -> (Intermezzo 3) -> Arrival 3
```

properties.name: timeline
properties.description: Used when leaving or arriving to a station.

properties.name: usage
properties.description: Arrival and Departure are to be referenced by name. All intermezzos are collected during loading and filled in by `procession_style`.

prototypes.name: ProduceAchievementPrototype
prototypes.description: This prototype is used for receiving an achievement when the player produces more than the specified amount of items.

properties.description:
Mandatory if `item_product` is not defined.

This will tell the achievement what fluid the player needs to craft, to get the achievement.

properties.name: item_product
properties.description:
Mandatory if `fluid_product` is not defined.

This will tell the achievement what item the player needs to craft, to get the achievement.

properties.name: limited_to_one_game
properties.description: If this is false, the player carries over their statistics from this achievement through all their saves.

prototypes.name: ProducePerHourAchievementPrototype
