properties.name: fluid_product
properties.description:
Mandatory if `item_product` is not defined.

This will tell the achievement what fluid the player needs to craft, to get the achievement.

properties.name: item_product
properties.description:
Mandatory if `fluid_product` is not defined.

This will tell the achievement what item the player needs to craft, to get the achievement.

prototypes.name: ProgrammableSpeakerPrototype
prototypes.description: A [programmable speaker](https://wiki.factorio.com/Programmable_speaker).

prototypes.name: ProjectilePrototype
prototypes.description: Entity with limited lifetime that can hit other entities and has triggers when this happens.

properties.name: acceleration
properties.description: Must be != 0 if `turning_speed_increases_exponentially_with_projectile_speed` is true.

properties.name: action
properties.description: Executed when the projectile hits something.

properties.name: direction_only
properties.description: Setting this to true can be used to disable projectile homing behaviour.

properties.name: final_action
properties.description: Executed when the projectile hits something, after `action` and only if the entity that was hit was destroyed. The projectile is destroyed right after the final_action.

properties.name: hit_at_collision_position
properties.description: When true the entity is hit at the position on its collision box the projectile first collides with. When false the entity is hit at its own position.

properties.name: hit_collision_mask
properties.description: Defaults to the mask from [UtilityConstants::default_collision_masks](prototype:UtilityConstants::default_collision_masks) when indexed by `"projectile/hit"`.

properties.name: max_speed
properties.description: Must be greater than or equal to 0.

properties.name: piercing_damage
properties.description: Whenever an entity is hit by the projectile, this number gets reduced by the health of the entity. If the number is then below 0, the `final_action` is applied and the projectile destroyed. Otherwise, the projectile simply continues to its destination.

properties.name: rotatable
properties.description: Whether the animation of the projectile is rotated to match the direction of travel.

properties.name: turn_speed
properties.description: Must be greater than or equal to 0.

properties.name: factoriopedia_alternative
properties.description:
The ID type corresponding to the prototype that inherits from this.

For example, if this is an [EntityPrototype](prototype:EntityPrototype), this property's type is [EntityID](prototype:EntityID).

prototypes.name: PrototypeBase
prototypes.description: The abstract base for prototypes. PrototypeBase defines the common features of prototypes, such as localization and order.

properties.name: factoriopedia_description
properties.description: Provides additional description used in factoriopedia.

properties.name: factoriopedia_simulation
properties.description: The simulation shown when looking at this prototype in the Factoriopedia GUI.

properties.name: localised_description
properties.description: Overwrites the description set in the [locale file](https://wiki.factorio.com/Tutorial:Localisation). The description is usually shown in the tooltip of the prototype.

properties.name: localised_name
properties.description: Overwrites the name set in the [locale file](https://wiki.factorio.com/Tutorial:Localisation). Can be used to easily set a procedurally-generated name because the LocalisedString format allows to insert parameters into the name directly from the Lua script.

properties.name: name
properties.description:
Unique textual identification of the prototype. May only contain alphanumeric characters, dashes and underscores. May not exceed a length of 200 characters.

For a list of all names used in vanilla, see [data.raw](https://wiki.factorio.com/Data.raw).

properties.name: order
properties.description: Used to order prototypes in inventory, recipes and GUIs. May not exceed a length of 200 characters.

properties.name: parameter
properties.description: Whether the prototype is a special type which can be used to parametrize blueprints and doesn't have other function.

properties.name: subgroup
properties.description: The name of an [ItemSubGroup](prototype:ItemSubGroup).

properties.name: type
properties.description:
Specifies the kind of prototype this is.

For a list of all possible types, see the [prototype overview](prototype:prototypes).

prototypes.name: ProxyContainerPrototype
prototypes.description: A container that must be set to point at other entity and inventory index so it can forward all inventory interactions to the other entity.

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

properties.name: draw_inventory_content
properties.description: If the content of the inventory should be rendered in alt mode.

prototypes.name: PumpPrototype
prototypes.description: The pump is used to transfer fluids between tanks, fluid wagons and pipes.

properties.name: animations
properties.description: The animation for the pump.

properties.name: energy_source
properties.description: The type of energy the pump uses.

properties.name: energy_usage
properties.description: The amount of energy the pump uses.

properties.name: flow_scaling
properties.description: When true, pump will reduce pumping speed based on fullness of the input fluid segment.

properties.name: fluid_box
properties.description: The area of the entity where fluid travels.

properties.name: pumping_speed
properties.description: The amount of fluid this pump transfers per tick.

properties.name: beacon_power_usage_multiplier
properties.description: Must be >= 0.

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Path to the icon file.

Mandatory if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icon_size
properties.description:
The size of the square icon, in pixels. E.g. `32` for a 32px by 32px icon. Must be larger than `0`.

Only loaded if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icons
properties.description: Can't be an empty array.

properties.name: level
properties.description: Requires Space Age to use level greater than `0`.

properties.name: mining_drill_resource_drain_multiplier
properties.description: Must be in range `[0, 1]`.

properties.name: name
properties.description:
Unique textual identification of the prototype. May only contain alphanumeric characters, dashes and underscores. May not exceed a length of 200 characters.

Requires Space Age to create prototypes with name other than `normal` or `quality-unknown`.

properties.name: next_probability
properties.description: Must be in range [0, 1.0].

properties.name: science_pack_drain_multiplier
properties.description: Must be in range `[0, 1]`.

prototypes.name: RadarPrototype
prototypes.description: A [radar](https://wiki.factorio.com/Radar).

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

properties.name: connects_to_other_radars
properties.description: If set to true, radars on the same surface will connect to other radars on the same surface using hidden wires with [radar](runtime:defines.wire_origin.radars) origin.

properties.name: energy_fraction_to_connect
properties.description: Must be between 0 and 1. Must be larger than or equal to `energy_fraction_to_disconnect`.

properties.name: energy_fraction_to_disconnect
properties.description: Must be between 0 and 1. Must be less than or equal to `energy_fraction_to_connect`.

properties.name: energy_per_nearby_scan
properties.description:
The amount of energy the radar has to consume for nearby scan to be performed. This value doesn't have any effect on sector scanning.

Performance warning: nearby scan causes re-charting of many chunks, which is expensive operation. If you want to make a radar that updates map more in real time, you should keep its range low. If you are making radar with high range, you should set this value such that nearby scan is performed once a second or so. For example if you set `energy_usage` to 100kW, setting `energy_per_nearby_scan` to 100kJ will cause nearby scan to happen once per second.

properties.name: energy_per_sector
properties.description: The amount of energy it takes to scan a sector. This value doesn't have any effect on nearby scanning.

properties.name: energy_source
properties.description: The energy source for this radar.

properties.name: energy_usage
properties.description: The amount of energy this radar uses.

properties.name: is_military_target
properties.description: Whether this prototype should be a high priority target for enemy forces. See [Military units and structures](https://wiki.factorio.com/Military_units_and_structures).

properties.name: max_distance_of_nearby_sector_revealed
properties.description: The radius of the area constantly revealed by this radar, in chunks.

properties.name: max_distance_of_sector_revealed
properties.description: The radius of the area this radar can chart, in chunks.

prototypes.name: RailChainSignalPrototype
prototypes.description: A [rail chain signal](https://wiki.factorio.com/Rail_chain_signal).

properties.name: support

properties.name: walking_sound
properties.description: Sound played when a character walks over this rail.

prototypes.description: A rail ramp.

properties.name: collision_mask_allow_on_deep_oil_ocean
properties.description: Defaults to the mask from [UtilityConstants::default_collision_masks](prototype:UtilityConstants::default_collision_masks) when indexed by `"allow_on_deep_oil_ocean"`.

prototypes.name: RailRemnantsPrototype
prototypes.description: Used for rail corpses.

properties.name: build_grid_size
properties.description: Has to be 2 for 2x2 grid.

properties.name: collision_box
properties.description: "Rail remnant entities must have a non-zero [collision_box](prototype:EntityPrototype::collision_box) defined.

prototypes.name: RailSignalBasePrototype
prototypes.description: The abstract base entity for both rail signals.

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

properties.name: collision_box
properties.description: The [collision_box](prototype:EntityPrototype::collision_box) of rail signals is hardcoded to `{{-0.2, -0.2}, {0.2, 0.2}}`.

properties.name: elevated_collision_mask
properties.description: Defaults to the mask from [UtilityConstants::default_collision_masks](prototype:UtilityConstants::default_collision_masks) when indexed by  `type .. "/elevated"`.

properties.name: flags
properties.description: The "placeable-off-grid" flag will be ignored for rail signals.

prototypes.name: RailSignalPrototype
prototypes.description: A [rail signal](https://wiki.factorio.com/Rail_signal).

properties.name: build_grid_size
properties.description: Has to be 2 for 2x2 grid.

properties.name: collision_mask_allow_on_deep_oil_ocean
properties.description: Defaults to the mask from [UtilityConstants::default_collision_masks](prototype:UtilityConstants::default_collision_masks) when indexed by `"allow_on_deep_oil_ocean"`.

properties.name: elevated_selection_boxes
properties.description: Array must contain 8 items.

properties.name: support_range
properties.description: Must be lower than 500 and at least 1.

prototypes.name: ReactorPrototype
prototypes.description: A [reactor](https://wiki.factorio.com/Reactor).

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

properties.name: connection_patches_connected
properties.description: If defined, number of variations must be at least equal to count of [connections](prototype:HeatBuffer::connections) defined in `heat_buffer`. Each variation represents connected heat buffer connection of corresponding index.

properties.name: connection_patches_disconnected
properties.description: If defined, number of variations must be at least equal to count of [connections](prototype:HeatBuffer::connections) defined in `heat_buffer`. Each variation represents unconnected heat buffer connection of corresponding index.

properties.name: consumption
properties.description: How much energy this reactor can consume (from the input energy source) and then output as heat.

properties.name: default_fuel_glow_color
properties.description: When `use_fuel_glow_color` is true, this is the color used as `working_light_picture` tint for fuels that don't have glow color defined.

properties.name: energy_source
properties.description:
May not be a heat energy source.

The input energy source, in vanilla it is a burner energy source.

properties.name: heat_buffer
properties.description: The energy output as heat.

properties.name: heat_connection_patches_connected
properties.description: If defined, number of variations must be at least equal to count of [connections](prototype:HeatBuffer::connections) defined in `heat_buffer`. When reactor is heated, corresponding variations are drawn over `connection_patches_connected`.

properties.name: heat_connection_patches_disconnected
properties.description: If defined, number of variations must be at least equal to count of [connections](prototype:HeatBuffer::connections) defined in `heat_buffer`. When reactor is heated, corresponding variations are drawn over `connection_patches_disconnected`.

properties.name: heating_radius
properties.description: Must be >= 0.

properties.name: meltdown_action
properties.description: The action is triggered when the reactor dies (is destroyed) at over 90% of max temperature.

properties.name: scale_energy_usage
properties.description: When this is true, the reactor will stop consuming fuel/energy when the temperature has reached the maximum.

properties.name: use_fuel_glow_color
properties.description: Whether the reactor should use [fuel_glow_color](prototype:ItemPrototype::fuel_glow_color) from the fuel item prototype as light color and tint for `working_light_picture`. [Forum post.](https://forums.factorio.com/71121)

prototypes.name: RecipeCategory
prototypes.description:
A recipe category. The built-in categories can be found [here](https://wiki.factorio.com/Data.raw#recipe-category). See [RecipePrototype::category](prototype:RecipePrototype::category). Recipe categories can be used to specify which [machine](prototype:CraftingMachinePrototype::crafting_categories) can craft which [recipes](prototype:RecipePrototype).

The recipe category with the name "crafting" cannot contain recipes with fluid ingredients or products.

prototypes.name: RecipePrototype
prototypes.description: A recipe. It can be a crafting recipe, a smelting recipe, or a custom type of recipe, see [RecipeCategory](prototype:RecipeCategory).

properties.name: allow_as_intermediate
properties.description: Whether the recipe can be used as an intermediate recipe in hand-crafting.

properties.name: allow_decomposition
properties.description: Whether this recipe is allowed to be broken down for the recipe tooltip "Total raw" calculations.

properties.name: allow_inserter_overload
properties.description: Whether the recipe is allowed to have the extra inserter overload bonus applied (4 * stack inserter stack size).

properties.name: allow_intermediates
properties.description: Whether the recipe is allowed to use intermediate recipes when hand-crafting.

properties.name: allowed_module_categories
properties.description: Sets the [module categories](prototype:ModuleCategory) that are allowed to be used with this recipe.

properties.name: alternative_unlock_methods
properties.description: Additional technologies to list under "Unlocked by" on a recipe's Factoriopedia page.

properties.name: always_show_made_in
properties.description: Whether the "Made in: <Machine>" part of the tool-tip should always be present, and not only when the recipe can't be hand-crafted.

properties.name: always_show_products
properties.description: Whether the products are always shown in the recipe tooltip.

properties.name: auto_recycle
properties.description:
Whether the recipe should be included in the recycling recipes automatically generated by the quality mod.

This property is not read by the game engine itself, but the quality mod's recycling.lua file. This means it is discarded by the game engine after loading finishes.

properties.name: category
properties.description:
The [category](prototype:RecipeCategory) of this recipe. Controls which machines can craft this recipe.

The built-in categories can be found [here](https://wiki.factorio.com/Data.raw#recipe-category). The base `"crafting"` category can not contain recipes with fluid ingredients or products.

properties.name: crafting_machine_tint
properties.description: Used by [WorkingVisualisations::working_visualisations](prototype:WorkingVisualisations::working_visualisations) to tint certain layers with the recipe color. [WorkingVisualisation::apply_recipe_tint](prototype:WorkingVisualisation::apply_recipe_tint) determines which of the four colors is used for that layer, if any.

properties.name: enabled
properties.description:
This can be `false` to disable the recipe at the start of the game, or `true` to leave it enabled.

If a recipe is unlocked via technology, this should be set to `false`.

properties.name: energy_required
properties.description: The amount of time it takes to make this recipe. Must be `> 0.001`. Equals the number of seconds it takes to craft at crafting speed `1`.

properties.name: hide_from_player_crafting
properties.description: Hides the recipe from the player's crafting screen. The recipe will still show up for selection in machines.

properties.name: hide_from_signal_gui
properties.description: If left unset, this property will be determined automatically: If the recipe is not `hidden`, and no item, fluid, or virtual signal has the same icon as this recipe, this property will be set to `false`. It'll be `true` otherwise.

properties.name: hide_from_stats
properties.description: Hides the recipe from item/fluid production statistics.

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
If given, this determines the recipe's icon. Otherwise, the icon of `main_product` or the singular product is used.

Mandatory if `icons` is not defined for a recipe with more than one product and no `main_product`, or no product.

properties.name: icon_size
properties.description:
The size of the square icon, in pixels. E.g. `32` for a 32px by 32px icon. Must be larger than `0`.

Only loaded if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icons
properties.description: Can't be an empty array.

properties.name: ingredients
properties.description:
A table containing ingredient names and amounts. Can also contain information about fluid temperature and whether some of the amount is ignored by production statistics.

The maximum ingredient amount is 65 535. Can be set to an empty table to create a recipe that needs no ingredients.

Duplicate ingredients, e.g. two entries with the same name, are *not* allowed. In-game, the item ingredients are ordered by [ItemGroup::order_in_recipe](prototype:ItemGroup::order_in_recipe).

properties.name: main_product
properties.description:
For recipes with one or more products: Subgroup, localised_name and icon default to the values of the singular/main product, but can be overwritten by the recipe. Setting the main_product to an empty string (`""`) forces the title in the recipe tooltip to use the recipe's name (not that of the product) and shows the products in the tooltip.

If 1) there are multiple products and this property is nil, 2) this property is set to an empty string (`""`), or 3) there are no products, the recipe will use the localised_name, icon, and subgroup of the recipe. icon and subgroup become non-optional.

properties.name: maximum_productivity
properties.description: Must be >= 0.

properties.name: overload_multiplier
properties.description:
Used to determine how many extra items are put into an assembling machine before it's considered "full enough". See [insertion limits](https://wiki.factorio.com/Inserters#Insertion_limits).

If set to `0`, it instead uses the following formula: `1.166 / (energy_required / the assembler's crafting_speed)`, rounded up, and clamped to be between`2` and `100`. The numbers used in this formula can be changed by the [UtilityConstants](prototype:UtilityConstants) properties `dynamic_recipe_overload_factor`, `minimum_recipe_overload_multiplier`, and `maximum_recipe_overload_multiplier`.

properties.name: reset_freshness_on_craft
properties.description: When set to true, if the recipe successfully finishes crafting without spoiling, the result is produced fresh (non-spoiled).

properties.name: result_is_always_fresh
properties.description: When set to true, the recipe will always produce fresh (non-spoiled) item even when the ingredients are spoiled.

properties.name: results
properties.description:
A table containing result names and amounts. Products also contain information such as fluid temperature, probability of results and whether some of the amount is ignored by productivity.

Can be set to an empty table to create a recipe that produces nothing. Duplicate results, e.g. two entries with the same name, are allowed.

properties.name: show_amount_in_title
properties.description: Whether the recipe name should have the product amount in front of it. E.g. "2x Transport belt".

properties.name: unlock_results
properties.description: Whether enabling this recipe unlocks its item products to show in selection lists (item filters, logistic requests, etc.).

prototypes.name: RemoteControllerPrototype
prototypes.description: Properties of the remote controller.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the remote controller. Base game uses "default".

prototypes.name: RepairToolPrototype
prototypes.description: A [repair pack](https://wiki.factorio.com/Repair_pack). Using the tool decreases durability to restore entity health.

properties.name: speed
properties.description:
Entity health repaired per used [ToolPrototype::durability](prototype:ToolPrototype::durability). E.g. a repair tool with 5 durability and a repair speed of 2 will restore 10 health.

This is then multiplied by the [EntityWithHealthPrototype::repair_speed_modifier](prototype:EntityWithHealthPrototype::repair_speed_modifier) of the entity.

prototypes.name: ResearchAchievementPrototype
prototypes.description: This prototype is used for receiving an achievement when the player completes a specific research.

properties.name: research_all
properties.description:
Mandatory if `technology` is not defined.

This will only trigger if the player has learned every research in the game.

properties.name: technology
properties.description:
Mandatory if `research_all` is not defined.

Researching this technology will trigger the achievement.

prototypes.name: ResourceCategory
prototypes.description: A resource category. The built-in categories can be found [here](https://wiki.factorio.com/Data.raw#resource-category). See [ResourceEntityPrototype::category](prototype:ResourceEntityPrototype::category).

prototypes.name: ResourceEntityPrototype
prototypes.description: A mineable/gatherable entity.
examples:
```
{
  type = "resource",
  name = "crude-oil",
  icon = "__base__/graphics/icons/crude-oil.png",
  icon_size = 32,
  flags = {"placeable-neutral"},
  category = "basic-fluid",
  order="a-b-a",
  infinite = true,
  highlight = true,
  minimum = 60000,
  normal = 300000,
  infinite_depletion_amount = 10,
  resource_patch_search_radius = 12,
  tree_removal_probability = 0.7,
  tree_removal_max_distance = 32 * 32,
  minable =
  {
    mining_time = 1,
    results =
    {
      {
        type = "fluid",
        name = "crude-oil",
        amount_min = 10,
        amount_max = 10,
        probability = 1
      }
    }
  },
  collision_box = {{ -1.4, -1.4}, {1.4, 1.4}},
  selection_box = {{ -0.5, -0.5}, {0.5, 0.5}},
  autoplace = resource_autoplace.resource_autoplace_settings{
    name = "crude-oil",
    order = "c", -- Other resources are "b"; oil won't get placed if something else is already there.
    base_density = 8.2,
    base_spots_per_km2 = 1.8,
    random_probability = 1/48,
    random_spot_size_minimum = 1,
    random_spot_size_maximum = 1, -- don't randomize spot size
    additional_richness = 220000, -- this increases the total everywhere, so base_density needs to be decreased to compensate
    has_starting_area_placement = false,
    resource_index = resource_autoplace.resource_indexes["crude-oil"],
    regular_rq_factor_multiplier = 1
  },
  stage_counts = {0},
  stages =
  {
    sheet =
    {
      filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/crude-oil/crude-oil.png",
      priority = "extra-high",
      width = 75,
      height = 61,
      frame_count = 4,
      variation_count = 1
    }
  },
  map_color = {r=0.78, g=0.2, b=0.77},
  map_grid = false
}
```

properties.name: category
properties.description: The category for the resource. Available categories in vanilla can be found [here](https://wiki.factorio.com/Data.raw#resource-category).

properties.name: cliff_removal_probability
properties.description: Must be greater than or equal to `0`.

properties.name: driving_sound
properties.description: Sound played when a [CarPrototype](prototype:CarPrototype) drives over this resource.

properties.name: effect_animation_period
properties.description: How long it takes `stages_effect` to go from `min_effect_alpha` to `max_effect_alpha`.

properties.name: effect_animation_period_deviation
properties.description: How much `effect_animation_period` can deviate from its original value. Used to make the stages effect alpha change look less uniform.

properties.name: effect_darkness_multiplier
properties.description: How much the surface darkness should affect the alpha of `stages_effect`.

properties.name: highlight
properties.description: If the resource should be highlighted when holding a mining drill that can mine it (holding a pumpjack highlights crude-oil in the base game).

properties.name: infinite
properties.description: If the ore is infinitely minable, or if it will eventually run out of resource.

properties.name: infinite_depletion_amount
properties.description: Every time an infinite-type resource "ticks" lower it's lowered by that amount.

properties.name: map_grid
properties.description: Whether the resource should have a grid pattern on the map instead of a solid map color.

properties.name: max_effect_alpha
properties.description: Maximal alpha value of `stages_effect`.

properties.name: min_effect_alpha
properties.description: Minimal alpha value of `stages_effect`.

properties.name: minimum
properties.description: Must be not 0 when `infinite = true`.

properties.name: mining_visualisation_tint
properties.description: Defaults to the resources map color if left unset and map color is set, otherwise defaults to white if left unset.

properties.name: normal
properties.description: Must be not 0 when `infinite = true`.

properties.name: randomize_visual_position
properties.description: Whether there should be a slight offset to graphics of the resource. Used to make patches a little less uniform in appearance.

properties.name: resource_patch_search_radius
properties.description: When hovering over this resource in the map view: How far to search for other resource patches of this type to display as one (summing amount, white outline).

properties.name: stage_counts
properties.description: Number of stages the animation has.

properties.name: stages
properties.description:
Entity's graphics, using a graphic sheet, with variation and depletion. At least one stage must be defined.

When using [AnimationVariations::sheet](prototype:AnimationVariations::sheet), `frame_count` is the amount of frames per row in the spritesheet. `variation_count` is the amount of rows in the spritesheet. Each row in the spritesheet is one stage of the animation.

properties.name: stages_effect
properties.description: An effect that can be overlaid above the normal ore graphics. Used in the base game to make [uranium ore](https://wiki.factorio.com/Uranium_ore) glow.

properties.name: tree_removal_max_distance
properties.description: Must be positive when `tree_removal_probability` is set.

properties.name: tree_removal_probability
properties.description: Must be greater than or equal to `0`.

properties.name: walking_sound
properties.description: Sound played when the player walks over this resource.

prototypes.name: RoboportEquipmentPrototype
prototypes.description: Used by [personal roboport](https://wiki.factorio.com/Personal_roboport).

properties.name: burner
properties.description: Add this is if the roboport should be fueled directly instead of using power from the equipment grid.

properties.name: charge_approach_distance
properties.description: Presumably, the distance from the roboport at which robots will wait to charge.

properties.name: charging_offsets
properties.description: The offsets from the center of the roboport at which robots will charge. Only used if `charging_station_count` is equal to 0.

properties.name: charging_station_count
properties.description: How many charging points this roboport has. If this is 0, the length of the charging_offsets table is used to calculate the charging station count.

properties.name: charging_threshold_distance
properties.description: Distance in tiles. This defines how far away a robot can be from the charging spot and still be charged, however the bot is still required to reach a charging spot in the first place.

properties.name: construction_radius
properties.description: Can't be negative.

properties.name: draw_logistic_radius_visualization
properties.description: Unused, as roboport equipment does not have a logistic radius that could be drawn.

properties.name: power
properties.description:
Mandatory if `burner` is defined.

The size of the buffer of the burner energy source, so effectively the amount of power that the energy source can produce per tick.

properties.name: recharging_animation
properties.description: The animation played at each charging point when a robot is charging there.

properties.name: recharging_light
properties.description: The light emitted when charging a robot.

properties.name: robot_limit
properties.description: How many robots can exist in the network (cumulative).

properties.name: spawn_and_station_height
properties.description: Presumably states the height of the charging stations and thus an additive offset for the charging_offsets.

properties.name: spawn_minimum
properties.description: Minimum amount of energy that needs to available inside the roboport's buffer so that robots can be spawned.

properties.name: stationing_offset
properties.description: The offset from the center of the roboport at which robots will enter and exit.

properties.name: stationing_render_layer_swap_height
properties.description: When robot ascends or descends to this roboport, at which height is should switch between `"air-object"` and `"object"` [render layer](prototype:RenderLayer).

prototypes.name: RoboportPrototype
prototypes.description: A [roboport](https://wiki.factorio.com/Roboport).

properties.name: base_animation
properties.description: The animation played when the roboport is idle.

properties.name: charge_approach_distance
properties.description: The distance (in tiles) from the roboport at which robots will wait to charge. Notably, if the robot is already in range, then it will simply wait at its current position.

properties.name: charging_energy
properties.description: The maximum power provided to each charging station.

properties.name: charging_offsets
properties.description: The offsets from the center of the roboport at which robots will charge. Only used if `charging_station_count` is equal to 0.

properties.name: charging_station_count
properties.description: How many charging points this roboport has. If this is 0, the length of the charging_offsets table is used to calculate the charging station count.

properties.name: charging_threshold_distance
properties.description: Unused.

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

properties.name: construction_radius
properties.description: Can't be negative.

properties.name: energy_source
properties.description: The roboport's energy source.

properties.name: energy_usage
properties.description: The amount of energy the roboport uses when idle.

properties.name: logistics_connection_distance
properties.description: Must be >= `logistics_radius`.

properties.name: logistics_radius
properties.description: Can't be negative.

properties.name: material_slots_count
properties.description: The number of repair pack slots in the roboport.

properties.name: radar_range
properties.description: Defaults to the max of logistic range or construction range rounded up to chunks.

properties.name: recharge_minimum
properties.description:
Minimum charge that the roboport has to have after a blackout (0 charge/buffered energy) to begin working again. Additionally, freshly placed roboports will have their energy buffer filled with `0.25  recharge_minimum` energy.

Must be larger than or equal to `energy_usage` otherwise during low power the roboport will toggle on and off every tick.

properties.name: recharging_animation
properties.description: The animation played at each charging point when a robot is charging there.

properties.name: recharging_light
properties.description: The light emitted when charging a robot.

properties.name: robot_limit
properties.description: Unused.

properties.name: robot_slots_count
properties.description: The number of robot slots in the roboport.

properties.name: spawn_and_station_height
properties.description: Presumably states the height of the charging stations and thus an additive offset for the charging_offsets.

properties.name: stationing_offset
properties.description: The offset from the center of the roboport at which robots will enter and exit.

properties.name: stationing_render_layer_swap_height
properties.description: When robot ascends or descends to this roboport, at which height is should switch between `"air-object"` and `"object"` [render layer](prototype:RenderLayer).

prototypes.name: RobotWithLogisticInterfacePrototype
prototypes.description: The common properties of logistic and construction robots represented by an abstract prototype.

properties.name: destroy_action
properties.description: Applied when the robot expires (runs out of energy and [FlyingRobotPrototype::speed_multiplier_when_out_of_energy](prototype:FlyingRobotPrototype::speed_multiplier_when_out_of_energy) is 0).

properties.name: idle
properties.description: Only the first frame of the animation is drawn. This means that the graphics for the idle state cannot be animated.

properties.name: in_motion
properties.description: Only the first frame of the animation is drawn. This means that the graphics for the in_motion state cannot be animated.

properties.name: max_payload_size
properties.description: The robot's cargo carrying capacity. Can be increased by [worker robot cargo size research](prototype:WorkerRobotStorageModifier).

properties.name: shadow_idle
properties.description: Only the first frame of the animation is drawn. This means that the graphics for the idle state cannot be animated.

properties.name: shadow_in_motion
properties.description: Only the first frame of the animation is drawn. This means that the graphics for the in_motion state cannot be animated.

prototypes.name: RocketSiloPrototype
prototypes.description: A [rocket silo](https://wiki.factorio.com/Rocket_silo).

properties.name: active_energy_usage
properties.description: Additional energy used during the following parts of the [launch sequence](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status): doors_opening, rocket_rising, arms_advance, engine_starting, arms_retract, doors_closing.

properties.name: alarm_sound
properties.description: Played when switching into the [lights_blinking_open](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.lights_blinking_open) state.

properties.name: alarm_trigger
properties.description: Applied when switching into the [lights_blinking_open](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.lights_blinking_open) state.

properties.name: base_night_sprite
properties.description: Drawn instead of `base_day_sprite` during the night, that is when [LuaSurface::darkness](runtime:LuaSurface::darkness) is larger than 0.3.

properties.name: cargo_station_parameters
properties.description: Must have exactly one entry in [CargoStationParameters::hatch_definitions](prototype:CargoStationParameters::hatch_definitions).

properties.name: clamps_off_sound
properties.description: Played when switching into the [arms_retract](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.arms_retract) state.

properties.name: clamps_off_trigger
properties.description: Applied when switching into the [arms_retract](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.arms_retract) state.

properties.name: clamps_on_sound
properties.description: Played when switching into the [arms_advance](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.arms_advance) state.

properties.name: clamps_on_trigger
properties.description: Applied when switching into the [arms_advance](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.arms_advance) state.

properties.name: door_opening_speed
properties.description: The inverse of the duration in ticks of [doors_opening](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.doors_opening) and [closing](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.doors_closing).
examples:
```
door_opening_speed = 1 / (4 * 60) -- doors opening and closing takes 4 seconds
```

properties.name: doors_sound
properties.description: Played when switching into the [doors_opening](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.doors_opening) and [doors_closing](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.doors_closing) states.

properties.name: doors_trigger
properties.description: Applied when switching into the [doors_opening](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.doors_opening) and [doors_closing](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.doors_closing) states.

properties.name: lamp_energy_usage
properties.description:
May be 0.

Additional energy used during the night, that is when [LuaSurface::darkness](runtime:LuaSurface::darkness) is larger than 0.3.

properties.name: launch_to_space_platforms
properties.description: Enables 'Space Age' functionality for this rocket silo, allowing it to supply space platforms.

properties.name: launch_wait_time
properties.description: The time to wait in the [launch_started](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.launch_started) state before switching to [engine_starting](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.engine_starting).

properties.name: light_blinking_speed
properties.description: The inverse of the duration in ticks of [lights_blinking_open](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.lights_blinking_open) and [lights_blinking_close](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.lights_blinking_close).

properties.name: quick_alarm_sound
properties.description: Played when switching from [rocket_flying](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.rocket_flying) into the [doors_opened](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.doors_opened) state when a quick follow-up rocket is ready.

properties.name: raise_rocket_sound
properties.description: Played when switching into the [rocket_rising](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.rocket_rising) state.

properties.name: raise_rocket_trigger
properties.description: Applied when switching into the [rocket_rising](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.rocket_rising) state.

properties.name: red_lights_back_sprites
properties.description: Drawn from the start of the [lights_blinking_open](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.lights_blinking_open) state until the end of the [lights_blinking_close](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.lights_blinking_close) state.

properties.name: red_lights_front_sprites
properties.description: Drawn from the start of the [lights_blinking_open](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.lights_blinking_open) state until the end of the [lights_blinking_close](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.lights_blinking_close) state.

properties.name: render_not_in_network_icon
properties.description: Whether the "no network" icon should be rendered on this entity if the entity is not within a logistics network.

properties.name: rocket_entity
properties.description: Name of a [RocketSiloRocketPrototype](prototype:RocketSiloRocketPrototype).

properties.name: rocket_parts_required
properties.description: The number of crafts that must complete to produce a rocket. This includes bonus crafts from productivity. Recipe products are ignored.

properties.name: rocket_parts_storage_cap
properties.description: Must be at least `rocket_parts_required`.

properties.name: rocket_rising_delay
properties.description: The time to wait in the [doors_opened](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.doors_opened) state before switching to [rocket_rising](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.rocket_rising).

properties.name: times_to_blink
properties.description:
How many times the `red_lights_back_sprites` and `red_lights_front_sprites` should blink during [lights_blinking_open](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.lights_blinking_open) and [lights_blinking_close](runtime:defines.rocket_silo_status.lights_blinking_close).

Does not affect the duration of the launch sequence.

prototypes.name: RocketSiloRocketPrototype
prototypes.description: The rocket inside the rocket silo.

properties.name: cargo_pod_entity
properties.description: Name of a [CargoPodPrototype](prototype:CargoPodPrototype).

prototypes.name: RocketSiloRocketShadowPrototype
prototypes.description: The shadow of the rocket inside the rocket silo.
examples:
```
{
  type = "rocket-silo-rocket-shadow",
  name = "rocket-silo-rocket-shadow",
  flags = {"not-on-map"},
  hidden = true,
  collision_mask = {layers={}, not_colliding_with_itself=true},
  collision_box = {{0, 0}, {10, 3.5}},
  selection_box = {{0, 0}, {0, 0}}
}
```

prototypes.name: RollingStockPrototype
prototypes.description: The abstract base of all rolling stock.

properties.name: connection_distance
properties.description:
The distance between the joint of this rolling stock and its connected rolling stocks joint.

Maximum connection distance is 15.

properties.name: door_closing_sound
properties.description: Cannot use `fade_ticks`.

properties.name: door_opening_sound
properties.description: Cannot use `fade_ticks`.

properties.name: drive_over_tie_trigger
properties.description: Usually a sound to play when the rolling stock drives over a tie. The rolling stock is considered to be driving over a tie every `tie_distance` tiles.

properties.name: elevated_collision_mask
properties.description: Defaults to the mask from [UtilityConstants::default_collision_masks](prototype:UtilityConstants::default_collision_masks) when indexed by  `type .. "/elevated"`.

properties.name: joint_distance
properties.description:
The length between this rolling stocks front and rear joints. Joints are the point where connection_distance is measured from when rolling stock are connected to one another. Wheels sprite are placed based on the joint position.

Maximum joint distance is 15.

Note: There needs to be border at least 0.2 between the [bounding box](prototype:EntityPrototype::collision_box) edge and joint. This means that the collision_box must be at least `{{-0,-0.2},{0,0.2}}`.

properties.name: max_speed
properties.description:
Maximum speed of the rolling stock in tiles/tick.

In-game, the max speed of a train is `min(all_rolling_stock_max_speeds)  average(all_fuel_modifiers_in_all_locomotives)`. This calculated train speed is then silently capped to 7386.3km/h.

properties.name: tie_distance
properties.description: In tiles. Used to determine how often `drive_over_tie_trigger` is triggered.

properties.name: transition_collision_mask
properties.description: Defaults to the mask from [UtilityConstants::default_collision_masks](prototype:UtilityConstants::default_collision_masks) when indexed by  `type .. "/transition"`.

prototypes.name: SegmentPrototype
prototypes.description: Entity representing an individual segment in a [SegmentedUnitPrototype](prototype:SegmentedUnitPrototype)

properties.name: animation
properties.description: The animation to use of the entity.

properties.name: backward_overlap
properties.description:
The number of segments behind this one that should always be rendered atop this one, giving the illusion that at all orientations, those following segments overlap this current segment.

Must be 0 or greater, and the sum of `forward_overlap` and `backward_overlap` must be less than or equal to 4.

properties.name: backward_padding
properties.description: The number of tiles of spacing to add behind this segment. Can be negative. Scales with the segment scale when used in a [SegmentEngineSpecification](prototype:SegmentEngineSpecification).

properties.name: dying_sound
properties.description:
The sound to play when the entity dies.

If not specified, [UtilitySounds::segment_dying_sound](prototype:UtilitySounds::segment_dying_sound) is used.

properties.name: forward_overlap
properties.description:
The number of segments ahead of this one that should always be rendered atop this one, giving the illusion that at all orientations, those preceding segments overlap this current segment.

Must be 0 or greater, and the sum of `forward_overlap` and `backward_overlap` must be less than or equal to 4.

properties.name: forward_padding
properties.description: The number of tiles of spacing to add in front of this segment. Can be negative. Scales with the segment scale when used in a [SegmentEngineSpecification](prototype:SegmentEngineSpecification).

properties.name: render_layer
properties.description: The layer to render the entity in.

properties.name: update_effects
properties.description: The effects to trigger every tick.

properties.name: update_effects_while_enraged
properties.description: The effects to trigger every tick while enraged, in addition to `update_effects`.

prototypes.name: SegmentedUnitPrototype
prototypes.description: Entity composed of multiple segment entities that trail behind the head.

properties.name: acceleration_rate
properties.description: The acceleration rate when moving from one state to another. Cannot be negative.

properties.name: attack_parameters
properties.description: Attack parameters for when a segmented unit is attacking something.

properties.name: attacking_speed
properties.description: The movement speed while attacking, in tiles per tick. Cannot be negative.

properties.name: enraged_duration
properties.description: The number of ticks to remain enraged after last taking damage.

properties.name: enraged_speed
properties.description: The movement speed while enraged, in tiles per tick. Cannot be negative.

properties.name: hurt_roar
properties.description: Sound which plays when health ratio drops below any of `hurt_thresholds`.

properties.name: hurt_thresholds
properties.description: Only loaded, and mandatory if `hurt_roar` is defined.

properties.name: investigating_speed
properties.description: The movement speed while investigating, in tiles per tick. Cannot be negative.

properties.name: patrolling_speed
properties.description: The movement speed while patrolling, in tiles per tick. Cannot be negative.

properties.name: patrolling_turn_radius
properties.description: Cannot be negative.

properties.name: revenge_attack_parameters
properties.description: Attack parameters for when a segmented unit is attacking something in retaliation because the target first attacked it.

properties.name: roar_probability
properties.description: The default is 1.0f / (6.0f * 60.0f), average pause between roars is 6 seconds.

properties.name: segment_engine
properties.description: Specification of the segment engine, which should contain a list of the segments that compose the entity's body.

properties.name: territory_radius
properties.description: The territory radius in chunks. The chunk in which the entity spawned is included.

properties.name: ticks_per_scan
properties.description: The number of ticks between territory scans. Greater values means longer time between scans, which means a slower reaction time. Cannot be `0`.

properties.name: turn_radius
properties.description: Turn radius, in tiles. Cannot be negative.

properties.name: turn_smoothing
properties.description: Attempts to smooth out tight turns by limiting how quickly the unit can change turning directions. 0 means no turn smoothing, 1 means no turning whatsoever. Must be between 0 and 1.

properties.name: vision_distance
properties.description: Vision distance, affects scanning radius for enemies to attack. Must be non-negative. Max 100.

prototypes.name: SelectionToolPrototype
prototypes.description: Used in the base game as a base for the blueprint item and the deconstruction item.

properties.name: alt_reverse_select
properties.description: Settings for how the selection tool alt-reverse-selects things in-game (using SHIFT + Right mouse button).

properties.name: always_include_tiles
properties.description: If tiles should be included in the selection regardless of entities also being in the selection. This is a visual only setting.

prototypes.name: ShootAchievementPrototype
prototypes.description: This prototype is used for receiving an achievement when the player shoots certain ammo.

properties.name: ammo_type
properties.description: This will trigger the achievement, if this ammo is shot.

properties.name: amount
properties.description: How much of the ammo needs to be shot.

prototypes.name: ShortcutPrototype
prototypes.description:
Definition for a shortcut button in the [shortcut bar](https://wiki.factorio.com/Shortcut_bar).

This is **not** a custom keybinding (keyboard shortcut), for that see [CustomInputPrototype](prototype:CustomInputPrototype).
examples:
```
{
  type = "shortcut",
  name = "give-deconstruction-planner",
  order = "b[blueprints]-i[deconstruction-planner]",
  action = "spawn-item",
  localised_name = {"shortcut.make-deconstruction-planner"},
  associated_control_input = "give-deconstruction-planner",
  technology_to_unlock = "construction-robotics",
  item_to_spawn = "deconstruction-planner",
  style = "red",
  icon = "__base__/graphics/icons/shortcut-toolbar/mip/new-deconstruction-planner-x56.png",
  icon_size = 56,
  small_icon = "__base__/graphics/icons/shortcut-toolbar/mip/new-deconstruction-planner-x24.png",
  small_icon_size = 24
}
```

properties.name: action
properties.description: If this is `"lua"`, [on_lua_shortcut](runtime:on_lua_shortcut) is raised when the shortcut is clicked.

properties.name: associated_control_input
properties.description: Name of a custom input or vanilla control. This is **only** used to show the keybind in the tooltip of the shortcut.

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Path to the icon file.

Mandatory if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icon_size
properties.description:
The size of the square icon, in pixels. E.g. `32` for a 32px by 32px icon. Must be larger than `0`.

The base game uses 32px icons for shortcuts.

Only loaded if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icons
properties.description: Can't be an empty array.

properties.name: item_to_spawn
properties.description: The item to create when clicking on a shortcut with the action set to `"spawn-item"`. The item must have the [spawnable](prototype:ItemPrototypeFlags::spawnable) flag set.

properties.name: order
properties.description: Used to order the shortcuts in the [quick panel](https://wiki.factorio.com/Quick_panel), which replaces the shortcut bar when using a controller (game pad). It [is recommended](https://forums.factorio.com/106661) to order modded shortcuts after the vanilla shortcuts.

properties.name: small_icon
properties.description:
Path to the icon file. Used in the shortcut selection popup.

Mandatory if `small_icons` is not defined.

properties.name: small_icon_size
properties.description:
The size of the small icon, in pixels. E.g. `32` for a 32px by 32px icon. Must be larger than `0`.

The base game uses 24px small icons for shortcuts.

Only loaded if `small_icons` is not defined.

properties.name: small_icons
properties.description: Can't be an empty array.

properties.name: technology_to_unlock
properties.description: The technology that must be researched before this shortcut can be used. Once a shortcut is unlocked in one save file, it is unlocked for all future save files.

properties.name: toggleable
properties.description: Must be enabled for the Factorio API to be able to set the toggled state on the shortcut button, see [LuaPlayer::set_shortcut_toggled](runtime:LuaPlayer::set_shortcut_toggled).

properties.name: unavailable_until_unlocked
properties.description: If `true`, the shortcut will not be available until its `technology_to_unlock` is researched, even if it was already researched in a different game.

prototypes.name: SimpleEntityPrototype
prototypes.description: An extremely basic entity with no special functionality. Used for minable rocks. Cannot be rotated.

properties.name: count_as_rock_for_filtered_deconstruction
properties.description: Whether this entity should be treated as a rock for the purpose of deconstruction and for [CarPrototype::immune_to_rock_impacts](prototype:CarPrototype::immune_to_rock_impacts).

properties.name: picture
properties.description: Takes priority over `animations`. Only the `north` sprite is used because this entity cannot be rotated.

properties.name: pictures
properties.description: Takes priority over `picture` and `animations`.

properties.name: random_variation_on_create
properties.description: Whether a random graphics variation is chosen when placing the entity/creating it via script/creating it via map generation. If this is `false`, the entity will use the first variation instead of a random one.

properties.name: secondary_draw_order
properties.description: Used to determine render order for entities with the same `render_layer` in the same position. Entities with a higher `secondary_draw_order` are drawn on top.

properties.name: stateless_visualisation_variations
properties.description: Loaded and drawn with all `pictures`, `picture` and `animations`. If graphics variation is larger than number of `lower_pictures` variations this layer is not drawn.

prototypes.name: SimpleEntityWithForcePrototype
prototypes.description: By default, this entity will be a priority target for units/turrets, who will choose to attack it even if it does not block their path. Setting [EntityWithOwnerPrototype::is_military_target](prototype:EntityWithOwnerPrototype::is_military_target) to `false` will turn this off, which then makes this type equivalent to [SimpleEntityWithOwnerPrototype](prototype:SimpleEntityWithOwnerPrototype).

properties.name: is_military_target
properties.description: Whether this prototype should be a high priority target for enemy forces. See [Military units and structures](https://wiki.factorio.com/Military_units_and_structures).

prototypes.name: SimpleEntityWithOwnerPrototype
prototypes.description:
Has a force, but unlike [SimpleEntityWithForcePrototype](prototype:SimpleEntityWithForcePrototype) it is only attacked if the biters get stuck on it (or if [EntityWithOwnerPrototype::is_military_target](prototype:EntityWithOwnerPrototype::is_military_target) set to true to make the two entity types equivalent).

Can be rotated in 4 directions. `picture` can be used to specify different graphics per direction.

properties.name: force_visibility
properties.description: If the entity is not visible to a player, the player cannot select it.

properties.name: lower_pictures
properties.description: Loaded and drawn with all `pictures`, `picture` and `animations`. If graphics variation is larger than number of `lower_pictures` variations this layer is not drawn.

properties.name: picture
properties.description: Takes priority over `animations`.

properties.name: pictures
properties.description: Takes priority over `picture` and `animations`.

properties.name: random_variation_on_create
properties.description: Whether a random graphics variation is chosen when placing the entity/creating it via script/creating it via map generation. If this is false, the entity will use the first variation instead of a random one.

properties.name: secondary_draw_order
properties.description: Used to determine render order for entities with the same `render_layer` in the same position. Entities with a higher `secondary_draw_order` are drawn on top.

prototypes.name: SmokePrototype
prototypes.description: Abstract entity that has an animation.

properties.name: affected_by_wind
properties.description: Smoke always moves randomly unless `movement_slow_down_factor` is 0. If `affected_by_wind` is true, the smoke will also be moved by wind.

properties.name: collision_box
properties.description: Must have a collision box size of zero.

properties.name: cyclic
properties.description: If this is false then the smoke expires when the animation has played once.

properties.name: duration
properties.description: May not be 0 if `cyclic` is true. If `cyclic` is false then the smoke will be expire when the animation has played once, even if there would still be duration left.

properties.name: fade_away_duration
properties.description: `fade_in_duration` + `fade_away_duration` must be <= `duration`.

properties.name: fade_in_duration
properties.description: `fade_in_duration` + `fade_away_duration` must be <= `duration`.

properties.name: movement_slow_down_factor
properties.description: Value between 0 and 1, with 0 being no movement.

prototypes.name: SmokeWithTriggerPrototype
prototypes.description: An entity with animation and a trigger.

properties.name: action_cooldown
properties.description: 0 means never apply.

properties.name: attach_to_target
properties.description: If true, causes the smoke to move with the target entity if one is specified.

properties.name: fade_when_attachment_is_destroyed
properties.description: If true, the smoke will immediately start fading away when the entity it is attached to is destroyed. If it was never attached to an entity in the first place, then the smoke will fade away immediately after being created.

prototypes.name: SolarPanelEquipmentPrototype
prototypes.description: A [portable solar panel](https://wiki.factorio.com/Portable_solar_panel).

properties.name: power
properties.description: How much power should be provided.

properties.name: solar_coefficient_property
properties.description:
Surface property must have a positive [default value](prototype:SurfacePropertyPrototype::default_value). When [SolarPanelEquipmentPrototype::solar_coefficient_property](prototype:SolarPanelEquipmentPrototype::solar_coefficient_property) is set to point at a different surface property than "solar-power", then [LuaSurface::solar_power_multiplier](runtime:LuaSurface::solar_power_multiplier) and [SpaceLocationPrototype::solar_power_in_space](prototype:SpaceLocationPrototype::solar_power_in_space) will be ignored as the solar panel power output will be only affected by value of this surface property set on the surface using [PlanetPrototype::surface_properties](prototype:PlanetPrototype::surface_properties) or [LuaSurface::set_property](runtime:LuaSurface::set_property).

Due to equipment grid overall description, when solar_coefficient_property is not solar-power, a different locale will be used to show total energy production of solar panels: `description.solar-panel-power-X` where X is the surface property name.

prototypes.name: SolarPanelPrototype
prototypes.description: A [solar panel](https://wiki.factorio.com/Solar_panel).

properties.name: energy_source
properties.description: Sets how this solar panel connects to the energy network. The most relevant property seems to be the output_priority.

properties.name: overlay
properties.description: Overlay has to be empty or have same number of variations as `picture`.

properties.name: picture
properties.description: The picture displayed for this solar panel.

properties.name: production
properties.description: The maximum amount of power this solar panel can produce.

properties.name: solar_coefficient_property
properties.description: Surface property must have a positive [default value](prototype:SurfacePropertyPrototype::default_value). When [SolarPanelPrototype::solar_coefficient_property](prototype:SolarPanelPrototype::solar_coefficient_property) is set to point at a different surface property than "solar-power", then [LuaSurface::solar_power_multiplier](runtime:LuaSurface::solar_power_multiplier) and [SpaceLocationPrototype::solar_power_in_space](prototype:SpaceLocationPrototype::solar_power_in_space) will be ignored as the solar panel power output will be only affected by value of this surface property set on the surface using [PlanetPrototype::surface_properties](prototype:PlanetPrototype::surface_properties) or [LuaSurface::set_property](runtime:LuaSurface::set_property).

prototypes.name: SoundPrototype
prototypes.description: Specifies a sound that can be used with [SoundPath](runtime:SoundPath) at runtime.

properties.name: audible_distance_modifier
properties.description: Modifies how far a sound can be heard. Must be between `0` and `1` inclusive.

properties.name: filename
properties.description:
Supported sound file formats are `.ogg` (Vorbis and Opus) and `.wav`.

Only loaded, and mandatory if `variations` is not defined.

properties.name: max_speed
properties.description:
Must be `>= min_speed`.

Only loaded if `variations` is not defined. Only loaded, and mandatory if `min_speed` is defined.

properties.name: max_volume
properties.description:
Only loaded if `variations` is not defined.

Only loaded if `min_volume` is defined.

Must be `>= min_volume`.

properties.name: min_speed
properties.description:
Must be `>= 1 / 64`.

Only loaded if both `variations` and `speed` are not defined.

properties.name: min_volume
properties.description:
Only loaded if `variations` and `volume` are not defined.

Must be `>= 0`.

properties.name: modifiers
properties.description: Only loaded if `variations` is not defined.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the sound. Can be used as a [SoundPath](runtime:SoundPath) at runtime.

properties.name: preload
properties.description: Only loaded if `variations` is not defined.

properties.name: priority
properties.description:
Sounds with higher priority will replace a sound with lower priority if the maximum sounds limit is reached.

0 is the highest priority, 255 is the lowest priority.

properties.name: speed
properties.description:
Speed must be `>= 1 / 64`. This sets both min and max speeds.

Only loaded if `variations` is not defined.

properties.name: volume
properties.description:
Only loaded if `variations` is not defined.

This sets both min and max volumes.

Must be `>= 0`.

properties.name: distance
properties.description: How far a platform must travel to gain this achievement. Repeated trips over a shorter distance do not count.

properties.name: reversed
properties.description:
The achievement is unidirectional, this property controls the direction (using space connection definition).

When false, a platform must go through [from](prototype:SpaceConnectionPrototype::from) location and travel in [to](prototype:SpaceConnectionPrototype::to) direction. When true, a platform must go through `to` location and travel in `from` direction.

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Path to the icon file.

Mandatory if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icon_size
properties.description:
The size of the square icon, in pixels. E.g. `32` for a 32px by 32px icon. Must be larger than `0`.

Only loaded if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icons
properties.description: Can't be an empty array.

properties.name: length
properties.description: Cannot be 0.

prototypes.name: SpaceLocationPrototype
prototypes.description: A space location, such as a planet.

properties.name: asteroid_spawn_influence
properties.description: If greater than 0, `asteroid_spawn_definitions` will be used on space connections of this location, interpolated based on distance. The number specifies the percentage of the route where the location stops spawning its asteroids.

properties.name: distance
properties.description: Distance from the location's parent body in map coordinates.

properties.name: draw_orbit
properties.description: If `false`, an orbital ring will not be drawn for this location.

properties.name: fly_condition
properties.description: When set to true, it means that this connection offers fly condition rather than wait condition at the destination

properties.name: gravity_pull
properties.description: A value which modifies platform speed; is subtracted when traveling from this location and added when traveling to this location.

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Path to the icon file.

Mandatory if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icon_size
properties.description:
The size of the square icon, in pixels. E.g. `32` for a 32px by 32px icon. Must be larger than `0`.

Only loaded if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icons
properties.description: Can't be an empty array.

properties.name: label_orientation
properties.description: The orientation where the location's name will be drawn.

properties.name: magnitude
properties.description: The apparent size of the space location in map coordinates.

properties.name: orientation
properties.description: Angle in relation to the parent body.

properties.name: parked_platforms_orientation
properties.description: The orientation where parked space platforms will be drawn.

properties.name: planet_procession_set
properties.description: These transitions are used for anything traveling from the surface associated with this location.

properties.name: platform_procession_set
properties.description: These transitions are used for any platform stopped at this location.

properties.name: starmap_icon
properties.description:
Path to the icon file.

Only loaded if `starmap_icons` is not defined.

properties.name: starmap_icon_size
properties.description:
The size of the starmap icon, in pixels. E.g. `32` for a 32px by 32px icon. Must be larger than `0`.

Only loaded if `starmap_icons` is not defined.

properties.name: starmap_icons
properties.description: Can't be an empty array.

properties.name: build_grid_size
properties.description: Has to be 256 to make blueprints snap to (0, 0) most of the time.

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

properties.name: dump_container
properties.description: Name of a [ContainerPrototype](prototype:ContainerPrototype).

properties.name: initial_items
properties.description: The quality of the items will match the quality of the starter pack.

prototypes.name: SpectatorControllerPrototype
prototypes.description: Properties of the spectator controller.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the spectator controller. Base game uses "default".

prototypes.name: SpeechBubblePrototype
prototypes.description: A speech bubble. It floats in the world and can display text.

properties.name: style
properties.description: Needs a style of the type "speech_bubble_style", defined inside the gui styles.

properties.name: wrapper_flow_style
properties.description: Needs a style of the type "flow_style", defined inside the gui styles.

prototypes.name: SpiderLegPrototype
prototypes.description: Used by [SpiderLegSpecification](prototype:SpiderLegSpecification) for [SpiderVehiclePrototype](prototype:SpiderVehiclePrototype), also known as [spidertron](https://wiki.factorio.com/Spidertron).

properties.name: ankle_height
properties.description: The height of the foot from the ground when at rest.

properties.name: hip_flexibility
properties.description: The flexibility of hip. Must be between 0 and 1 inclusive. 0 means the hip doesn't flex at all, and 1 means the hip can bend the entire range, from straight up to straight down. Values less than one will dampen the hip flexibility and cause the upper and lower leg parts to stretch and squish more to compensate. Does not affect movement, only graphics.

properties.name: knee_distance_factor
properties.description: The placement of the knee relative to the torso of the spider and the end of the foot when at rest. Used to calculate the shape of the leg and the length of the individual parts. Values between 0 and 1 place the knee between the torso and the leg. Values closer to 0 will place the knee closer to the torso.

properties.name: knee_height
properties.description: The resting height of the knee from the ground. Used to derive leg part length and size. If set too low, this could cause the knee to invert, bending inwards underneath the spider.

properties.name: stretch_force_scalar
properties.description: A scalar that controls the amount of influence this leg has over the position of the torso. Must be greater than 0.

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the spider affects the shooting height and the drawing of the graphics and lights.

properties.name: torso_bob_speed
properties.description: Cannot be negative.

properties.name: torso_rotation_speed
properties.description: The orientation of the torso of the spider affects the shooting direction and the drawing of the graphics and lights.

properties.name: vision_distance
properties.description: Must be less than or equal to 100.

properties.name: warcry
properties.description: A sound the spider unit makes when it sets out to attack.

prototypes.name: SpiderVehiclePrototype
prototypes.description: A [spidertron](https://wiki.factorio.com/Spidertron).

properties.name: chain_shooting_cooldown_modifier
properties.description:
This is applied whenever the spider shoots (manual and automatic targeting), `automatic_weapon_cycling` is true and the next gun in line (which is then selected) has ammo. When all of the above is the case, the chain_shooting_cooldown_modifier is a multiplier on the remaining shooting cooldown: `cooldown = (remaining_cooldown  chain_shooting_cooldown_modifier)`.

chain_shooting_cooldown_modifier is intended to be in the range of 0 to 1. This means that setting chain_shooting_cooldown_modifier to 0 reduces the remaining shooting cooldown to 0 while a chain_shooting_cooldown_modifier of 1 does not affect the remaining shooting cooldown at all.

properties.name: guns
properties.description: The guns this spider vehicle uses.

properties.name: height
properties.description: The height of the spider affects the shooting height and the drawing of the graphics and lights.

properties.name: torso_bob_speed
properties.description: Cannot be negative.

properties.name: torso_rotation_speed
properties.description: The orientation of the torso of the spider affects the shooting direction and the drawing of the graphics and lights.

properties.name: trash_inventory_size
properties.description: If set to 0 then the spider will not have a Logistics tab.

prototypes.name: SpidertronRemotePrototype
prototypes.description: The [spidertron remote](https://wiki.factorio.com/Spidertron_remote). This remote can only be used for entities of type [SpiderVehiclePrototype](prototype:SpiderVehiclePrototype).

properties.name: icon_color_indicator_mask
properties.description: Color mask for the icon. This is used to show the color of the spidertron remote LEDS in the GUI.

properties.name: stack_size
properties.description: Count of items of the same name that can be stored in one inventory slot. Must be 1 when the `"not-stackable"` flag is set.

prototypes.name: SplitterPrototype
prototypes.description: A [splitter](https://wiki.factorio.com/Splitter).

properties.name: related_transport_belt
properties.description: The name of the [TransportBeltPrototype](prototype:TransportBeltPrototype) which is used for the sound of the underlying belt.

properties.name: structure_patch
properties.description: Drawn 1 tile north of `structure` when the splitter is facing east or west.

prototypes.name: SpritePrototype
prototypes.description: Specifies an image that can be used with [SpritePath](runtime:SpritePath) at runtime.
examples:
```
{
  type = "sprite"
  name = "accumulator-sprite",
  filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/basic-accumulator/basic-accumulator.png",
  priority = "extra-high",
  width = 124,
  height = 103,
  shift = {0.7, -0.2}
}
```

properties.name: allow_forced_downscale
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

If `true`, the sprite may be downsampled to half its size on load even when 'Sprite quality' graphics setting is set to 'High'. Whether downsampling happens depends on detected hardware and other graphics settings.

properties.name: apply_runtime_tint
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: apply_special_effect
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: blend_mode
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: dice
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Number of slices this is sliced into when using the "optimized atlas packing" option. If you are a modder, you can just ignore this property. Example: If this is 4, the sprite will be sliced into a 4x4 grid.

properties.name: dice_x
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Same as `dice` above, but this specifies only how many slices there are on the x axis.

properties.name: dice_y
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Same as `dice` above, but this specifies only how many slices there are on the y axis.

properties.name: draw_as_glow
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Only one of `draw_as_shadow`, `draw_as_glow` and `draw_as_light` can be true. This takes precedence over `draw_as_light`.

Draws first as a normal sprite, then again as a light layer. See [https://forums.factorio.com/91682](https://forums.factorio.com/91682).

properties.name: draw_as_light
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Only one of `draw_as_shadow`, `draw_as_glow` and `draw_as_light` can be true.

properties.name: draw_as_shadow
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Only one of `draw_as_shadow`, `draw_as_glow` and `draw_as_light` can be true. This takes precedence over `draw_as_glow` and `draw_as_light`.

properties.name: filename
properties.description:
Only loaded, and mandatory if `layers` is not defined.

The path to the sprite file to use.

properties.name: flags
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: generate_sdf
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Unused.

properties.name: height
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined. Mandatory if `size` is not defined.

Height of the picture in pixels, from 0-4096.

properties.name: invert_colors
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: layers
properties.description:
If this property is present, all Sprite definitions have to be placed as entries in the array, and they will all be loaded from there. `layers` may not be an empty table. Each definition in the array may also have the `layers` property.

If this property is present, all other properties besides `name` and `type` are ignored.

properties.name: load_in_minimal_mode
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Minimal mode is entered when mod loading fails. You are in it when you see the gray box after (part of) the loading screen that tells you a mod error. Modders can ignore this property.

properties.name: mipmap_count
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Only loaded if this is an icon, that is it has the flag `"group=icon"` or `"group=gui"`.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the sprite. Can be used as a [SpritePath](runtime:SpritePath) at runtime.

properties.name: position
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Loaded only when `x` and `y` are both `0`. The first member of the tuple is `x` and the second is `y`.

properties.name: premul_alpha
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Whether alpha should be pre-multiplied.

properties.name: priority
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: rotate_shift
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: scale
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Values other than `1` specify the scale of the sprite on default zoom. A scale of `2` means that the picture will be two times bigger on screen (and thus more pixelated).

properties.name: shift
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

The shift in tiles. `util.by_pixel()` can be used to divide the shift by 32 which is the usual pixel height/width of 1 tile in normal resolution. Note that 32 pixel tile height/width is not enforced anywhere - any other tile height or width is also possible.

properties.name: size
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

The width and height of the sprite. If this is a tuple, the first member of the tuple is the width and the second is the height. Otherwise the size is both width and height. Width and height may only be in the range of 0-4096.

properties.name: surface
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Provides hint to sprite atlas system, so it can try to put sprites that are intended to be used at the same locations to the same sprite atlas.

properties.name: tint
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: tint_as_overlay
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: usage
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Provides hint to sprite atlas system, so it can pack sprites that are related to each other to the same sprite atlas.

properties.name: width
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined. Mandatory if `size` is not defined.

Width of the picture in pixels, from 0-4096.

properties.name: x
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Horizontal position of the sprite in the source file in pixels.

properties.name: y
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Vertical position of the sprite in the source file in pixels.

prototypes.name: StickerPrototype
prototypes.description: Entity that sticks to another entity, and damages/slows it. Stickers can only be attached to [UnitPrototype](prototype:UnitPrototype), [CharacterPrototype](prototype:CharacterPrototype), [CarPrototype](prototype:CarPrototype) and [SpiderVehiclePrototype](prototype:SpiderVehiclePrototype).

properties.name: damage_interval
properties.description: Interval between application of `damage_per_tick`, in ticks.

properties.name: damage_per_tick
properties.description: Applied every `damage_interval` ticks, so may not necessarily be "per tick".

properties.name: duration_in_ticks
properties.description: Must be > 0.

properties.name: ground_target
