properties.description: If true, causes the target entity to become "grounded", disabling flight. This only applies to Character entities wearing mech armor.

properties.name: hidden
properties.description: The `hidden` property of stickers is hardcoded to `true`.

properties.name: hidden_in_factoriopedia
properties.description: The `hidden_in_factoriopedia` property of stickers is hardcoded to `true`.

properties.name: selection_box_type
properties.description: Using this property marks the sticker as a "selection sticker", meaning that the selection box will be rendered around the entity when the sticker is on it.

properties.name: spread_fire_entity
properties.description: If this is given, this sticker is considered a "fire sticker" for some functions, such as [BaseAttackParameters::fire_penalty](prototype:BaseAttackParameters::fire_penalty) and [EntityPrototypeFlags::not-flammable](prototype:EntityPrototypeFlags::not_flammable).

properties.name: target_movement_max
properties.description:
The maximum movement speed for the target.

Negative values are ignored.

properties.name: target_movement_max_from
properties.description:
The maximum movement speed for the target when the sticker is attached. It linearly changes over time to reach `target_movement_max_to`.

Negative values are ignored.

properties.name: target_movement_max_to
properties.description:
The maximum movement speed for the target when the sticker expires. It linearly changes over time starting from `target_movement_max_from`.

Negative values are ignored.

properties.name: target_movement_modifier
properties.description: Less than 1 to reduce movement speed, more than 1 to increase it.

properties.name: target_movement_modifier_from
properties.description: The modifier value when the sticker is attached. It linearly changes over time to reach `target_movement_modifier_to`.

properties.name: target_movement_modifier_to
properties.description: The modifier value when the sticker expires. It linearly changes over time starting from `target_movement_modifier_from`.

properties.name: update_effects
properties.description: Effects (with cooldowns) to trigger every tick.

properties.name: vehicle_friction_modifier_from
properties.description: Works similarly to `target_movement_modifier_from`.

properties.name: vehicle_friction_modifier_to
properties.description: Works similarly to `target_movement_modifier_to`.

properties.name: vehicle_speed_max
properties.description:
The maximum movement speed for vehicles.

Negative values are ignored.

properties.name: vehicle_speed_max_from
properties.description:
The maximum movement speed for vehicles when the sticker is attached. It linearly changes over time to reach `vehicle_speed_max_to`.

Negative values are ignored.

properties.name: vehicle_speed_max_to
properties.description:
The maximum movement speed for vehicles when the sticker expires. It linearly changes over time starting from `vehicle_speed_max_from`.

Negative values are ignored.

properties.name: vehicle_speed_modifier
properties.description: Less than 1 to reduce vehicle speed, more than 1 to increase it.

properties.name: vehicle_speed_modifier_from
properties.description: Works similarly to `target_movement_modifier_from`.

properties.name: vehicle_speed_modifier_to
properties.description: Works similarly to `target_movement_modifier_to`.

prototypes.name: StorageTankPrototype
prototypes.description: A [storage tank](https://wiki.factorio.com/Storage_tank).

properties.name: flow_length_in_ticks
properties.description:
Must be positive.

Used for determining the x position inside the `flow_sprite` when drawing the storage tank. Does not affect gameplay.

The x position of the sprite will be `((game.tick % flow_length_in_ticks)  flow_length_in_ticks)  (flow_sprite.width - 32)`. This means, that over `flow_length_in_ticks` ticks, the part of the `flow_sprite` that is drawn in-game is incrementally moved from most-left to most-right inside the actual sprite, that part always has a width of 32px. After `flow_length_in_ticks`, the part of the `flow_sprite` that is drawn will start from the left again.

properties.name: show_fluid_icon
properties.description: Whether the "alt-mode icon" should be drawn at all.

properties.name: window_bounding_box
properties.description: The location of the window showing the contents. Note that for `window_background` the width and height are determined by the sprite and window_bounding_box only determines the drawing location. For `fluid_background` the width is determined by the sprite and the height and drawing location are determined by window_bounding_box.

prototypes.name: StraightRailPrototype
prototypes.description: A straight rail.

properties.name: collision_box
properties.description: The [collision_box](prototype:EntityPrototype::collision_box) of straight rail is hardcoded to `{{-0.7, -0.99}, {0.7, 0.99}}`.

properties.name: localised_unit_key
properties.description: The locale key of the unit of the property. In-game, the locale is provided the `__1__` parameter, which is the value of the property.

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Path to the icon file.

Mandatory if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icon_size
properties.description:
The size of the square icon, in pixels. E.g. `32` for a 32px by 32px icon. Must be larger than `0`.

Only loaded if `icons` is not defined.

prototypes.name: TechnologyPrototype
prototypes.description: A [technology](https://wiki.factorio.com/Technologies).

properties.name: effects
properties.description: List of effects of the technology (applied when the technology is researched).

properties.name: essential
properties.description: Whether the technology should be shown in the technology tree GUI when "Show only essential technologies" is enabled.

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Path to the icon file.

Mandatory if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icon_size
properties.description:
The size of the square icon, in pixels. E.g. `32` for a 32px by 32px icon. Must be larger than `0`.

The base game uses 256px icons for technologies.

Only loaded if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icons
properties.description: Can't be an empty array.

properties.name: ignore_tech_cost_multiplier
properties.description: Controls whether the technology cost ignores the tech cost multiplier set in the [DifficultySettings](runtime:DifficultySettings). E.g. `4` for the default expensive difficulty.

properties.name: max_level
properties.description:
`"infinite"` for infinite technologies, otherwise `uint32`.

Defaults to the same level as the technology, which is `0` for non-upgrades, and the level of the upgrade for upgrades.

properties.name: name
properties.description: If this name ends with `-<number>`, that number is ignored for localization purposes. E.g. if the name is `technology-3`, the game looks for the `technology-name.technology` localization. The technology tree will also show the number on the technology icon.

properties.name: prerequisites
properties.description: List of technologies needed to be researched before this one can be researched.

properties.name: research_trigger
properties.description: Mandatory if `unit` is not defined.

properties.name: show_levels_info
properties.description: Can be used to enable or disable showing levels info in technology slot.

properties.name: unit
properties.description:
Determines the cost in items and time of the technology.

Mandatory if `research_trigger` is not defined.

properties.name: upgrade
properties.description: When set to true, and the technology contains several levels, only the relevant one is displayed in the technology screen.

properties.name: visible_when_disabled
properties.description: Controls whether the technology is shown in the tech GUI when it is not `enabled`.

properties.name: max_performance
properties.description: `max_performance.fluid_volume` must not be smaller than `min_performance.fluid_volume`.

prototypes.name: TileEffectDefinition
prototypes.description: Used to define the parameters for tile shaders.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the tile-effect.

properties.name: puddle
properties.description: Only loaded, and mandatory if `shader` is `"puddle"`.

properties.name: space
properties.description: Only loaded, and mandatory if `shader` is `"space"`.

properties.name: water
properties.description: Only loaded, and mandatory if `shader` is `"water"`.

prototypes.name: TileGhostPrototype
prototypes.description: The entity used for tile ghosts.
examples:
```
{
  type = "tile-ghost",
  name = "tile-ghost",
  flags = {"not-on-map"},
  minable = { mining_time = 0, results={}},
  collision_box = {{-0.5, -0.5}, {0.5, 0.5}},
  selection_priority = 45
}
```

prototypes.name: TilePrototype
prototypes.description: A [tile](https://wiki.factorio.com/Tile).

properties.name: allowed_neighbors
properties.description: Array of tile names that are allowed next to this one.

properties.name: build_animations
properties.description: The build animation used when this tile is built on a space platform.

properties.name: build_sound
properties.description: If this is loaded as one Sound, it is loaded as the "small" build sound.

properties.name: built_animation_frame
properties.description:
When the build_animations frame reaches this point the tile is built.

Mandatory if `build_animations` is defined.

properties.name: check_collision_with_entities
properties.description: If set to true, the game will check for collisions with entities before building or mining the tile. If entities are in the way it is not possible to mine/build the tile.

properties.name: default_destroyed_dropped_item_trigger
properties.description:
The effect/trigger that runs when an item is destroyed by being dropped on this tile.

If the item defines [its own trigger](prototype:ItemPrototype::destroyed_by_dropping_trigger) it will override this.

If this is defined, `destroys_dropped_items` must be `true`.

properties.name: destroys_dropped_items
properties.description: If items dropped on this tile are destroyed.

properties.name: dying_explosion
properties.description: Triggers when a foundation tile is destroyed by an asteroid.

properties.name: effect_color_secondary
properties.description: Used by the [pollution](https://wiki.factorio.com/Pollution) shader.

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Path to the icon file. If this and `icons` is not set, the `material_background` in `variants` is used as the icon.

Only loaded if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icon_size
properties.description:
The size of the square icon, in pixels. E.g. `32` for a 32px by 32px icon. Must be larger than `0`.

Only loaded if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icons
properties.description: Can't be an empty array. If this and `icon` is not set, the `material_background` in `variants` is used as the icon.

properties.name: layer
properties.description: Specifies transition drawing priority.

properties.name: lowland_fog
properties.description: For surfaces that use [fog effect](prototype:SurfaceRenderParameters::fog) of type `gleba`, this property determines whether given tile should contribute to fog intensity on a chunk or not.

properties.name: max_health
properties.description: Must be equal to or greater than 0.

properties.name: minable
properties.description: If you want the tile to not be mineable, don't specify the minable property. Only non-mineable tiles become hidden tiles when placing mineable tiles on top of them.

properties.name: needs_correction
properties.description: Whether the tile needs tile correction logic applied when it's generated in the world, to prevent graphical artifacts. The tile correction logic disallows 1-wide stripes of the tile, see [Friday Facts #346](https://factorio.com/blog/post/fff-346).

properties.name: transitions
properties.description: Extra transitions.

properties.name: trigger_effect
properties.description: Called by [InvokeTileEffectTriggerEffectItem](prototype:InvokeTileEffectTriggerEffectItem).

properties.name: variants
properties.description: Graphics for this tile.

prototypes.name: TipsAndTricksItem
prototypes.description: A tips and tricks entry.

properties.name: category
properties.description: Name of a [TipsAndTricksItemCategory](prototype:TipsAndTricksItemCategory), used for the sorting of this tips and tricks entry. Tips and trick entries are sorted first by category and then by their `order` within that category.

properties.name: dependencies
properties.description: An array of names of other tips and tricks items. This tips and tricks entry is only shown to the player once they have marked all dependencies as read.

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Path to the icon file.

Only loaded if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icon_size
properties.description:
The size of the square icon, in pixels. E.g. `32` for a 32px by 32px icon. Must be larger than `0`.

Only loaded if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icons
properties.description: Can't be an empty array.

properties.name: indent
properties.description: The tips and tricks entry is indented by `indent`6 spaces.

properties.name: is_title
properties.description: Whether the tip title on the left in the tips and tricks GUI should use the "title_tip_item" style (semi bold font).

properties.name: order
properties.description: Used to order prototypes in inventory, recipes and GUIs. May not exceed a length of 200 characters.

properties.name: skip_trigger
properties.description: Condition for never showing the tip notification to the player.

properties.name: tag
properties.description: String to add in front of the tips and trick entries name. Can be anything, the base game tends to use [rich text](https://wiki.factorio.com/Rich_text) tags for items, e.g. `[item=wooden-chest]` here.

properties.name: trigger
properties.description: Condition for when the tip notification should be shown to the player.

properties.name: tutorial
properties.description: Name of a [TutorialDefinition](prototype:TutorialDefinition).

prototypes.name: TipsAndTricksItemCategory
prototypes.description: A [TipsAndTricksItem](prototype:TipsAndTricksItem) category, used for sorting of tips and tricks entries: Tips and trick entries are sorted first by category and then by their order within that category.

properties.name: order
properties.description: Tips and trick categories are sorted by `order`, and then the tips and tips entries are sorted by their own order within those categories.

prototypes.name: ToolPrototype
prototypes.description: Items with a "durability". Used for [science packs](https://wiki.factorio.com/Science_pack).

properties.name: durability
properties.description: The durability of this tool. Must be positive. Mandatory if `infinite` is false. Ignored if infinite is true.

properties.name: durability_description_key
properties.description: May not be longer than 200 characters.

properties.name: durability_description_value
properties.description:
May not be longer than 200 characters.

In-game, the game provides the locale with three [parameters](https://wiki.factorio.com/Tutorial:Localisation#Localising_with_parameters):

`__1__`: remaining durability

`__2__`: total durability

`__3__`: durability as a percentage

So when a locale key that has the following translation

`Remaining durability is __1__ out of __2__ which is __3__ %`

is applied to a tool with 2 remaining durability out of 8 it will be displayed as

`Remaining durability is 2 out of 8 which is 25 %`

properties.name: infinite
properties.description: Whether this tool has infinite durability. If this is false, `durability` must be specified.

prototypes.name: TrainPathAchievementPrototype
prototypes.description: This prototype is used for receiving an achievement when the player has a specified train path length.

properties.name: minimum_distance
properties.description: The achievement will trigger if a train path is longer than this.

prototypes.name: TrainStopPrototype
prototypes.description: A [train stop](https://wiki.factorio.com/Train_stop).

properties.name: build_grid_size
properties.description: Has to be 2 for 2x2 grid.

prototypes.name: TransportBeltConnectablePrototype
prototypes.description: Abstract class that anything that is a belt or can connect to belts uses.

properties.name: collision_box
properties.description: Transport belt connectable entities must have [collision_box](prototype:EntityPrototype::collision_box) of an appropriate minimal size, they should occupy more than half of every tile the entity covers.

properties.name: flags
properties.description: Transport belt connectable entities cannot have the `"building-direction-8-way"` flag.

properties.name: speed
properties.description:
The speed of the belt: `speed  480 = x Items/second`.

The raw value is expressed as the number of tiles traveled by each item on the belt per tick, relative to the belt's maximum density - e.g. `x items/second  (4 items/lane  2 lanes/belt  60 ticks/second) = <speed> belts/tick` where a "belt" is the size of one tile. See [Transport_belts/Physics](https://wiki.factorio.com/Transport_belts/Physics) for more details.

Must be a positive non-infinite number. The number is a fixed point number with 8 bits reserved for decimal precision, meaning the smallest value step is `1/2^8 = 0.00390625`. In the simple case of a non-curved belt, the rate is multiples of `1.875` items/s, even though the entity tooltip may show a different rate.

prototypes.name: TransportBeltPrototype
prototypes.description: A [transport belt](https://wiki.factorio.com/Transport_belt).

properties.name: circuit_connector
properties.description: Set of 7 [circuit connector definitions](prototype:CircuitConnectorDefinition) in order: X, H, V, SE, SW, NE and NW.

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

properties.name: related_underground_belt
properties.description: The name of the [UndergroundBeltPrototype](prototype:UndergroundBeltPrototype) which is used in quick-replace fashion when the smart belt dragging behavior is triggered.

prototypes.name: TreePrototype
prototypes.description: A [tree](https://wiki.factorio.com/Tree).

properties.name: colors
properties.description: Mandatory if `variations` is defined.

properties.name: healing_per_tick
properties.description: The amount of health automatically regenerated. Trees will regenerate every 60 ticks with `healing_per_tick  60`.

properties.name: pictures
properties.description: Mandatory if `variations` is not defined.

properties.name: variations
properties.description: If defined, it can't be empty.

prototypes.name: TriggerTargetType
prototypes.description: The base game always internally defines a "common" trigger target type. See [Design discussion: Trigger target type](https://forums.factorio.com/71657).

prototypes.name: TrivialSmokePrototype
prototypes.description: Smoke, but it's not an entity for optimization purposes.

properties.name: affected_by_wind
properties.description: Smoke always moves randomly unless `movement_slow_down_factor` is 0. If `affected_by_wind` is true, the smoke will also be moved by wind.

properties.name: duration
properties.description: Can't be 0 - the smoke will never render.

properties.name: fade_away_duration
properties.description: `fade_in_duration` + `fade_away_duration` must be <= `duration`.

properties.name: fade_in_duration
properties.description: `fade_in_duration` + `fade_away_duration` must be <= `duration`.

properties.name: movement_slow_down_factor
properties.description: Value between 0 and 1, with 1 being no slowdown and 0 being no movement.

prototypes.name: TurretPrototype
prototypes.description: A turret that needs no extra ammunition. See the children for turrets that need some kind of ammunition.

properties.name: attack_parameters
properties.description: Requires ammo_type in attack_parameters unless this is a [AmmoTurretPrototype](prototype:AmmoTurretPrototype).

properties.name: attacking_speed
properties.description: Controls the speed of the attacking_animation: `1  attacking_speed = duration of the attacking_animation`

properties.name: circuit_connector
properties.description: Set of [circuit connector definitions](prototype:CircuitConnectorDefinition) for all directions used by this turret. Required amount of elements is based on other prototype values: 8 elements if building-direction-8-way flag is set, or 16 elements if building-direction-16-way flag is set, or 4 elements if turret_base_has_direction is set to true, or 1 element.

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

properties.name: ending_attack_speed
properties.description: Controls the speed of the ending_attack_animation: `1  ending_attack_speed = duration of the ending_attack_animation`

properties.name: energy_glow_animation_flicker_strength
properties.description: The range of the flickering of the alpha of `energy_glow_animation`. Default is range 0.2, so animation alpha can be anywhere between 0.8 and 1.0.

properties.name: folded_speed
properties.description:
It's randomized whether a particular turret uses the primary or the secondary speed for its animations.

Controls the speed of the folded_animation: `1  folded_speed = duration of the folded_animation`

properties.name: folded_speed_secondary
properties.description:
It's randomized whether a particular turret uses the primary or the secondary speed for its animations.

Controls the speed of the folded_animation: `1  folded_speed_secondary = duration of the folded_animation`

properties.name: folding_speed
properties.description: Controls the speed of the folding_animation: `1  folding_speed = duration of the folding_animation`

properties.name: glow_light_intensity
properties.description: The intensity of light in the form of `energy_glow_animation` drawn on top of `energy_glow_animation`.

properties.name: is_military_target
properties.description: Whether this prototype should be a high priority target for enemy forces. See [Military units and structures](https://wiki.factorio.com/Military_units_and_structures).

properties.name: prepared_alternative_chance
properties.description: The chance for `prepared_alternative_animation` to be used.

properties.name: prepared_alternative_speed
properties.description:
It's randomized whether a particular turret uses the primary or the secondary speed for its animations.

Controls the speed of the prepared_alternative_animation: `1  prepared_alternative_speed = duration of the prepared_alternative_animation`

properties.name: prepared_alternative_speed_secondary
properties.description:
It's randomized whether a particular turret uses the primary or the secondary speed for its animations.

Controls the speed of the prepared_alternative_animation: `1  prepared_alternative_speed_secondary = duration of the prepared_alternative_animation`

properties.name: prepared_speed
properties.description:
It's randomized whether a particular turret uses the primary or the secondary speed for its animations.

Controls the speed of the prepared_animation: `1  prepared_speed = duration of the prepared_animation`

properties.name: prepared_speed_secondary
properties.description:
It's randomized whether a particular turret uses the primary or the secondary speed for its animations.

Controls the speed of the prepared_animation: `1  prepared_speed_secondary = duration of the prepared_animation`

properties.name: preparing_speed
properties.description: Controls the speed of the preparing_animation: `1  preparing_speed = duration of the preparing_animation`

properties.name: spawn_decoration
properties.description: Decoratives to be created when the spawner is created by the [map generator](https://wiki.factorio.com/Map_generator). Placed when enemies expand if `spawn_decorations_on_expansion` is set to true.

properties.name: spawn_decorations_on_expansion
properties.description: Whether `spawn_decoration` should be spawned when this turret is created through [enemy expansion](https://wiki.factorio.com/Enemies#Expansions).

properties.name: start_attacking_only_when_can_shoot
properties.description: When `false` the turret will enter `starting_attack` state without checking its ammo or energy levels. [FluidTurretPrototype](prototype:FluidTurretPrototype) forces this to `true`.

properties.name: starting_attack_speed
properties.description: Controls the speed of the starting_attack_animation: `1  starting_attack_speed = duration of the starting_attack_animation`

properties.name: turret_base_has_direction
properties.description: When `true` the turret's collision box will affected by its rotation.

prototypes.name: TutorialDefinition
prototypes.description: The definition of the tutorial to be used in the tips and tricks, see [TipsAndTricksItem](prototype:TipsAndTricksItem). The actual tutorial scripting code is defined in the tutorial scenario. The scenario must be placed in the `tutorials` folder in the mod.

properties.name: order
properties.description: Used to order prototypes in inventory, recipes and GUIs. May not exceed a length of 200 characters.

properties.name: scenario
properties.description: Name of the folder for this tutorial scenario in the [`tutorials` folder](https://wiki.factorio.com/Tutorial:Mod_structure#Subfolders).

prototypes.name: UndergroundBeltPrototype
prototypes.description: An [underground belt](https://wiki.factorio.com/Underground_belt).

prototypes.name: UnitPrototype
prototypes.description: Entity that moves around and attacks players, for example [biters and spitters](https://wiki.factorio.com/Enemies#Creatures).

properties.name: allow_run_time_change_of_is_military_target
properties.description: If this is true, this entities `is_military_target property` can be changed runtime (on the entity, not on the prototype itself).

properties.name: attack_parameters
properties.description: Requires animation in attack_parameters. Requires ammo_type in attack_parameters.

properties.name: distance_per_frame
properties.description:
How fast the `run_animation` frames are advanced. The animations are advanced animation_speed frames per `distance_per_frame` that the unit moves.

`frames_advanced = (distance_moved  distance_per_frame) * animation_speed`

properties.name: dying_sound
properties.description: The sound file to play when entity dies.

properties.name: has_belt_immunity
properties.description: If the unit is immune to movement by belts.

properties.name: is_military_target
properties.description: Whether this prototype should be a high priority target for enemy forces. See [Military units and structures](https://wiki.factorio.com/Military_units_and_structures).

properties.name: min_pursue_time
properties.description: In ticks.

properties.name: movement_speed
properties.description: Movement speed of the unit in the world, in tiles per tick. Must be equal to or greater than 0.

properties.name: running_sound_animation_positions
properties.description: Only loaded if `walking_sound` is defined.

properties.name: vision_distance
properties.description:
Max is 100.

Note: Setting to 50 or above can lead to undocumented behavior of individual units creating groups on their own when attacking or being attacked.

properties.name: warcry
properties.description: A sound the unit makes when it sets out to attack.

prototypes.name: UpgradeItemPrototype

properties.name: alt_select

The filters are parsed, but then ignored and forced to be empty.

properties.name: always_include_tiles

properties.name: draw_label_for_cursor_render

properties.name: select
properties.description:
The [SelectionModeData::mode](prototype:SelectionModeData::mode) is hardcoded to `"upgrade"`.

The filters are parsed, but then ignored and forced to be empty.

properties.name: stack_size
properties.description: Count of items of the same name that can be stored in one inventory slot. Must be 1 when the `"not-stackable"` flag is set.

prototypes.name: UseEntityInEnergyProductionAchievementPrototype

prototypes.name: UseItemAchievementPrototype

properties.name: limited_to_one_game

properties.name: to_use

prototypes.name: UtilityConstants
prototypes.description: Constants used by the game that are not specific to certain prototypes. See [utility-constants.lua](https://github.com/wube/factorio-data/blob/master/core/prototypes/utility-constants.lua) for the values used by the base game.

properties.name: blueprint_big_slots_per_row

properties.name: blueprint_small_slots_per_row

properties.name: bonus_gui_ordering

properties.name: capture_water_mask_at_layer
properties.description: Layer within `ground-natural` [tile render layer](prototype:TileRenderLayer) group, before which terrain lightmap alpha channel is copied into water mask. Decals, which need to be masked by water should have their [DecorativePrototype::tile_layer](prototype:DecorativePrototype::tile_layer) set to only slightly larger value than `capture_water_mask_at_layer`, to avoid risk of undefined behavior caused by rendering tiles into layers between `capture_water_mask_at_layer` and decal's `tile_layer`.

properties.name: chart
properties.description: Chart means map and minimap.

properties.name: crafting_queue_slots_per_row

properties.name: default_collision_masks

properties.name: default_pipeline_extent

properties.name: default_planet_procession_set

properties.name: default_platform_procession_set
properties.description: Must contain arrival and departure with [procession_style](prototype:ProcessionPrototype::procession_style) containing 0.

properties.name: default_trigger_target_mask_by_type

properties.name: ejected_item_direction_variation

properties.name: ejected_item_friction
properties.description: Silently clamped to be between 0 and 1.

properties.name: ejected_item_lifetime

properties.name: ejected_item_speed
properties.description: Silently clamped to be between 0 and 1/60.

properties.name: flying_text_ttl

properties.name: inserter_hand_stack_items_per_sprite

properties.name: inserter_hand_stack_max_sprites

properties.name: inventory_width

properties.name: item_health_bar_colors

properties.name: landing_area_clear_zone_radius
properties.description: Radius of area where cargo pods won't land.

properties.name: landing_area_max_radius
properties.description: Max radius where cargo pods will land.

properties.name: light_renderer_search_distance_limit
properties.description: Can be set to anything from range 0 to 255, but larger values will be clamped to 160. Setting it to larger values can have performance impact (growing geometrically).

properties.name: logistic_slots_per_row
properties.description: Will be clamped to the range [2, 100].

properties.name: main_menu_simulations

properties.name: max_belt_stack_size
properties.description: Must be >= 1.

properties.name: module_inventory_width
properties.description: Will be clamped to the range [1, 100].

properties.name: moving_sound_count_reduction_rate

properties.name: select_group_row_count

properties.name: space_platform_dump_cooldown

properties.name: space_platform_manual_dump_cooldown

properties.name: space_platform_max_relative_speed_deviation_for_asteroid_chunks_update
properties.description: Space platform remembers relative speed range which asteroids use while it moves. When the range is larger than the specified deviation, the platform will start updating cached trajectories of all asteroid chunks over multiple ticks.

properties.name: time_to_show_full_health_bar
properties.description: The number of ticks to show a segmented unit's health bar after fully regenerating.

properties.name: tooltip_monitor_edge_border
properties.description: Must be >= 1.

properties.name: trash_inventory_width
properties.description: Will be clamped to the range [1, 100].

properties.name: walking_sound_count_reduction_rate
properties.description: Silently clamped to be between 0 and 1.

prototypes.description: Sounds used by the game that are not specific to certain prototypes.

properties.name: segment_dying_sound
properties.description: Only present when the Space Age mod is loaded.

prototypes.name: UtilitySprites
prototypes.description: Sprites used by the game that are not specific to certain prototypes.

properties.name: fluid_icon
properties.description: The sprite will be drawn on top of [fluid turrets](prototype:FluidTurretPrototype) that are out of fluid ammunition and don't have [FluidTurretPrototype::out_of_ammo_alert_icon](prototype:FluidTurretPrototype::out_of_ammo_alert_icon) set.

properties.name: platform_entity_build_animations
properties.description: Only present when the Space Age mod is loaded.

prototypes.name: ValvePrototype
prototypes.description: A passive device that provides limited control of fluid flow between pipelines.

properties.name: flow_rate
properties.description: The max flow rate through the valve per tick.

properties.name: fluid_box
properties.description: Must have at least one `"output"` [FluidFlowDirection](prototype:FluidFlowDirection) and at least one `input-output` [FluidFlowDirection](prototype:FluidFlowDirection).

properties.name: threshold
properties.description: Ignored if [ValvePrototype::mode](prototype:ValvePrototype::mode) is `"one-way"`. Must be between `0` and `1` inclusive.

prototypes.name: VehiclePrototype
prototypes.description: Abstract base of all vehicles.

properties.name: allow_passengers
properties.description: Determines whether this vehicle accepts passengers. This includes both drivers and gunners, if applicable.

properties.name: braking_power
properties.description: Must be positive. There is no functional difference between the two ways to set braking power/force.

properties.name: deliver_category
properties.description: Name of a [DeliverCategory](prototype:DeliverCategory).

properties.name: energy_per_hit_point
properties.description: The (movement) energy used per hit point (1 hit point = 1 health damage) taken and dealt for this vehicle during collisions. The smaller the number, the more damage this vehicle and the rammed entity take during collisions: `damage = energy / energy_per_hit_point`.

properties.name: equipment_grid
properties.description: The name of the [EquipmentGridPrototype](prototype:EquipmentGridPrototype) this vehicle has.

properties.name: friction
properties.description: Must be positive. There is no functional difference between the two ways to set friction force.

properties.name: minimap_representation
properties.description: The sprite that represents this vehicle on the map/minimap.

properties.name: selected_minimap_representation
properties.description: The sprite that represents this vehicle on the map/minimap when it is selected.

properties.name: terrain_friction_modifier
properties.description: Must be in the [0, 1] interval.

properties.name: weight
properties.description: Must be positive. Weight of the entity used for physics calculation when car hits something.

prototypes.name: VirtualSignalPrototype
prototypes.description: A [virtual signal](https://wiki.factorio.com/Circuit_network#Virtual_signals).

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Path to the icon file that is used to represent this virtual signal.

Mandatory if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icon_size
properties.description:
The size of the square icon, in pixels. E.g. `32` for a 32px by 32px icon. Must be larger than `0`.

Only loaded if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icons
properties.description: The icon that is used to represent this virtual signal. Can't be an empty array.

prototypes.name: WallPrototype
prototypes.description: A [wall](https://wiki.factorio.com/Wall).

properties.name: circuit_wire_max_distance
properties.description: The maximum circuit wire distance for this entity.

properties.name: visual_merge_group
properties.description: Different walls will visually connect to each other if their merge group is the same.

properties.name: equipment
properties.description: Activation is only implemented for [ActiveDefenseEquipmentPrototype](prototype:ActiveDefenseEquipmentPrototype).

properties.name: deliver_category
properties.description: Name of a [DeliverCategory](prototype:DeliverCategory).

types.name: ActiveTriggerID
types.description: The name of an [ActiveTriggerPrototype](prototype:ActiveTriggerPrototype).

properties.name: minimum
properties.description: Cannot be larger than `maximum`.

properties.name: attenuation
properties.description: Volume reduction (fade-out) controlled by distance (fraction of audible distance).

properties.name: darkness_threshold
properties.description:
Has to be in the range [-1.0, 1.0].

Positive values are used for night sounds, the volume of the sound is 1.0 when darkness = threshold, 0.0 when darkness = 0.0 and linearly interpolated in between.

Negative values are used for day sounds, the sound of the sound is 0.0  when darkness = -threshold, 1.0 when darkness = 1.0 and linearly interpolated in between.

properties.name: fades
properties.description: Volume reduction (fade-out) or increase (fade-in) controlled by zoom level.

properties.name: count_already_playing
properties.description: If `true`, already playing sounds are taken into account when checking `max_count`.

properties.name: progress_threshold
properties.description: If `count_already_playing` is `true`, this will determine maximum progress when instance is counted toward playing sounds.

properties.name: remove
properties.description:
If `false`, the volume of sound instances above `max_count` is calculated according to the formula `volume = (x + 1) ^ (-volume_reduction_rate)`, where `x` is the order number of an instance above the threshold.

If `true`, sound instances above `max_count` are removed.

properties.name: volume_reduction_rate
properties.description: Has to be greater than or equal to 0.0.

properties.name: operation_angle
properties.description: In degrees.

properties.name: extension_speed
properties.description: Must be positive.

properties.name: turn_rate
properties.description: May not be 0.

properties.name: extension_speed
properties.description: Must be positive.

properties.name: horizontal_turn_rate
properties.description: May not be 0.

properties.name: vertical_turn_rate
properties.description: May not be 0.

types.name: AirbornePollutantID
types.description: The name of an [AirbornePollutantPrototype](prototype:AirbornePollutantPrototype).

types.name: Alignment
types.description: A string that specifies where a GUI element should be.

types.name: AmbientSoundType
types.description: Lets the game know in what instances the audio file is played.

options.description: This track is only played in the main menu.
This track is played interleaved (alternating) with `"interlude"` tracks.
This track is played when a character steps on a new surface for the first time. Only one `"hero-track"` per planet or space platform is allowed.
This track is played interleaved (alternating) with `"main-track"` tracks.

types.name: AmmoCategoryID
types.description: The name of an [AmmoCategory](prototype:AmmoCategory).

properties.name: ammo_category
properties.description: Name of the [AmmoCategory](prototype:AmmoCategory) that is affected.

properties.name: infer_icon
properties.description: If set to `false`, use the icon from [UtilitySprites](prototype:UtilitySprites) for this technology effect icon.

properties.name: modifier
properties.description: Modification value, which will be added to the current ammo damage modifier upon researching.

properties.name: use_icon_overlay_constant
properties.description: If `false`, do not draw the small "constant" icon over the technology effect icon.

types.name: AmmoSourceType
types.description:
Used to allow specifying different ammo effects depending on which kind of entity the ammo is used in.

If ammo is used in an entity that isn't covered by the defined source_types, e.g. only `"player"` and `"vehicle"` are defined and the ammo is used by a turret, the first defined AmmoType in the [AmmoItemPrototype::ammo_type](prototype:AmmoItemPrototype::ammo_type) array is used.

types.name: AmmoType
types.description: Definition of actual parameters used in attack.

properties.name: action
properties.description: Describes actions taken upon attack happening.

properties.name: clamp_position
properties.description: When true, the gun will be able to shoot even when the target is out of range. Only applies when `target_type` equals `"position"`. The gun will fire at the maximum range in the direction of the target position.

properties.name: energy_consumption
properties.description: Energy consumption of a single shot, if applicable.

properties.name: range_modifier
properties.description:
Affects the `range` value of the shooting gun prototype's [BaseAttackParameters](prototype:BaseAttackParameters) to give a modified maximum range. The `min_range` value of the gun is unaffected.

This has no effect on artillery turrets and wagons even though the bonus appears in the GUI. [Forum thread](https://forums.factorio.com/103658).

properties.name: source_type
properties.description:
Only exists (and is then mandatory) if the [AmmoItemPrototype::ammo_type](prototype:AmmoItemPrototype::ammo_type) this AmmoType is defined on has multiple ammo types.

Defines for which kind of entity this ammo type applies. Each entity kind can only be used once per array.

properties.name: target_filter
properties.description: List of entities that can be targeted by this ammo type.

properties.name: target_type
properties.description:
`"entity"` fires at an entity, `"position"` fires directly at a position, `"direction"` fires in a direction.

If this is `"entity"`, `clamp_position` is forced to be `false`.

properties.name: triggers
properties.description: If all of the triggers are fulfilled, this trigger is considered fulfilled.

properties.name: render_layer
properties.description: Default render layer for the rotations.

types.name: Animation
types.description:
Specifies an animation that can be used in the game.

Note that if any frame of the animation is specified from the same source as any other [Sprite](prototype:Sprite) or frame of other animation, it will be shared.
examples:
```
-- simple animation
horizontal_animation =
{
  filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/steam-engine/steam-engine-H.png",
  width = 352,
  height = 257,
  frame_count = 32,
  line_length = 8,
  shift = {0.03125, -0.1484375}
}
```

properties.name: filename
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined. Mandatory if neither `stripes` nor `filenames` are defined.

The path to the sprite file to use.

properties.name: filenames
properties.description: Only loaded if neither `layers` nor `stripes` are defined.

properties.name: layers
properties.description:
If this property is present, all Animation definitions have to be placed as entries in the array, and they will all be loaded from there. `layers` may not be an empty table. Each definition in the array may also have the `layers` property.

`animation_speed` and `max_advance` of the first layer are used for all layers. All layers will run at the same speed.

If this property is present, all other properties, including those inherited from AnimationParameters, are ignored.

properties.name: lines_per_file
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined. Mandatory if `filenames` is defined.

properties.name: slice
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined and if `filenames` is defined.

properties.name: stripes
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

types.name: Animation4Way
types.description: If this is loaded as a single Animation, it applies to all directions. Any direction that is not defined defaults to the north animation.

properties.name: secondary_draw_order
properties.description: Used to determine render order for sprites with the same `render_layer` in the same position. Sprites with a higher `secondary_draw_order` are drawn on top.

types.name: AnimationFrameSequence
types.description:
This is a list of 1-based frame indices into the spritesheet. The actual length of the animation will then be the length of the frame_sequence (times `repeat_count`, plus the length minus two if `run_mode` is `"forward-then-backward"`). There is a limit for (actual) animation length of 255 frames.

Indices can be used in any order, repeated or not used at all. Unused frames are not loaded into VRAM at all, frames referenced multiple times are loaded just once, see [here](https://forums.factorio.com/53202).
examples:
```
-- Trivial example - frame_sequence defines same sequence in which the animation would load by default,
-- so it is useless in this case:
frame_count = 4,
frame_sequence = { 1, 2, 3, 4 }
```

```
-- Usage example - first five times repeat frame 2, then alternate between 4 and 3 two times. Frame 1 is not used:
frame_count = 4,
frame_sequence = { 2, 2, 2, 2, 2, 4, 3, 4, 3 }
```

properties.name: animation_speed
properties.description: Modifier of the animation playing speed, the default of `1` means one animation frame per tick (60 fps). The speed of playing can often vary depending on the usage (output of steam engine for example). Has to be greater than `0`.

properties.name: dice
properties.description: Number of slices this is sliced into when using the "optimized atlas packing" option. If you are a modder, you can just ignore this property. Example: If this is 4, the sprite will be sliced into a 44 grid.

properties.name: dice_x
properties.description: Same as `dice` above, but this specifies only how many slices there are on the x axis.

properties.name: dice_y
properties.description: Same as `dice` above, but this specifies only how many slices there are on the y axis.

properties.name: frame_count
properties.description: Can't be `0`.

properties.name: generate_sdf
properties.description: Unused.

properties.name: height
properties.description:
Mandatory if `size` is not defined.

Height of one frame in pixels, from 0-4096.

properties.name: line_length
properties.description: Specifies how many pictures are on each horizontal line in the image file. `0` means that all the pictures are in one horizontal line. Once the specified number of pictures are loaded from a line, the pictures from the next line are loaded. This is to allow having longer animations loaded in to Factorio's graphics matrix than the game engine's width limit of 8192px per input file. The restriction on input files is to be compatible with most graphics cards.

properties.name: max_advance
properties.description: Maximum amount of frames the animation can move forward in one update. Useful to cap the animation speed on entities where it is variable, such as car animations.

properties.name: mipmap_count
properties.description:
Only loaded if this is an icon, that is it has the flag `"group=icon"` or `"group=gui"`.

Note that `mipmap_count` doesn't make sense in an animation, as it is not possible to layout mipmaps in a way that would load both the animation and the mipmaps correctly (besides animations with just one frame). See [here](https://forums.factorio.com/viewtopic.php?p=549058#p549058).

properties.name: repeat_count
properties.description: How many times to repeat the animation to complete an animation cycle. E.g. if one layer is 10 frames, a second layer of 1 frame would need `repeat_count = 10` to match the complete cycle.

properties.name: size
properties.description: The width and height of one frame. If this is a tuple, the first member of the tuple is the width and the second is the height. Otherwise the size is both width and height. Width and height may only be in the range of 0-4096.

properties.name: width
properties.description:
Mandatory if `size` is not defined.

Width of one frame in pixels, from 0-4096.

options.description: Does not repeat the first and last frame when running backwards.

properties.name: filename
properties.description:
Only loaded, and mandatory if `filenames` is not defined.

The path to the animation file to use.

properties.name: lines_per_file
properties.description: Mandatory if `filenames` is defined.

types.name: AnimationVariations
examples:
```
-- array of animations
animations =
{
  {
    filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/explosion-gunshot/explosion-gunshot.png",
    draw_as_glow = true,
    priority = "extra-high",
    width = 34,
    height = 38,
    frame_count = 2,
    animation_speed = 1.5,
    shift = {0, 0}
  },
  {
    filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/explosion-gunshot/explosion-gunshot.png",
    draw_as_glow = true,
    priority = "extra-high",
    width = 34,
    height = 38,
    x = 34 * 2,
    frame_count = 2,
    animation_speed = 1.5,
    shift = {0, 0}
  },
  -- [...]
}
```

```
-- animation sheet using "sheet"
pictures =
{
  sheet =
  {
    filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/character/footprints.png",
    line_length = 2,
    frame_count = 2,
    width = 30,
    height = 22,
    shift = util.by_pixel(0.25, 0.25),
    scale = 0.5,
    variation_count = 8
  }
}
```

properties.name: sheet
properties.description: The variations are arranged vertically in the file, one row for each variation.

properties.name: sheets
properties.description: Only loaded if `sheet` is not defined.

types.name: AnyPrototype
types.description:
A union of all prototypes. A specific prototype is loaded based on the value of the `type` key.

See the [Prototypes page](prototype:prototypes) for more information.

properties.name: infer_icon
properties.description: If set to `false`, use the icon from [UtilitySprites](prototype:UtilitySprites) for this technology effect icon.

properties.name: use_icon_overlay_constant
properties.description: If `false`, do not draw the small "constant" icon over the technology effect icon.

properties.name: flare
properties.description: Name of an [ArtilleryFlarePrototype](prototype:ArtilleryFlarePrototype).

properties.name: direction_deviation
properties.description: Maximum deviation of the projectile from source orientation, in +/- (`x radians / 2`). Example: `3.14 radians -> +/- (180 / 2)`, meaning up to 90 deviation in either direction of rotation.

properties.name: projectile
properties.description: Name of a [ArtilleryProjectilePrototype](prototype:ArtilleryProjectilePrototype).

types.name: AsteroidChunkID
types.description: The name of an [AsteroidChunkPrototype](prototype:AsteroidChunkPrototype).

properties.name: angle_when_stopped
properties.description: Facing the north. Must be in `[0, 1]` range.

properties.name: probability
properties.description: Must be >= 0.

properties.name: speed
properties.description: Must be > 0.

types.name: AttackParameters
types.description: Loaded as one of the [BaseAttackParameters](prototype:BaseAttackParameters) extensions, based on the value of the `type` key.

types.name: AutoplaceControlID
types.description: The name of an [AutoplaceControl](prototype:AutoplaceControl).

properties.name: settings
properties.description: Overrides the FrequencySizeRichness provided to the [AutoplaceSpecification](prototype:AutoplaceSpecification) of the entity/tile/decorative. Takes priority over the FrequencySizeRichness set in the [autoplace control](prototype:AutoplaceSpecification::control).

properties.name: treat_missing_as_default
properties.description: Whether missing autoplace names for this type should be default enabled.

types.name: AutoplaceSpecification
types.description:
Autoplace specification is used to determine which entities are placed when generating map. Currently it is used for enemy bases, tiles, resources and other entities (trees, fishes, etc.).

Autoplace specification describe conditions for placing tiles, entities, and decoratives during surface generation. Autoplace specification defines probability of placement on any given tile and richness, which has different meaning depending on the thing being placed.

properties.name: control
properties.description: Name of the [AutoplaceControl](prototype:AutoplaceControl) (row in the map generator GUI) that applies to this entity.

properties.name: default_enabled
properties.description:
Indicates whether the thing should be placed even if [MapGenSettings](runtime:MapGenSettings) do not provide frequency/size/richness for it. (either for the specific prototype or for the control named by AutoplaceSpecification.control).

If true, normal frequency/size/richness (`value=1`) are used in that case. Otherwise it is treated as if 'none' were selected.

properties.name: force
properties.description: Force of the placed entity. Can be a custom force name. Only relevant for [EntityWithOwnerPrototype](prototype:EntityWithOwnerPrototype).

properties.name: local_expressions
properties.description:
A map of expression name to expression. Used by `probability_expression` and `richness_expression`.

Local expressions are meant to store data locally similar to local variables in Lua. Their purpose is to hold noise expressions used multiple times in the named noise expression, or just to tell the reader that the local expression has a specific purpose. Local expressions can access other local definitions and also function parameters, but recursive definitions aren't supported.

properties.name: local_functions
properties.description:
A map of function name to function. Used by `probability_expression` and `richness_expression`.

Local functions serve the same purpose as local expressions - they aren't visible outside of the specific prototype and they have access to other local definitions.

properties.name: order
properties.description: Order for placing the entity (has no effect when placing tiles). Entities whose order compares less are placed earlier (this influences placing multiple entities which collide with itself), from entities with equal order string only one with the highest probability is placed.

properties.name: placement_density
properties.description: For entities and decoratives, how many times to attempt to place on each tile. Probability and collisions are taken into account each attempt.

properties.name: probability_expression
properties.description: Provides a noise expression that will be evaluated at every point on the map to determine probability.

properties.name: richness_expression
properties.description: If specified, provides a noise expression that will be evaluated to determine richness. Otherwise, `probability_expression` will be used instead.

properties.name: tile_restriction
properties.description: Restricts tiles or tile transitions the entity can appear on.

types.name: BaseAttackParameters
types.description: The abstract base of all [AttackParameters](prototype:AttackParameters).

properties.name: activation_type
properties.description:
Used in tooltips to set the tooltip category. It is also used to get the locale keys for activation instructions and speed of the action for the tooltip.

For example, an activation_type of "throw" will result in the tooltip category "thrown" and the tooltip locale keys "gui.instruction-to-throw" and "description.throwing-speed".

properties.name: ammo_categories
properties.description: Mandatory if `ammo_category` is not defined.

properties.name: ammo_category
properties.description: Mandatory if `ammo_categories` is not defined.

properties.name: ammo_consumption_modifier
properties.description: Must be greater than or equal to `0`.

properties.name: ammo_type
properties.description: Can be mandatory.

properties.name: cooldown
properties.description: Number of ticks in which it will be possible to shoot again. If < 1, multiple shots can be performed in one tick.

properties.name: cooldown_deviation
properties.description: Must be between `0` and `1`.

properties.name: cyclic_sound
properties.description: Played during the attack.

properties.name: fire_penalty
properties.description: Used when searching for the nearest enemy, when this is > 0, enemies that aren't burning are preferred over burning enemies. Definition of "burning" for this: Entity has sticker attached to it, and the sticker has a [spread_fire_entity](prototype:StickerPrototype::spread_fire_entity) set.

properties.name: health_penalty
properties.description: A higher penalty will discourage turrets from targeting units with higher health. A negative penalty will encourage turrets to target units with higher health.

properties.name: lead_target_for_projectile_delay
properties.description: Setting this to anything but zero causes projectiles to aim for the predicted location based on enemy movement instead of the current enemy location. If set, this property adds a flat number of ticks atop `lead_target_for_projectile_speed` that the shooter must lead.

properties.name: lead_target_for_projectile_speed
properties.description: Setting this to anything but zero causes homing projectiles to aim for the predicted location based on enemy movement instead of the current enemy location. If set, this property specifies the distance travelled per tick of the fired projectile.
examples:
```
-- this is same as particle horizontal speed of flamethrower fire stream
lead_target_for_projectile_speed = 0.2* 0.75 * 1.5
```

properties.name: min_attack_distance
properties.description: If less than `range`, the entity will choose a random distance between `range` and `min_attack_distance` and attack from that distance.

properties.name: min_range
properties.description: The minimum distance (in tiles) between an entity and target. If a unit's target is less than this, the unit will attempt to move away before attacking. A [flamethrower turret](https://wiki.factorio.com/Flamethrower_turret) does not move, but has a minimum range. Less than this, it is unable to target an enemy.

properties.name: range
properties.description: Before an entity can attack, the distance (in tiles) between the entity and target must be less than or equal to this.

properties.name: rotate_penalty
properties.description: A higher penalty will discourage turrets from targeting units that would take longer to turn to face.

properties.name: sound
properties.description: Played once at the start of the attack if these are [ProjectileAttackParameters](prototype:ProjectileAttackParameters).

properties.name: true_collinear_ejection
properties.description: Projectile will be creation position and orientation will be collinear with shooter and target (unless offset projectile center is specified). Used for railgun turrets to avoid unexpected friendly fire incidents.

properties.name: turn_range
properties.description: If this is <= 0, it is set to 1. Arc from 0 to 1, so for example 0.25 is 90. Used by the [flamethrower turret](https://wiki.factorio.com/Flamethrower_turret) in the base game. Arcs greater than 0.5 but less than 1 will be clamped to 0.5 as targeting in arcs larger than half circle is [not implemented](https://forums.factorio.com/94654).

properties.name: warmup
properties.description:
Number of ticks it takes for the weapon to actually shoot after the order for shooting has been made. This also allows to "adjust" the shooting animation to the effect of shooting.

[CapsuleActions](prototype:CapsuleAction) cannot have attack parameters with non-zero warmup.

types.name: BaseEnergySource
types.description: The abstract base of all [EnergySources](prototype:EnergySource). Specifies the way an entity gets its energy.

properties.name: emissions_per_minute
properties.description: The pollution an entity emits per minute at full energy consumption. This is exactly the value that is shown in the entity tooltip.

properties.name: render_no_network_icon
properties.description: Whether to render the "no network" icon if the entity is not connected to an electric network.

properties.name: render_no_power_icon
properties.description: Whether to render the "no power" icon if the entity is low on power. Also applies to the "no fuel" icon when using burner energy sources.

types.name: BaseModifier
types.description: The abstract base of all [Modifiers](prototype:Modifier).

properties.name: icon
properties.description:
Path to the icon file.

Only loaded if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icon_size
properties.description:
The size of the square icon, in pixels. E.g. `32` for a 32px by 32px icon. Must be larger than `0`.

Only loaded if `icons` is not defined.

properties.name: icons
properties.description: Can't be an empty array.

types.name: BaseStyleSpecification
types.description: The abstract base of all [StyleSpecifications](prototype:StyleSpecification).
examples:
```
-- Adding a custom frame_style-type style via GuiStyle
data.raw["gui-style"]["default"]["custom_style_for_a_frame"] =
{
  type = "frame_style",
  parent = "frame",
  use_header_filler = false,
  drag_by_title = false
}
```

properties.name: effect
properties.description: Name of a custom GUI effect, which are hard-coded in the game's engine. Only has one option currently.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Sets `minimal_height`, `maximal_height` and `natural_height` to the same value.

properties.name: margin
properties.description: Sets `top_margin`, `right_margin`, `bottom_margin` and `left_margin` to the same value.

properties.name: maximal_height
properties.description: Maximal height ensures that the widget will never be bigger than than that size. It can't be stretched to be bigger.

properties.name: maximal_width
properties.description: Maximal width ensures that the widget will never be bigger than than that size. It can't be stretched to be bigger.

properties.name: minimal_height
properties.description: Minimal height ensures that the widget will never be smaller than than that size. It can't be squashed to be smaller.

properties.name: minimal_width
properties.description: Minimal width ensures that the widget will never be smaller than than that size. It can't be squashed to be smaller.

properties.name: natural_height
properties.description: Natural height specifies the height of the element tries to have, but it can still be squashed/stretched to have a different size.

properties.name: natural_size
properties.description: If this is a tuple, the first member sets `natural_width` and the second sets `natural_height`. Otherwise, both `natural_width` and `natural_height` are set to the same value.

properties.name: natural_width
properties.description: Natural width specifies the width of the element tries to have, but it can still be squashed/stretched to have a different size.

properties.name: padding
properties.description: Sets `top_padding`, `right_padding`, `bottom_padding` and `left_padding` to the same value.

properties.name: parent
properties.description:
Name of a [StyleSpecification](prototype:StyleSpecification). This style inherits all property values from its parent.

Styles without a parent property default to the root style for their type. The exception to this are the root styles themselves, as they cannot have a parent set. Due to this, for root styles, some style properties are mandatory and behavior may be unexpected, such as an element not showing up because its size defaults to `0`.

properties.name: size
properties.description: If this is a tuple, the first member sets `width`, and the second sets `height`. Otherwise, both `width` and `height` are set to the same value.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Sets `minimal_width`, `maximal_width` and `natural_width` to the same value.

properties.name: infer_icon
properties.description: If set to `false`, use the icon from [UtilitySprites](prototype:UtilitySprites) for this technology effect icon.

properties.name: use_icon_overlay_constant
properties.description: If `false`, do not draw the small "constant" icon over the technology effect icon.

properties.name: apply_module_tint
properties.description: Which tint set in [ModulePrototype::beacon_tint](prototype:ModulePrototype::beacon_tint) should be applied to elements of the `animation_list`, if any.

properties.name: module_visualisations
properties.description: The visualisations available for displaying the modules in the beacon. The visualisation is chosen based on art style, see [BeaconModuleVisualizations::art_style](prototype:BeaconModuleVisualizations::art_style) and [ModulePrototype::art_style](prototype:ModulePrototype::art_style).

properties.name: apply_module_tint
properties.description: Which tint set in [ModulePrototype::beacon_tint](prototype:ModulePrototype::beacon_tint) should be applied to this, if any.

properties.name: secondary_draw_order
properties.description: Used to determine render order for sprites with the same `render_layer` in the same position. Sprites with a higher `secondary_draw_order` are drawn on top.

properties.name: art_style
properties.description: The visualization is chosen based on the [ModulePrototype::art_style](prototype:ModulePrototype::art_style), meaning if module art style equals beacon module visualization art style then this visualization is chosen. Vanilla uses `"vanilla"` here.

properties.name: slots
properties.description: The outer array contains the different slots, the inner array contains the different layers for those slots (with different tints etc). Example:

properties.name: body
properties.description: Body segment of the beam.

properties.name: ending
properties.description: End point of the beam.

properties.name: head
properties.description: Head segment of the beam.

properties.name: start
properties.description: Start point of the beam.

properties.name: tail
properties.description: Tail segment of the beam.

properties.name: desired_segment_length
properties.description: Must be larger than 0.

properties.name: beam
properties.description: Name of a [BeamPrototype](prototype:BeamPrototype).

properties.name: sprites
properties.description: Must have a `frame_count` of `4`, one for each direction.

properties.name: use_icon_overlay_constant
properties.description: If `false`, do not draw the small "constant" icon over the technology effect icon.

types.name: BlendMode
types.description:
Determines how sprites/animations should blend with the background. The possible values are listed below.

Note that in most of Factorio it is assumed colors are in alpha pre-multiplied format, see [FFF #172 - Blending and Rendering](https://www.factorio.com/blog/post/fff-172). Sprites get pre-multiplied when loaded, unless `premul_alpha` is set to `false` on the sprite/animation itself. Since generating mipmaps doesn't respect `premul_alpha`, lower mipmap levels will be in pre-multiplied format regardless.

options.description: The result color is determined with the following formula: `Result = Active_RGB + Background_RGB * ( 1 - Active_Alpha )`. Note that this is alpha blending with an assumption that `Active_RGB` is already pre-multiplied with `Active_Alpha`.
The result color is determined with the following formula: `Result = Active_RGB + Background_RGB`
The result color is determined with the following formula: `Result = Active_RGB * ( 1 - Background_RGB ) + Background_RGB`
The result color is determined with the following formula: `Result = Active_RGB * Background_RGB`
The result color is determined with the following formula: `Result = Active_RGB * Background_RGB * Active_Alpha + Background_RGB * ( 1 - Active_Alpha )`
The result color is determined with the following formula: `Result = Active_RGBA or Background_RGBA`

properties.name: fire
properties.description:
Animation that is drawn on top of the `structure` when `burning_cooldown` is larger than 1. The animation alpha can be controlled by the energy source light intensity, depending on `fire_flicker_enabled`.

The secondary draw order of this is higher than the secondary draw order of `fire_glow`, so this is drawn above `fire_glow`.

properties.name: fire_glow
properties.description:
Animation that is drawn on top of the `structure` when `burning_cooldown` is larger than 1. The animation alpha can be controlled by the energy source light intensity, depending on `fire_glow_flicker_enabled`.

The secondary draw order of this is lower than the secondary draw order of `fire`, so this is drawn below `fire`.

properties.name: patch
properties.description: Drawn above the `structure`, in the "higher-object-under" [RenderLayer](prototype:RenderLayer). May be useful to correct problems with neighboring pipes overlapping the structure graphics.

properties.name: modifier
properties.description: The value this modifier will have upon researching.

types.name: BoundingBox
types.description:
BoundingBoxes are typically centered around the position of an entity.

BoundingBoxes are usually specified with the short-hand notation of passing an array of exactly 2 or 3 items.

The first tuple item is left_top, the second tuple item is right_bottom. There is an unused third tuple item, a [float](prototype:float) that represents the orientation.

Positive x goes towards east, positive y goes towards south. This means that the upper-left point is the least dimension in x and y, and lower-right is the greatest.

properties.name: orientation
properties.description: Unused.

types.name: BoxSpecification
types.description: A cursor box, for use in [UtilitySprites](prototype:UtilitySprites).

properties.name: is_whole_box
properties.description: Whether this is a complete box or just the top left corner. If this is true, `side_length` and `side_height` must be present. Otherwise `max_side_length` must be present.

properties.name: max_side_length
properties.description: Only loaded, and mandatory if `is_whole_box` is `false`.

properties.name: side_height
properties.description: Only loaded, and mandatory if `is_whole_box` is `true`.

properties.name: side_length
properties.description: Only loaded, and mandatory if `is_whole_box` is `true`.

properties.name: consecutive
properties.description: Building is considered consecutive when the built entity is the same as the last built entity.

properties.name: infer_icon
properties.description: If set to `false`, use the icon from [UtilitySprites](prototype:UtilitySprites) for this technology effect icon.

properties.name: use_icon_overlay_constant
properties.description: If `false`, do not draw the small "constant" icon over the technology effect icon.

properties.name: effectivity
properties.description: `1` means 100% effectivity. Must be greater than `0`. Multiplier of the energy output.

properties.name: fuel_categories
properties.description: The energy source can be used with fuel from these [fuel categories](prototype:FuelCategory).

types.name: BurnerUsageID
types.description: The name of a [BurnerUsagePrototype](prototype:BurnerUsagePrototype).

properties.name: font
properties.description: Name of a [FontPrototype](prototype:FontPrototype).

types.name: CapsuleAction
types.description: Loaded as one of the capsule actions, based on the value of the `type` key.

types.name: CargoBayConnections
types.description: Walls should have an even number of variations because they are interleaved.

properties.name: closing_sound
properties.description: Cannot use `fade_ticks`.

properties.name: entering_render_layer
properties.description: render layer for objects entering the hatch.

properties.name: hatch_render_layer
properties.description: render layer for the hatch itself.

properties.name: illumination_graphic_index
properties.description: [ProcessionGraphic](prototype:ProcessionGraphic) index pointing to the [ProcessionGraphicCatalogue](prototype:ProcessionGraphicCatalogue) inside the current [SpaceLocationPrototype](prototype:SpaceLocationPrototype).

properties.name: opening_sound
properties.description: Cannot use `fade_ticks`.

properties.name: sky_slice_height
properties.description: y height relative to hatch position where the pod art gets clipped from sky to regular sorting layer.

properties.name: slice_height
properties.description: y height relative to hatch position where the pod art gets cut off.

properties.name: travel_height
properties.description: y height relative to hatch position where the pod travels to during preparing and parking.

properties.name: use_icon_overlay_constant
properties.description: If `false`, do not draw the small "constant" icon over the technology effect icon.

types.name: CargoStationParameters
types.description: A cargo station is any entity that has the capacity to send cargo units. In Space Age those are [RocketSiloPrototype](prototype:RocketSiloPrototype), [SpacePlatformHubPrototype](prototype:SpacePlatformHubPrototype) and [CargoLandingPadPrototype](prototype:CargoLandingPadPrototype). [Cargo bays](prototype:CargoBayPrototype) may provide additional cargo hatches to cargo stations which are cargo bay connectable.

properties.name: giga_hatch_definitions
properties.description: Big additional hatch that goes over the actual hatches.

properties.name: prefer_packed_cargo_units
properties.description: Packed cargo units will wait for the full order to be completed. This is useful to save rockets in rocket silos when items trickle in slowly. The platform hub has immediate access to items so false is better to allow partial fulfillments.

properties.name: use_icon_overlay_constant
properties.description: If `false`, do not draw the small "constant" icon over the technology effect icon.

types.name: CharacterArmorAnimation
types.description: The data for one variation of [character animations](prototype:CharacterPrototype::animations).

properties.name: armors
properties.description: The names of the armors this animation data is used for. Don't define this if you want the animations to be used for the player without armor.

properties.name: extra_smoke_cycles_per_tile
properties.description: Will be clamped to range [0, 1000]. When the character is flying, each [SmokeSource](prototype:SmokeSource) in `smoke_in_air` will generate `extra_smoke_cycles_per_tile` * [SmokeSource::frequency](prototype:SmokeSource::frequency) additional smokes per tile moved.

properties.name: flipped_shadow_running_with_gun
properties.description: flipped_shadow_running_with_gun must be nil or contain exactly 18 directions, so all of the combination of gun direction and moving direction can be covered. Some of these variations are used in reverse to save space. You can use the character animation in the base game for reference. `flipped_shadow_running_with_gun` has to have same frame count as `running_with_gun`.

properties.name: flying_with_gun
properties.description: Must contain exactly 18 or 40 directions, so all of the combination of gun direction and moving direction can be covered. Some of these variations are used in reverse to save space. You can use the character animation in the base game for reference.

properties.name: mining_with_tool_particles_animation_positions
properties.description:
List of positions in the mining with tool animation when the mining sound and mining particles are created.

Overrides [CharacterPrototype::mining_with_tool_particles_animation_positions](prototype:CharacterPrototype::mining_with_tool_particles_animation_positions) if defined

properties.name: running_with_gun
properties.description: Must contain exactly 18 or 40 directions, so all of the combination of gun direction and moving direction can be covered. Some of these variations are used in reverse to save space. You can use the character animation in the base game for reference.

properties.name: smoke_cycles_per_tick
properties.description: Will be clamped to range [0, 1000]. When the character is flying, each [SmokeSource](prototype:SmokeSource) in `smoke_in_air` will generate `smoke_cycles_per_tick` * [SmokeSource::frequency](prototype:SmokeSource::frequency) smokes per tick on average.

properties.name: smoke_in_air
properties.description: Smoke generator for when in air.

properties.name: use_icon_overlay_constant
properties.description: If `false`, do not draw the small "constant" icon over the technology effect icon.

properties.name: default_color_by_type
properties.description: The strings are entity types.

properties.name: default_friendly_color_by_type
properties.description: The strings are entity types.

properties.name: font
properties.description: Name of a [FontPrototype](prototype:FontPrototype).

types.name: CircuitConnectorDefinition
types.description: Definition of a circuit connector.

properties.name: points
properties.description: Defines how wires visually connect to this circuit connector.

properties.name: sprites
properties.description: The pictures displayed for circuit connector.

properties.name: connector_main
properties.description: Drawn when the entity is connected to a circuit network or a logistic network.

properties.name: connector_shadow
properties.description: Drawn when the entity is connected to a circuit network or a logistic network.

properties.name: wire_pins
properties.description: Drawn when the entity is connected to a circuit network.

properties.name: wire_pins_shadow
properties.description: Drawn when the entity is connected to a circuit network.

properties.name: use_icon_overlay_constant
