properties.name: draw_switch_tick
properties.description:
During procession, the pod will at some point start being drawn above the rest of the game:

- When ascending this tick will go from world to above.

- When descending this tick will go from above to world.

Notably, LUT override won't be applied until the pod is drawn above the game.

properties.name: duration
properties.description: The time to play this cutscene regardless of individual layer durations.

properties.name: intermezzo_max_duration
properties.description: The real duration of the intermezzo playing will be below this value.

properties.name: intermezzo_min_duration
properties.description: The real duration of the intermezzo playing will be above this value.

properties.name: special_action_tick
properties.description:
Time to initiate usage specific actions:

- Ascending animation will detach from rocket on this tick.

- Descending animation will request hatch to be opened.

types.name: ProductionType
types.description: Specifies how the entity will utilize this fluidbox. `input-output` should only be used for boilers in fluid heating mode.

properties.name: notes
properties.description: Cannot be an empty array.

properties.name: cyclic_sound
properties.description:
Cannot contain aggregations.

One of `sound` or `cyclic_sound` must be defined. Both cannot be defined together.

properties.name: sound
properties.description:
Cannot contain aggregation.

One of `sound` or `cyclic_sound` must be defined. Both cannot be defined together.

properties.name: font
properties.description: Name of a [FontPrototype](prototype:FontPrototype).

properties.name: projectile_center
properties.description:
When used with `projectile_creation_parameters`, this offsets what the turret's sprite looks at. Setting to `{0,1}` will cause the turret to aim one tile up from the target but the projectile will still aim for the entity. Can be used to give the illusion of height but can also confuse aim logic when set too high.

When used without `projectile_creation_parameters`, this sets the turret's rotation axis.

properties.name: projectile_creation_offsets
properties.description: Used to shoot from multiple points. The turret will look at the enemy as normal but the bullet will spawn from a random offset position. Can be used to create multi-barreled weapons.

properties.name: projectile_creation_parameters
properties.description: Used to shoot projectiles from arbitrary points. Used by worms. If not set then the launch positions are calculated using `projectile_center` and `projectile_creation_distance`.

properties.name: projectile_orientation_offset
properties.description: Used to shoot from different sides of the turret. Setting to `0.25` shoots from the right side, `0.5` shoots from the back, and `0.75` shoots from the left. The turret will look at the enemy as normal but the bullet will spawn from the offset position. Can be used to create right-handed weapons.

properties.name: shell_particle
properties.description: Used to show bullet shells/casings being ejected from the gun, see [artillery shell casings](https://factorio.com/blog/post/fff-345).

properties.name: direction_deviation
properties.description: Maximum deviation of the projectile from source orientation, in +/- (`x radians / 2`). Example: `3.14 radians -> +/- (180 / 2)`, meaning up to 90 deviation in either direction of rotation.

properties.name: projectile
properties.description: Name of a [ProjectilePrototype](prototype:ProjectilePrototype).

properties.name: range_deviation
properties.description: The maximum deviation of the projectile maximum range from `max_range` is `max_range  range_deviation  2`. This means a deviation of `0.5` will appear as a maximum of `0.25` (25%) deviation of an initial range goal. Post-deviation range may exceed `max_range` or be less than `min_range`.

properties.name: starting_speed
properties.description: Starting speed in tiles per tick.

types.name: PrototypeStrafeSettings
types.description: Used by [UnitPrototype](prototype:UnitPrototype).

properties.name: clockwise_chance
properties.description: Must be between 0 and 1 inclusive.

properties.name: ideal_distance
properties.description: Must be between 0 and max_distance inclusive.

properties.name: ideal_distance_importance
properties.description: Must be between between 0 and 1 inclusive.

properties.name: ideal_distance_importance_variance
properties.description: Must be between 0 and ideal_distance_importance inclusive.

properties.name: ideal_distance_tolerance
properties.description: Must be >= `0`.

properties.name: ideal_distance_variance
properties.description: Must be >= `0`.

properties.name: max_distance
properties.description: Must be >= `0`.

properties.name: water_effect
properties.description: Only loaded, and mandatory if `water_effect_parameters` is not defined. Must be name of a [TileEffectDefinition](prototype:TileEffectDefinition) which has `shader` set to `"water"`.

examples:

```
    [1] =

      standup_base =
      {
        filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/pump/connector/V-R-135-load-standup-base.png",
        width = 110,
        height = 126,
        scale = 0.5,

      },
      standup_shadow =
      {
        filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/pump/connector/V-R-1-load-standup-base-shadow.png",
        width = 157,

      },
```

properties.name: south
properties.description: Size of the array must be 6 or more.

properties.name: west
properties.description: Size of the array must be 6 or more.

types.name: PushBackTriggerEffectItem
types.description:
The push back effect used by the [discharge defense](https://wiki.factorio.com/Discharge_defense).

Aims to push the target entity away from the source entity by the `distance` from the target entity's current position. Searches within double the `distance` from the pushed to position for the nearest non-colliding position for the target entity to be teleported too. If no valid non-colliding position is found or the target is not teleportable, then no push back occurs.

properties.name: rail_endings
properties.description:
Can be used to load rail endings instead of the front and back variants.

Only loaded if `front_rail_endings` or `back_rail_endings` are not defined.

properties.name: segment_visualisation_endings
properties.description: Must contain exactly 16 directions and 6 frames.

types.name: RailPieceLayers
types.description: Used for graphics by [RailPrototype](prototype:RailPrototype) and [RailRemnantsPrototype](prototype:RailRemnantsPrototype).

properties.name: backplates
properties.description: Must have same number of variations as `metals` or be empty.

properties.name: metals
properties.description: May not have more than 16 variations.

properties.name: stone_path
properties.description: May not have more than 16 variations.

properties.name: stone_path_background
properties.description: May not have more than 16 variations.

properties.name: ties
properties.description: May not have more than 16 variations.

properties.name: use_icon_overlay_constant
properties.description: If `false`, do not draw the small "constant" icon over the technology effect icon.

properties.name: shifts
properties.description: Must be an empty array or contain exactly 16 values.

properties.name: use_icon_overlay_constant
properties.description: If `false`, do not draw the small "constant" icon over the technology effect icon.

types.name: RandomRange
types.description:
Define a numerical property in terms of minimum and maximum to be used as a randomly chosen value in that range (inclusively).

The maximum cannot be less than the minimum.

options.description: First number is the minimum, second is the maximum.

types.name: RealOrientation
types.description:
The smooth orientation. It is a `float` in the range `[0, 1)` that covers a full circle, starting at the top and going clockwise.

This means a value of `0` indicates "north", a value of `0.5` indicates "south". For example then, a value of `0.625` would indicate "south-west", and a value of `0.875` would indicate "north-west".

types.name: RecipeCategoryID
types.description: The name of a [RecipeCategory](prototype:RecipeCategory).

types.name: RecipeID
types.description: The name of a [RecipePrototype](prototype:RecipePrototype).

types.name: RecipeTints
types.description: If no tint is specified, the machine falls back to [WorkingVisualisations::default_recipe_tint](prototype:WorkingVisualisations::default_recipe_tint).

types.name: RenderLayer
types.description:
The render layer specifies the order of the sprite when rendering, most of the objects have it hardcoded in the source, but some are configurable. The union contains valid values from lowest to highest.

Note: `decals` is used as special marker for [DecorativePrototype::render_layer](prototype:DecorativePrototype::render_layer). When used elsewhere, the sprites will draw over the terrain.

types.name: ResearchIngredient
types.description: Defines the amount of an item required to research one unit of a [technology](prototype:TechnologyPrototype). The first member of the tuple is the name of a [ToolPrototype](prototype:ToolPrototype) and the second is the amount. Amount must not be 0.

types.name: ResearchProgressProductPrototype
types.description: A research progress product definition.

types.name: Resistance
types.description: Resistances to certain types of attacks from enemy, and physical damage. See [Damage](https://wiki.factorio.com/Damage).

properties.name: decrease
properties.description: The [flat resistance](https://wiki.factorio.com/Damage#Decrease.2C_or_.22flat.22_resistance) to the given damage type. (Higher is better)

properties.name: percent
properties.description: The [percentage resistance](https://wiki.factorio.com/Damage#Percentage_resistance) to the given damage type. (Higher is better)

types.name: ResourceCategoryID
types.description: The name of a [ResourceCategory](prototype:ResourceCategory).

properties.name: apply_projection
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: axially_symmetrical
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

If `true`, `direction_count` must be greater than `1`.

properties.name: counterclockwise
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: direction_count
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

The sequential animation instance is loaded equal to the entities direction within the `direction_count` setting.

Direction count to [Direction](prototype:Direction) (animation sequence number):

- `1`: North (1)

- `2`: North (1), South (2)

- `4`: North (1), East (2), South (3), West (4)

- `8`: North (1), Northeast (2), East (3), Southeast (4), South (5), Southwest (6), West (7), Northwest (8)

properties.name: filename
properties.description:
Only loaded, and mandatory if `layers`, `stripes`, and `filenames` are not defined.

The path to the sprite file to use.

properties.name: filenames
properties.description: Only loaded if both `layers` and `stripes` are not defined.

properties.name: layers
properties.description:
If this property is present, all RotatedAnimation definitions have to be placed as entries in the array, and they will all be loaded from there. `layers` may not be an empty table. Each definition in the array may also have the `layers` property.

If this property is present, all other properties, including those inherited from AnimationParameters, are ignored.

properties.name: lines_per_file
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined. Mandatory if `filenames` is defined.

properties.name: middle_orientation
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: orientation_range
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Automatically clamped to be between `0` and `1`.

properties.name: slice
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined. Mandatory if `filenames` is defined.

properties.name: still_frame
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: stripes
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

types.name: RotatedAnimation8Way
types.description:
A map of rotated animations for all 8 directions of the entity. If this is loaded as a single RotatedAnimation, it applies to all directions.

Any direction that is not defined defaults to the rotated animation of the opposite direction. If that is also not defined, it defaults to the north rotated animation.

types.name: RotatedSprite
types.description: Specifies series of sprites used to visualize different rotations of the object.
examples:
```
pictures =
{
  layers =
  {
    {
      filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/radar/radar.png",
      priority = "low",
      width = 196,
      height = 254,
      apply_projection = false,
      direction_count = 64,
      line_length = 8,
      shift = util.by_pixel(1, -16),
      scale = 0.5
    },
    {
      filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/radar/radar-shadow.png",
      priority = "low",
      width = 343,
      height = 186,
      apply_projection = false,
      direction_count = 64,
      line_length = 8,
      shift = util.by_pixel(39.25,3),
      draw_as_shadow = true,
      scale = 0.5
    }
  }
}
```

properties.name: allow_low_quality_rotation
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: apply_projection
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Used to fix the inconsistency of direction of the entity in 3d when rendered and direction on the screen (where the 45 degree angle for projection is used).

properties.name: axially_symmetrical
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

When `true`, the same picture is used for left/right direction, just flipped, which can save half of the space required, but is not usable once the picture contains shadows, etc.

properties.name: back_equals_front
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

properties.name: counterclockwise
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Set to `true` to indicate sprites in the spritesheet are in counterclockwise order.

properties.name: dice
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Number of slices this is sliced into when using the "optimized atlas packing" option. If you are a modder, you can just ignore this property. Example: If this is 4, the sprite will be sliced into a 4x4 grid.

properties.name: dice_x
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Same as `dice` above, but this specifies only how many slices there are on the x axis.

properties.name: dice_y
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Same as `dice` above, but this specifies only how many slices there are on the y axis.

properties.name: direction_count
properties.description:
Only loaded, and mandatory if `layers` is not defined.

Count of direction (frames) specified.

properties.name: filename
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

The path to the sprite file to use.

properties.name: filenames
properties.description: Only loaded, and mandatory if both `layers` and `filename` are not defined.

properties.name: frames
properties.description: A list of overrides and customizations for each specific frame within the rotated sprite. This can be used to adjust each individual frame's width, height, and other properties. If this property is present, then it must contain at least as many `RotatedSpriteFrame` as there are sprites in this RotatedSprite.

properties.name: generate_sdf
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Unused.

properties.name: layers
properties.description:
If this property is present, all RotatedSprite definitions have to be placed as entries in the array, and they will all be loaded from there. `layers` may not be an empty table. Each definition in the array may also have the `layers` property.

If this property is present, all other properties, including those inherited from SpriteParameters, are ignored.

properties.name: line_length
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Once the specified number of pictures is loaded, other pictures are loaded on other line. This is to allow having more sprites in matrix, to input files with too high width. The game engine limits the width of any input files to 8192px, so it is compatible with most graphics cards. 0 means that all the pictures are in one horizontal line.

properties.name: lines_per_file
properties.description: Only loaded if `layers` is not defined. Mandatory if `filenames` is defined.

types.name: RotatedSpriteFrame
types.description: Specifies frame-specific properties of an individual sprite within a RotatedSprite set. Some properties are absolute values, and some are relative and inherited from the parent RotatedSprite prototype definition.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Height of the sprite in pixels, from 0-4096. If not defined, inherits the height of the parent RotatedSprite.

properties.name: shift
properties.description: The shift in tiles of this specific frame, relative to the shift of the parent RotatedSprite. `util.by_pixel()` can be used to divide the shift by 32 which is the usual pixel height/width of 1 tile in normal resolution. Note that 32 pixel tile height/width is not enforced anywhere - any other tile height or width is also possible.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Width of the sprite in pixels, from 0-4096. If not defined, inherits the width of the parent RotatedSprite.

properties.name: x
properties.description: The horizontal offset of the sprite relative to its specific frame within the parent RotatedSprite.

properties.name: y
properties.description: The vertical offset of the sprite relative to its specific frame within the parent RotatedSprite.

properties.name: effect_id
properties.description: The effect ID that will be provided in [on_script_trigger_effect](runtime:on_script_trigger_effect).

properties.name: extra_margin_when_activated
properties.description: Sets `extra_top_margin_when_activated`, `extra_bottom_margin_when_activated`, `extra_left_margin_when_activated` and `extra_right_margin_when_activated`.

properties.name: extra_padding_when_activated
properties.description: Sets `extra_top_padding_when_activated`, `extra_bottom_padding_when_activated`, `extra_left_padding_when_activated` and `extra_right_padding_when_activated`.

types.name: SegmentEngineSpecification
types.description: Used by [SegmentedUnitPrototype](prototype:SegmentedUnitPrototype) to define and manage the segments that make up the body of the entity.

properties.name: segments
properties.description: The segments that compose the entity's body. Must contain no more than 63 entries.

types.name: SegmentSpecification
types.description: A container for an individual instance of a [SegmentPrototype](prototype:SegmentPrototype) within a [SegmentEngineSpecification](prototype:SegmentEngineSpecification). May contain context-specific customizations unique to the associated segment instance.

properties.name: segment
properties.description: Name of the [SegmentPrototype](prototype:SegmentPrototype) to use in this position.

types.name: SelectionModeFlags
types.description:
An array containing the following values.

Some flags only exclude objects from the selection, meaning they need to be combined with another flag to select anything.

options.description: Selects entities and tiles as if selecting them for a blueprint.
Selects entities and tiles as if selecting them for deconstruction.
Selects entities and tiles as if selecting them for deconstruction cancellation.
Selects entities which are considered [a building](runtime:LuaEntityPrototype::is_building), plus landmines.
Selects no entities or tiles, but is useful to select an area.
Selects entities and tiles that can be built by an item.
Excludes entities that have a different force than the selecting player from the selection.
Excludes entities that have the same force as the selecting player from the selection.
Excludes entities that are not from a friendly force from the selection.
Excludes entities that are not from an enemy force from the selection.
Selects entities as if selecting them for upgrading.
Selects entities as if selecting them for upgrade cancellation.
Selects entities as if selecting them for downgrading.
Selects entities and tiles as if selecting them for a blueprint.
Selects entities and tiles as if selecting them for deconstruction.
Selects entities and tiles as if selecting them for deconstruction cancellation.
Selects entities which are considered [a building](runtime:LuaEntityPrototype::is_building), plus landmines.
Selects no entities or tiles, but is useful to select an area.
Selects entities and tiles that can be built by an item.
Excludes entities that have a different force than the selecting player from the selection.
Excludes entities that have the same force as the selecting player from the selection.
Excludes entities that are not from a friendly force from the selection.
Excludes entities that are not from an enemy force from the selection.
Selects entities as if selecting them for upgrading.
Selects entities as if selecting them for upgrade cancellation.
Selects entities as if selecting them for downgrading.

properties.name: triggers
properties.description: List of triggers to fulfill.

types.name: Settings
types.description: A struct that provides access to the user-set values of startup [mod settings](https://wiki.factorio.com/Tutorial:Mod_settings).
examples:
```
-- Accessing the value of a mod setting
local val = settings.startup["my-mod-setting-name"].value
```

properties.name: startup
properties.description: All startup mod settings, indexed by the name of the setting.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name of the signal.

types.name: SimpleBoundingBox
types.description:
An axis aligned bounding box.

SimpleBoundingBoxes are usually specified with the short-hand notation of passing an array of exactly 2 numbers. The first position is left_top, the second position is right_bottom.

Positive x goes towards east, positive y goes towards south. This means that the upper-left point is the least dimension in x and y, and lower-right is the greatest.

properties.name: modifier
properties.description: Modification value, which will be added to the variable it modifies.

types.name: SimulationDefinition
types.description: Used by tips and tricks and main menu simulations. Simulations can be controlled at runtime via [LuaSimulation](runtime:LuaSimulation).

properties.name: checkboard
properties.description: If this is true, the map of the simulation is set to be a lab-tile checkerboard in the area of `{{-20, -15},{20, 15}}` when the scenario is first initialized (before init/init_file run).

properties.name: generate_map
properties.description: If `save` is not given and this is true, a map gets generated by the game for use in the simulation.

properties.name: init
properties.description:
Only loaded if `init_file` is not defined.

This code is run as a (silent) console command inside the simulation when it is first initialized. Since this is run as a console command, the restrictions of console commands apply, e.g. `require` is not available, see [here](runtime:libraries).

properties.name: init_file
properties.description: This code is run as a (silent) console command inside the simulation when it is first initialized. Since this is run as a console command, the restrictions of console commands apply, e.g. `require` is not available, see [here](runtime:libraries).

properties.name: init_update_count
properties.description: Amount of ticks that this simulation should run for before the simulation is shown to the player. These updates happen after init/init_file has been run and at the highest possible rate (> 60 UPS).

properties.name: length
properties.description: How long this simulation takes. In the main menu simulations, another simulation will start after this simulation ends.

properties.name: mods
properties.description: An array of mods whose runtime scripts will be loaded for this simulation, if they are present and enabled.

properties.name: mute_wind_sounds
properties.description:
Overrides whether a simulation has its wind sounds muted.

Tips and Tricks simulations and Factoriopedia simulations have their wind sounds muted by default, other simulations don't.

properties.name: override_volume
properties.description: If true, overrides the simulation volume set by the player in the sound settings, simply setting the volume modifier to `1`.

properties.name: save
properties.description: The save file that is used for this simulation. If not given and `generate_map` is `true`, a map is generated by the game.

properties.name: update
properties.description:
Only loaded if `update_file` is not defined.

This code is run as a (silent) console command inside the simulation every time the simulation is updated. Since this is run as a console command, the restrictions of console commands apply, e.g. `require` is not available, see [here](runtime:libraries).

properties.name: update_file
properties.description: This code is run as a (silent) console command inside the simulation every time the simulation is updated. Since this is run as a console command, the restrictions of console commands apply, e.g. `require` is not available, see [here](runtime:libraries).

properties.name: volume_modifier
properties.description: Multiplier for the simulation volume set by the player in the sound settings.

types.name: SingleGraphicLayerProcessionBezierControlPoint
types.description: One frame in time for a Bezier interpolation.

properties.name: frame
properties.description: the frame of the pod animation played. Used only when 'animation_driven_by_curve' is enabled.

properties.name: opacity
properties.description: `opacity` and `opacity_t` interpolate a double smoothly over time.

properties.name: opacity_t
properties.description: Bidirectional tangent at the given timestamp.

properties.name: rotation
properties.description: `rotation` and `rotation_t` interpolate a double smoothly over time.

properties.name: rotation_t
properties.description: Bidirectional tangent at the given timestamp.

properties.name: scale
properties.description: `scale` and `scale_t` interpolate a double smoothly over time.

properties.name: scale_t
properties.description: Bidirectional tangent at the given timestamp.

properties.name: shift
properties.description:
`shift` and `shift_t` interpolate a vector smoothly over time using `shift_rate` and `shift_rate_t` for a 0-1 rate curve.

Vector value.

properties.name: shift_rate
properties.description: Rate 0-1 value.

properties.name: shift_rate_t
properties.description: Rate tangent.

properties.name: shift_t
properties.description: Vector tangent.

properties.name: timestamp
properties.description: Mandatory if `opacity` or `tint` is defined.

properties.name: tint
properties.description: `tint` and `tint_t` interpolate a color smoothly over time.

properties.name: tint_t
properties.description: Bidirectional tangent at the given timestamp.

properties.name: compensated_pivot
properties.description: Swaps the order of sprite shift and rotation.

properties.name: relative_to
properties.description: Where the sprite is centered.

properties.name: shift_rotates_with_pod
properties.description: Only applied when the `relative_to` is `pod`.

types.name: SmokeSource
types.description: Definition of the smoke of an entity.

properties.name: frequency
properties.description: Number of smokes generated per entity animation cycle (or per tick for some entities). Can't be negative or infinite.

properties.name: north_east_position
properties.description: Only loaded if `has_8_directions` is `true`.

properties.name: north_west_position
properties.description: Only loaded if `has_8_directions` is `true`.

properties.name: offset
properties.description: Offsets animation cycle, to move at which points of the cycle the smoke gets emitted.

properties.name: position
properties.description:
Positional offset of smoke source relative to owner entity position. The vector is rotated by orientation of the entity.

If any of `north_position`, `north_east_position`, `east_position`, `south_east_position`, `south_position`, `south_west_position`, `west_position`, `north_west_position` is defined, `position` is used only as default value for directional positions. Orientation of the owner entity will be rounded to 4 or 8 directions and one of the directional positions will be used as the offset instead of `position`.

properties.name: south_east_position
properties.description: Only loaded if `has_8_directions` is `true`.

properties.name: south_west_position
properties.description: Only loaded if `has_8_directions` is `true`.

properties.name: vertical_speed_slowdown
properties.description: A value between `0` and `1`.

properties.name: audible_distance_modifier
properties.description: Modifies how far a sound can be heard. Cannot be less than zero.

properties.name: filename
properties.description:
Supported sound file formats are `.ogg` (Vorbis and Opus) and `.wav`.

Only loaded, and mandatory if `variations` is not defined.

properties.name: max_speed
properties.description:
Must be `>= min_speed`.

Only loaded if `variations` is not defined. Only loaded, and mandatory if `min_speed` is defined.

properties.name: max_volume
properties.description:
Only loaded if `variations` is not defined.

Only loaded if `min_volume` is defined.

Must be `>= min_volume`.

properties.name: min_speed
properties.description:
Must be `>= 1 / 64`.

Only loaded if both `variations` and `speed` are not defined.

properties.name: min_volume
properties.description:
Only loaded if `variations` and `volume` are not defined.

Must be `>= 0`.

properties.name: modifiers
properties.description: Only loaded if `variations` is not defined.

properties.name: preload
properties.description: Only loaded if `variations` is not defined.

properties.name: priority
properties.description:
Sounds with higher priority will replace a sound with lower priority if the maximum sounds limit is reached.

0 is the highest priority, 255 is the lowest priority.

properties.name: speed
properties.description:
Speed must be `>= 1 / 64`. This sets both min and max speeds.

Only loaded if `variations` is not defined.

properties.name: volume
properties.description:
Only loaded if `variations` is not defined.

This sets both min and max volumes.

Must be `>= 0`.

properties.name: play_for_working_visualisation
properties.description:
Play the `sound` for a working visualisation of a given [WorkingVisualisation::name](prototype:WorkingVisualisation::name).

The name cannot be empty.

properties.name: filename
properties.description: Supported sound file formats are `.ogg` (Vorbis) and `.wav`.

properties.name: max_speed
properties.description:
Only loaded, and mandatory, if `min_speed` is defined.

Must be `>= min_speed`.

properties.name: max_volume
properties.description:
Only loaded if `min_volume` is defined.

Must be `>= min_volume`.

properties.name: min_speed
properties.description:
Only loaded if `speed` is not defined.

Must be `>= 1 / 64`.

properties.name: min_volume
properties.description:
Only loaded if `volume` is not defined.

Must be `>= 0`.

properties.name: speed
properties.description: Speed must be `>= 1 / 64`. This sets both min and max speeds.

properties.name: volume
properties.description:
This sets both min and max volumes.

Must be `>= 0`.

types.name: SoundType
types.description: This defines which slider in the sound settings affects the volume of this sound. Furthermore, some sound types are mixed differently than others, e.g. zoom level effects are applied.

properties.name: asteroid
properties.description: The type this is loaded as depends on `type`.

types.name: SpaceConnectionID
types.description: The name of a [SpaceConnectionPrototype](prototype:SpaceConnectionPrototype).

properties.name: asteroid
properties.description: The type this is loaded as depends on `type`.

types.name: SpaceLocationID
types.description: The name of a [SpaceLocationPrototype](prototype:SpaceLocationPrototype).

properties.name: use_icon_overlay_constant
properties.description: If `false`, do not draw the small "constant" icon over the technology effect icon.

types.name: SpaceTileEffectParameters
types.description:
Nebulae are rendered only behind tiles with the effect, but stars are rendered behind entire terrain. For that reason using two or more tile types with different space effect on one surface is not supported. The game will allow this to happen, but rendering will chose one star configuration for entire screen.

Zoom is recalculated using formula `max(1/1024, pow(max(0, zoom * base_factor + base_offset), exponent) * factor + offset)`.

properties.name: index
properties.description: The index of the row or column after which to insert `spacing`.

properties.name: spacing
properties.description: The spacing in scaled pixels between columns `column` and `column + 1`.

types.name: SpawnPoint
types.description:
The definition of a evolution and probability weights for a [spawnable unit](prototype:UnitSpawnDefinition) for a [EnemySpawnerPrototype](prototype:EnemySpawnerPrototype).

It can be specified as a table with named or numbered keys, but not a mix of both. If this is specified as a table with numbered keys then the first value is the evolution factor and the second is the spawn weight.

properties.name: spawn_weight
properties.description: Must be `>= 0`.

types.name: SpiderEngineSpecification
types.description: Used by [SpiderVehiclePrototype](prototype:SpiderVehiclePrototype).

properties.name: walking_group_overlap
properties.description: The amount of overlap allowed between spider leg walking groups. Valid values are between 0.0 and 1.0. Default is 0.0 (no overlap); all legs in the current walking group must complete their step before the next walking group is allowed to move. 0.5 means the next walking group is allowed to start when the time remaining in the current walking group's step is about half of the time that the next group's step is predicted to take.

properties.name: bottom_end_offset
properties.description: The number of tiles in screen space to shift the bottom end of the leg part AWAY from the bottom joint.

properties.name: render_layer
properties.description: The sprite layer in which to draw this leg part.

properties.name: top_end_offset
properties.description: The number of tiles in screen space to shift the top end of the leg part AWAY from the top joint.

types.name: SpiderLegSpecification
types.description: Used by [SpiderEngineSpecification](prototype:SpiderEngineSpecification) for [SpiderVehiclePrototype](prototype:SpiderVehiclePrototype).

properties.name: leg
properties.description: Name of a [SpiderLegPrototype](prototype:SpiderLegPrototype).

properties.name: leg_hit_the_ground_trigger
properties.description: Triggers to activate whenever the leg hits the ground, even if the owning spider is actively attacking an entity. For triggers, the source is the leg entity and the target is the leg's current position. Certain effects may not raise as desired, e.g. `"push-back"` does nothing.

properties.name: leg_hit_the_ground_when_attacking_trigger
properties.description: Triggers to activate whenever the leg hits the ground and the owning spider is actively attacking an entity. These effects will trigger after `leg_hit_the_ground_trigger` have triggered. For triggers, the source is the let entity and the target is the leg's current position. Certain effects may not raise as desired.

properties.name: walking_group
properties.description: The walking group this leg belongs to. Legs in the same walking group move or stay still at the same time, according to the engine that drives them. Walking groups must start at 1 and increment upward without skipping any numbers. If all legs are part of the same walking_group, they will all move simultaneously.

properties.name: position
properties.description: A number between 0 and 1 (inclusive) representing the distance from the upper end of the leg (0) to the lower end of the leg (1) where the effects will be triggered. For the upper leg, position 0 represents the point that the leg connects to the entity's hip and position 1 represents the knee. For the lower leg, position 0 represents the knee and position 1 represents the foot.

types.name: SpiderVehicleGraphicsSet
types.description: Used to specify the graphics for [SpiderVehiclePrototype](prototype:SpiderVehiclePrototype).

properties.name: default_color
properties.description: The default mask color for the spider vehicle. Defaults to orange.

properties.name: eye_light
properties.description: Placed in multiple positions, as determined by `light_positions`.

properties.name: light_positions
properties.description: Defines where each `eye_light` is placed. One array per eye and each of those arrays should contain one position per body direction.

properties.name: items_per_trigger
properties.description: Must be positive (larger than 0).

types.name: Sprite
types.description:
Specifies one picture that can be used in the game.

When there is more than one sprite or [Animation](prototype:Animation) frame with the same source file and dimensions/position in the game, they all share the same memory.
examples:

properties.name: dice
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Number of slices this is sliced into when using the "optimized atlas packing" option. If you are a modder, you can just ignore this property. Example: If this is 4, the sprite will be sliced into a 4x4 grid.

properties.name: dice_x
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Same as `dice` above, but this specifies only how many slices there are on the x axis.

properties.name: dice_y
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layers` is not defined.

Same as `dice` above, but this specifies only how many slices there are on the y axis.

properties.name: filename
properties.description:
Only loaded, and mandatory if `layers` is not defined.

The path to the sprite file to use.

properties.name: layers
properties.description:
If this property is present, all Sprite definitions have to be placed as entries in the array, and they will all be loaded from there. `layers` may not be an empty table. Each definition in the array may also have the `layers` property.

If this property is present, all other properties, including those inherited from SpriteParameters, are ignored.

types.name: Sprite4Way
types.description:
Sprites for the 4 major directions of the entity. If this is loaded as a single Sprite, it applies to all directions.

This struct is either loaded as `sheets` or `sheet` or a map of one sprite per direction. For per direction sprites, the sprites are loaded via `north`, `east`, `south` and `west`.
examples:
```
-- separate sprites per direction
{
  north =
  {
    filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/assembling-machine-3/assembling-machine-3-pipe-N.png",
    priority = "extra-high",
    width = 71,
    height = 38,
    shift = util.by_pixel(2.25, 13.5),
    scale = 0.5
  },
  east =
  {
    filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/assembling-machine-3/assembling-machine-3-pipe-E.png",
    priority = "extra-high",
    width = 42,
    height = 76,
    shift = util.by_pixel(-24.5, 1),
    scale = 0.5
  },
  south =
  {
    filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/assembling-machine-3/assembling-machine-3-pipe-S.png",
    priority = "extra-high",
    width = 88,
    height = 61,
    shift = util.by_pixel(0, -31.25),
    scale = 0.5
  },
  west =
  {
    filename = "__base__/graphics/entity/assembling-machine-3/assembling-machine-3-pipe-W.png",
    priority = "extra-high",
    width = 39,
    height = 73,
    shift = util.by_pixel(25.75, 1.25),
    scale = 0.5
  }
}
```

types.name: SpriteFlags
types.description: An array containing the following values.

options.description: The sprite won't be automatically cropped.
This flag will internally set these flags: `"group=none"`
This flag will internally set these flags: `"no-crop"`, `"no-scale"`, `"mipmap"`, `"linear-minification"`, `"linear-magnification"`, `"linear-mip-level"`, `"not-compressed"`, `"group=icon"`
This flag will internally set these flags: `"no-crop"`, `"no-scale"`, `"mipmap"`, `"linear-minification"`, `"linear-magnification"`, `"linear-mip-level"`, `"not-compressed"`, `"group=gui"`
This flag will internally set these flags: `"no-crop"`, `"no-scale"`, `"mipmap"`, `"linear-minification"`, `"linear-magnification"`, `"not-compressed"`, `"group=icon"`
This flag will internally set these flags: `"mipmap"`, `"linear-mip-level"`, `"linear-minification"`, `"linear-magnification"`, `"group=none"`
This flag will internally set these flags: `"mipmap"`, `"linear-mip-level"`, `"linear-minification"`, `"no-crop"`, `"group=terrain"`
This flag will internally set these flags: `"mipmap"`, `"linear-mip-level"`, `"linear-minification"`, `"no-crop"`, `"terrain-effect-map"` (internal group flag)
This flag will internally set these flags: `"mipmap"`, `"linear-mip-level"`, `"linear-minification"`, `"terrain-effect-map"` (internal group flag)
This flag will internally set these flags: `"mipmap"`, `"linear-minification"`, `"linear-magnification"`, `"group=smoke"`
This flag will internally set these flags: `"group=decal"`

```
sheet =

  height = 79,
  shift = util.by_pixel(1.5, 7.5-1),

```

properties.name: frames
properties.description: Specifies how many of the directions of the SpriteNWay are filled up with this sheet.
properties.default: 4 if used in Sprite4Way, 8 if used in Sprite8Way

properties.name: generate_sdf
properties.description: Unused.

properties.name: draw_as_glow
properties.description:
Only one of `draw_as_shadow`, `draw_as_glow` and `draw_as_light` can be true. This takes precedence over `draw_as_light`.

Draws first as a normal sprite, then again as a light layer. See [https://forums.factorio.com/91682](https://forums.factorio.com/91682).

properties.name: draw_as_light
properties.description: Only one of `draw_as_shadow`, `draw_as_glow` and `draw_as_light` can be true.

properties.name: draw_as_shadow
properties.description: Only one of `draw_as_shadow`, `draw_as_glow` and `draw_as_light` can be true. This takes precedence over `draw_as_glow` and `draw_as_light`.

properties.name: generate_sdf
properties.description:
This property is only used by sprites used in [UtilitySprites](prototype:UtilitySprites) that have the `"icon"` flag set.

If this is set to `true`, the game will generate an icon shadow (using signed distance fields) for the sprite.

images.caption: Example of the icon shadow in the character modifier icon used by the steel axe research

properties.name: mipmap_count
properties.description: Only loaded if this is an icon, that is it has the flag `"group=icon"` or `"group=gui"`. Will be clamped to range `[0, 5]`.

properties.name: occludes_light
properties.description: Loaded only if `draw_as_shadow`, `draw_as_glow` and `draw_as_light` are `false`, and only by sprites used by tile renderer (decals and underwater patches). The purpose of setting this to `false` is to preserve water mask from sprites that are supposed to be drawn under the water.

properties.name: rotate_shift
properties.description: Whether to rotate the `shift` alongside the sprite's rotation. This only applies to sprites which are procedurally rotated by the game engine (like projectiles, wires, inserter hands, etc).

properties.name: scale
properties.description: Values other than `1` specify the scale of the sprite on default zoom. A scale of `2` means that the picture will be two times bigger on screen (and thus more pixelated).

properties.name: shift
properties.description: The shift in tiles. `util.by_pixel()` can be used to divide the shift by 32 which is the usual pixel height/width of 1 tile in normal resolution. Note that 32 pixel tile height/width is not enforced anywhere - any other tile height or width is also possible.

properties.name: surface
properties.description: Provides hint to sprite atlas system, so it can try to put sprites that are intended to be used at the same locations to the same sprite atlas.

properties.name: usage
properties.description: Provides hint to sprite atlas system, so it can pack sprites that are related to each other to the same sprite atlas.

types.name: SpritePriority
types.description: This sets the "caching priority" of a sprite, so deciding priority of it being included in VRAM instead of streaming it and is therefore a purely technical value. See [here](https://forums.factorio.com/viewtopic.php?p=437380#p437380) and [here](https://www.factorio.com/blog/post/fff-264). The possible values are listed below.

properties.name: dice
properties.description: Number of slices this is sliced into when using the "optimized atlas packing" option. If you are a modder, you can just ignore this property. Example: If this is 4, the sprite will be sliced into a 4x4 grid.

properties.name: dice_x
properties.description: Same as `dice` above, but this specifies only how many slices there are on the x axis.

properties.name: dice_y
properties.description: Same as `dice` above, but this specifies only how many slices there are on the y axis.

properties.name: layers
properties.description:
If this property is present, all SpriteSheet definitions have to be placed as entries in the array, and they will all be loaded from there. `layers` may not be an empty table. Each definition in the array may also have the `layers` property.

If this property is present, all other properties, including those inherited from SpriteParameters, are ignored.

properties.name: lines_per_file
properties.description: Mandatory if `filenames` is defined.

properties.name: allow_forced_downscale
properties.description: If `true`, the sprite may be downsampled to half its size on load even when 'Sprite quality' graphics setting is set to 'High'. Whether downsampling happens depends on detected hardware and other graphics settings.

properties.name: filename
properties.description: The path to the sprite file to use.

properties.name: height
properties.description:
Mandatory if `size` is not defined.

Height of the picture in pixels, from 0-4096.

properties.name: load_in_minimal_mode
properties.description: Minimal mode is entered when mod loading fails. You are in it when you see the gray box after (part of) the loading screen that tells you a mod error. Modders can ignore this property.

properties.name: position
properties.description: Loaded only when `x` and `y` are both `0`. The first member of the tuple is `x` and the second is `y`.

properties.name: premul_alpha
properties.description: Whether alpha should be pre-multiplied.

properties.name: size
properties.description: The width and height of the sprite. If this is a tuple, the first member of the tuple is the width and the second is the height. Otherwise the size is both width and height. Width and height may only be in the range of 0-4096.

properties.name: width
properties.description:
Mandatory if `size` is not defined.

Width of the picture in pixels, from 0-4096.

properties.name: x
properties.description: Horizontal position of the sprite in the source file in pixels.

properties.name: y
properties.description: Vertical position of the sprite in the source file in pixels.

types.name: SpriteUsageHint
types.description: Provides hint to sprite atlas system, so it can pack sprites that are related to each other to the same sprite atlas.

types.name: SpriteUsageSurfaceHint
types.description: Provides hint to sprite atlas system, so it can try to put sprites that are intended to be used at the same locations to the same sprite atlas.

types.name: StretchRule
types.description: Sets whether a GUI element can be stretched or squashed.

options.description: Stretching/squashing is disabled even when the container contains stretchable/squashable elements.
Stretching/squashing depends on the contents of the layout, for example a flow with stretchable element gets stretchable.

Used only for stretchable (not squashable) properties on scroll panes, labels, check boxes and radio buttons. The element this is set on expands its size to maximum and is stretched at the same time. This means the element takes up its maximum size even before its contents require it.

types.name: TechnologyTrigger
types.description: Loaded as one of the technology triggers, based on the value of the `type` key.

types.name: TechnologyUnit
types.description: Either `count` or `count_formula` must be defined, never both.

properties.name: count
properties.description: How many units are needed. Must be `> 0`.

properties.name: count_formula
properties.description:
Formula that specifies how many units are needed per level of the technology.

If the last characters of the prototype name are `-<number>`, the level is taken to be the number, e.g. `physical-projectile-damage-2` implies a number of `2`. This defaults to `1`. There does not need to be lower-level technologies for a technology to be detected as having a level, meaning a technology or sequence of upgrade technologies can begin at any number.

For an infinite technology, the level begins at the given suffix (or `1` by default) and gains 1 level upon being researched, or if the `max_level` is reached, marked as completed. The initial level of a technology can not be greater than its `max_level`.

`l` and `L` are provided as variables in the expression, they represent the current level of the technology.

This formula can also be used at [runtime](runtime:LuaHelpers::evaluate_expression).

properties.name: ingredients
properties.description: List of ingredients needed for one unit of research. The items must all be [ToolPrototypes](prototype:ToolPrototype).

properties.name: time
properties.description: How much time one unit takes to research. In a lab with a crafting speed of `1`, it corresponds to the number of seconds.

properties.name: minimum_territory_size
properties.description: Minimum number of chunks a territory must have. Below this, it will get deleted.

properties.name: territory_index_expression
properties.description: Mandatory if `units` is not empty.

properties.name: territory_variation_expression
properties.description: The result will be converted to integer, clamped and used as an index for `units` array. Negative values will result in empty spawn location.

properties.name: units
properties.description: Names of the [SegmentedUnitPrototype](prototype:SegmentedUnitPrototype).

properties.name: font
properties.description: Name of a [FontPrototype](prototype:FontPrototype).

properties.name: uses_stack
properties.description: Whether using the capsule consumes an item from the stack.

types.name: TileEffectDefinitionID

types.name: TileID
types.description: The name of a [TilePrototype](prototype:TilePrototype).

types.name: TileIDRestriction
types.description: Name of an allowed tile, or a list of two tile names for entities allowed on transitions.

properties.name: size
properties.description: Only powers of 2 from 1 to 128 can be used. Square size of the tile arrangement this sprite is used for. Used to calculate the `width` and `height` of the sprite which cannot be set directly. (width or height) = size * 32 / scale.

properties.name: probability
properties.description: Probability of 1x1 (size = 1) version of tile must be 1.

properties.name: size
properties.description: Only powers of 2 from 1 to 128 can be used. Square size of the tile arrangement this sprite is used for. Used to calculate the `width` and `height` of the sprite which cannot be set directly. (width or height) = size * 32 / scale.

types.name: TilePosition
types.description: Coordinates of a tile on a map where each integer `x`/`y` represents a different tile. This uses the same format as [MapPosition](prototype:MapPosition), except it rounds any non-integer `x`/`y` down to whole numbers. It can be specified either with or without explicit keys.

options.description: 64 layers. Used for tile sprites above background (e.g. transitions to out-of-map).
16 layers. Used for water related tile sprites. Water shaders are rendered above these layers.
64 layers. Used for lowland tiles and tile transitions to water that are desired to be drawn under the ground sprites. Puddles are rendered above these layers.
256 layers. Used for natural tile sprites above water. Global tile tint shaders are rendered above these layers.
128 layers. Used for tile sprites which are intended to be above natural ground. Like tiles that player can build.
1 layer. The top most tile render layer.

properties.name: count
properties.description: Frame count.

properties.name: line_length
properties.description: Once the specified number of pictures is loaded, other pictures are loaded on other line. This is to allow having longer animations in matrix, to input files with too high width. The game engine limits the width of any input files to 8192px, so it is compatible with most graphics cards. 0 means that all the pictures are in one horizontal line.

properties.name: x
properties.description: Horizontal position of the sprite in the source file in pixels.

properties.name: y
properties.description: Vertical position of the sprite in the source file in pixels.

types.name: TileTransitionSpritesheetLayout
types.description:
The properties from the parent TileSpriteLayoutVariant provide defaults for the TileTransitionVariantLayouts.

The `{inner_corner | outer_corner | side | double_side | u_transition | o_transition}_*` properties provide defaults for the corresponding properties in the TileTransitionVariantLayouts. They are used when the TileTransitionVariantLayouts have the same layout. See the example below.
examples:
```
-- all the layers use the same layout, at different offsets inside the spritesheet
layout =
{
  scale = 0.5,
  inner_corner_count = 8,
  outer_corner_count = 8,
  o_transition_count = 1,
  outer_corner_x = 576,
  u_transition_x = 1728,

  overlay = { y_offset = 0 },  -- 0 is default, but by defining overlay property, we enable the layer
  mask = { y_offset = 512 },
  background = { y_offset = 1024 }
}
```

types.name: TileTransitionVariantLayout

The properties from the parent TileSpriteLayoutVariant provide defaults for the properties defined here.

The `{inner_corner | outer_corner | side | double_side | u_transition | o_transition}_*` properties provide defaults for the properties inside the specific variant. They are used to specify select values for the variant without creating the table for the variant.

These various ways to define the variants are also shown in the examples below.
examples:
```
-- The above version is creating a table to just specify inner_corner has 8 count. It can be shorter by using variant prefix properties:
{
  scale = 0.5,
  inner_corner_count = 8,
  outer_corner_count = 8,
  u_transition_count = 1,
  outer_corner_x = 576,
  u_transition_x = 1728,
```

types.name: TileTransitions
types.description:
Used for [TilePrototype](prototype:TilePrototype) graphics.

Use `layout` with `spritesheet` to define all the tile layers inside the `layout` property. The `*_enabled`, `*_layout` and `*_spritesheet` properties can be used to override specific layers of a reused layout.

Only loaded if `layout` or `auxiliary_effect_mask_layout` is defined.

Default spritesheet for `auxiliary_effect_mask_layout` and `layout.auxiliary_effect_mask`.

properties.name: background_layer_occludes_light
properties.description: If drawing under water which is supposed to yield water mask, set this to `false` to not mess up the water mask.

properties.name: background_layout

properties.name: background_mask_layout

properties.name: background_spritesheet
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layout` or `background_layout` is defined.

Default spritesheet for `background_layout` and `layout.background`.

properties.name: effect_map_layout
properties.description: Overrides the `effect_map` definition inside `layout`.

properties.name: effect_map_spritesheet
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layout` or `effect_map_layout` is defined.

Default spritesheet for `effect_map_layout` and `layout.effect_map`.

properties.name: lightmap_layout
properties.description: Overrides the `lightmap` definition inside `layout`.

properties.name: lightmap_spritesheet
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layout` or `lightmap_layout` is defined.

properties.name: mask_layout
properties.description: Overrides the `mask` definition inside `layout`.

properties.name: mask_spritesheet
properties.description:
Only loaded if `layout` or `mask_layout` is defined.

Default spritesheet for `mask_layout` and `layout.mask`.

properties.name: overlay_layout
properties.description: Overrides the `overlay` definition inside `layout`.

properties.name: spritesheet
properties.description: Default spritesheet for all TileSpriteLayouts.

properties.name: material_light
properties.description: Must have the same `count` as material_background.

properties.name: transition
properties.description: Only loaded, and mandatory if `empty_transitions` is `false`.

types.name: TransportBeltConnectorFrame
types.description: Used to define the graphics for the (in vanilla) yellow frame that is used when a [TransportBeltPrototype](prototype:TransportBeltPrototype) is connected to the circuit network.

types.name: TreeVariation
types.description: Tree has number of "dying" stages, which is deduced from frame count of `shadow` if shadow is defined, otherwise from frame count of `trunk`. Frame count of `leaves` has to be one less than deduced number stages, as last stage is always assumed to be leafless.

properties.name: branches_when_damaged
properties.description: This value is multiplied with the percent of health lost.

properties.name: disable_shadow_distortion_beginning_at_frame
properties.description: Only loaded if `shadow` is present. Defaults to `shadow.frame_count - 1`.

properties.name: leaves_when_damaged
properties.description: This value is multiplied with the percent of health lost.

properties.name: normal
properties.description: Normal must have the same frame_count as `leaves`.

properties.name: overlay
properties.description: Overlay must have the same frame_count as `leaves`. Won't be tinted by the tree color unless `apply_runtime_tint` is set to `true` in the sprite definition. See [here](https://forums.factorio.com/viewtopic.php?p=547758#p547758).

properties.name: shadow
properties.description: Shadow must have 1 more `frame_count` than `leaves`.

properties.name: trunk
properties.description: If `shadow` is not specified, this has to have one more frame than `leaves`.

types.name: Trigger
types.description: Loaded as one of the [TriggerItem](prototype:TriggerItem) extensions, based on the value of the `type` key.

types.name: TriggerDelivery
types.description: Loaded as one of the [TriggerDeliveryItem](prototype:TriggerDeliveryItem) extensions, based on the value of the `type` key.

types.name: TriggerDeliveryItem
types.description: The abstract base of all [TriggerDeliveries](prototype:TriggerDelivery).

properties.name: source_effects
properties.description: Provides the source of the TriggerDelivery as as both the source and target of the effect.

types.name: TriggerEffect
types.description: Loaded as one of the [TriggerEffectItem](prototype:TriggerEffectItem) extensions, based on the value of the `type` key.

types.description: The abstract base of all [TriggerEffects](prototype:TriggerEffect).

properties.name: damage_type_filters
properties.description: Guaranteed to work with [EntityWithHealthPrototype::damaged_trigger_effect](prototype:EntityWithHealthPrototype::damaged_trigger_effect) and [EntityWithHealthPrototype::dying_trigger_effect](prototype:EntityWithHealthPrototype::dying_trigger_effect). Unknown if it works with other properties that use [TriggerEffect](prototype:TriggerEffect).

properties.name: probability
properties.description: Must be greater than `0` and less than or equal to `1`.

types.name: TriggerEffectWithCooldown
types.description: A [TriggerEffect](prototype:TriggerEffect) with cooldown conditions, used to limit the frequency of trigger effects that would otherwise fire every single tick. If multiple cooldown conditions are defined, then all cooldowns must be satisfied before the effect can be triggered.

properties.name: distance_cooldown
properties.description: The travel distance between triggers that the triggerer must travel between effects. Negative values will mean there is no cooldown.

properties.name: initial_distance_cooldown
properties.description: The initial state of the distance cooldown. In other words, the distance the triggerer must travel before the first effect can be triggered. Useful for staggering multiple effects.

properties.name: initial_time_cooldown
properties.description: The initial amount of time to wait before triggering the effect for the first time.

properties.name: time_cooldown
properties.description: The number of ticks that elapse between triggers.

types.name: TriggerItem
types.description: The abstract base of all [Triggers](prototype:Trigger).

properties.name: collision_mask
properties.description: Only prototypes with these collision masks are affected by the trigger item.

properties.name: entity_flags
properties.description: Only prototypes with these flags are affected by the trigger item.

properties.name: force
properties.description: Only entities meeting the force condition are affected by the trigger item.

properties.name: probability
properties.description: Must be greater than 0 and less than or equal to 1.

properties.name: trigger_target_mask
properties.description: The trigger affects only prototypes with these masks.

types.name: TriggerTargetMask
types.description: An array of names of [TriggerTargetType](prototype:TriggerTargetType). See [Design discussion: Trigger target type](https://forums.factorio.com/71657) and [Blacklist for prototypes turrets shouldn't attack](https://forums.factorio.com/86164).

types.name: TrivialSmokeID
