properties.name: modifier
properties.description: Modification value, which will be added to the current turret attack modifier upon researching.

properties.name: turret_id
properties.description: Name of the [EntityPrototype](prototype:EntityPrototype) that is affected. This also works for non-turrets such as tanks, however, the bonus does not appear in the entity's tooltips.

properties.name: use_icon_overlay_constant
properties.description: If `false`, do not draw the small "constant" icon over the technology effect icon.

properties.name: enabled_states
properties.description: If not defined, visualisation will be drawn in all states.

properties.name: attacking_falloff
properties.description: Only loaded if `type` is `"mask-by-circle"`.

properties.name: attacking_max_radius
properties.description: Only loaded if `type` is `"mask-by-circle"`.

properties.name: attacking_min_radius
properties.description: Only loaded if `type` is `"mask-by-circle"`.

properties.name: falloff
properties.description: Only loaded if `type` is `"mask-by-circle"`.

properties.name: max_radius
properties.description: Only loaded, and mandatory if `type` is `"mask-by-circle"`.

properties.name: min_radius
properties.description: Only loaded if `type` is `"mask-by-circle"`.

types.name: TurretSpecialEffectCenter
types.description: If this is loaded as a single Vector, it is used for all directions.

types.name: UnitAISettings
types.description: Used by [UnitPrototype](prototype:UnitPrototype) and [SpiderUnitPrototype](prototype:SpiderUnitPrototype).

properties.name: allow_try_return_to_spawner
properties.description: If enabled, units that have nothing else to do will attempt to return to a spawner.

properties.name: destroy_when_commands_fail
properties.description: If enabled, units that repeatedly fail to succeed at commands will be destroyed.

properties.name: do_separation
properties.description: If enabled, units will try to separate themselves from nearby friendly units.

properties.name: join_attacks
properties.description: If enabled, the unit is permitted to join attack groups.

properties.name: path_resolution_modifier
properties.description: Must be between -8 and 8.

properties.name: size_in_group
properties.description: The amount of slots in a unit group this unit takes up. For example, a unit with `groupingSize` of 2 will count as 2 normal-sized units when filling up a unit group. Must be greater than 0.

properties.name: attacking_frame_sequence
properties.description: Indices of frames from the attack parameter animation.

properties.name: back_to_walk_frame_sequence
properties.description: Indices of frames from the attack parameter animation.

properties.name: cooldown_frame_sequence
properties.description: Indices of frames from the attack parameter animation.

properties.name: prepared_frame_sequence
properties.description: Indices of frames from the attack parameter animation.

properties.name: warmup2_frame_sequence
properties.description: Indices of frames from the attack parameter animation.

properties.name: warmup_frame_sequence
properties.description: Indices of frames from the attack parameter animation.

properties.name: max_gathering_unit_groups
properties.description: Maximum number of automatically created unit groups gathering for attack at any time.

properties.name: max_group_member_fallback_factor
properties.description: If a member falls behind more than this times the group radius, the group will slow down to max_group_slowdown_factor.

properties.name: max_group_radius
properties.description: Limits for group radius (calculated by number of numbers).

properties.name: max_group_slowdown_factor
properties.description: When members of a group are behind, the entire group will slow down to at most this factor of its max speed.

properties.name: max_member_slowdown_when_ahead
properties.description: When a member gets ahead of its group, it will slow down to at most this factor of its speed.

properties.name: max_member_speedup_when_behind
properties.description: When a member falls behind the group he can speedup up till this much of his regular speed.

properties.name: max_unit_group_size
properties.description: Maximum size of an attack unit group. This only affects automatically-created unit groups; manual groups created through the API are unaffected.

properties.name: max_wait_time_for_late_members
properties.description: After the gathering is finished the group can still wait for late members, but it doesn't accept new ones anymore.

properties.name: member_disown_distance
properties.description: If a member falls behind more than this time the group radius, it will be removed from the group.

properties.name: min_group_gathering_time
properties.description: Pollution triggered group waiting time is a random time between min and max gathering time

types.name: UnitSpawnDefinition
types.description: It can be specified as a table with named or numbered keys, but not a mix of both. If this is specified as a table with numbered keys then the first value is the unit and the second is the spawn points.

properties.name: spawn_points
properties.description:
Array of evolution and probability info, with the following conditions:

- The `evolution_factor` must be ascending from entry to entry.

- The last entry's weight will be used when the `evolution_factor` is larger than the last entry.

- Weights are linearly interpolated between entries.

- Individual weights are scaled linearly so that the cumulative weight is `1`.

properties.name: use_icon_overlay_constant
properties.description: If `false`, do not draw the small "constant" icon over the technology effect icon.

properties.name: recipe
properties.description: Prototype name of the [RecipePrototype](prototype:RecipePrototype) that is unlocked upon researching.

properties.name: use_icon_overlay_constant
properties.description: If `false`, do not draw the small "constant" icon over the technology effect icon.

properties.name: use_icon_overlay_constant
properties.description: If `false`, do not draw the small "constant" icon over the technology effect icon.

properties.name: uses_stack
properties.description: Whether using the capsule consumes an item from the stack.

types.name: ValveMode
types.description: Defines the mode of operation for a [ValvePrototype](prototype:ValvePrototype).

options.description: Fluid will flow if input level > output level.
Fluid will flow if input level > [ValvePrototype::threshold](prototype:ValvePrototype::threshold) and input level > output level.
Fluid will flow if output level < [ValvePrototype::threshold](prototype:ValvePrototype::threshold) and input level > output level.

types.name: VariableAmbientSoundCompositionMode
types.description: Defines how are individual samples selected and played after each other.

options.description: Samples are selected randomly. The same sample cannot be repeated twice in a row.
Samples are selected in a repeating randomly selected sequence of a given length. The sequence is generated on each state transition. The same sample cannot be repeated twice in a row.
Samples are selected in a repeating sequence in which each sample is played once.
Samples are selected based on a sample currently playing in a different layer.

properties.name: control_layer
properties.description:
Name of a layer which controls this layer, a layer cannot control itself.

Only loaded, and mandatory if `composition_mode` is `"layer-controlled"`.

properties.name: control_layer_sample_mapping
properties.description:
Defines a mapping between controlling layer's samples and this (controlled) layer's samples. The number of items in the mapping must be the same as the number of samples in the controlling layer. Item in the mapping with index N defines which samples of this layer can play when the sample N is playing in the controlling layer.

Only loaded, and mandatory if `composition_mode` is `"layer-controlled"`.

properties.name: has_end_sample
properties.description: If `true`, the last of [Sound::variations](prototype:Sound::variations) is played at the end of a sequence (if the sequence is long enough). The end sample counts towards the [VariableAmbientSoundLayerStateProperties::sequence_length](prototype:VariableAmbientSoundLayerStateProperties::sequence_length).

properties.name: has_start_sample
properties.description: If `true`, the first of [Sound::variations](prototype:Sound::variations) is played at the start of a sequence. The start sample counts towards the [VariableAmbientSoundLayerStateProperties::sequence_length](prototype:VariableAmbientSoundLayerStateProperties::sequence_length)

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name has to be unique across all layers.

properties.name: number_of_sublayers
properties.description:
If greater than one, samples are composed in overlapping sub-layers, offset from each other.

If greater than one, one of `sublayer_starting_offset` or `sublayer_offset` must be defined. Both cannot be defined together.

Cannot be defined for layers with `"shuffled"` `composition_mode`.

Cannot be zero.

properties.name: sample_length
properties.description:
Explicitly defines sample lengths. The whole sample is played when this is not specified.

Cannot be defined together with `sublayer_offset`.

The minimum cannot be zero.

properties.name: sublayer_offset
properties.description:
Specifies offset between two sub-layers' samples.

This implicitly dictates the sample lengths as two sub-layer offsets.

Only loaded if `number_of_sublayers` is greater than one.

Cannot be defined together with `sublayer_starting_offset`.

The minimum of [RandomRange](prototype:RandomRange) variant cannot be zero.

properties.name: sublayer_starting_offset
properties.description:
Specifies starting offset of the second sub-layer.

Only loaded if `number_of_sublayers` is greater than one.

Cannot be defined together with `sublayer_offset`.

The minimum of [RandomRange](prototype:RandomRange) variant cannot be zero.

properties.name: variants
properties.description:
Cannot be empty.

Samples within a layer are the [Sound::variations](prototype:Sound::variations).

Number of samples must be the same across all variants.

Samples cannot have variable volume and all samples must have the same default volume.

types.name: VariableAmbientSoundLayerSample
types.description:
First property is the name of a layer.

Second property is the sample index.

properties.name: end_pause
properties.description: Pause before a layer finishes playing. The last repetition and consequently the layer being finished is not counted until the pause finishes.

properties.name: number_of_repetitions
properties.description:
The number of times a layer repeats itself until it's considered finished. If it's not defined, the layer never finishes on its own. What counts as repetition depends on the [VariableAmbientSoundCompositionMode](prototype:VariableAmbientSoundCompositionMode).

Each sample played is counted as a repetition of `"randomized"` layer.

Repetition of `"semi-randomized"` layer is counted when its sequence is finished.

Repetition of `"shuffled"` layer is counted when all samples play once.

Each sample played is counted as a repetition of `"layer-controlled"` layer.

If `number_of_repetitions` of [VariableAmbientSoundLayer::control_layer](prototype:VariableAmbientSoundLayer::control_layer) of `"layer-controlled"` layer is smaller than `number_of_repetitions` of the controlled layer, `number_of_repetitions` of the control layer is used for the purposes of `pause_between_repetitions` and `end_pause`.

Cannot be zero.

properties.name: pause_between_repetitions
properties.description: Pause between each repetition of a layer. The repetition is not counted until the pause finishes.

properties.name: pause_between_samples
properties.description:
Pause between individual samples within a sequence.

Cannot be defined for `"randomized"` layers without defining `sequence_length` as well. Alternatively, use `pause_between_repetitions` instead.

Cannot be defined for layers with `sublayer_offset` defined.

properties.name: sequence_length
properties.description:
Number of samples in a sequence.

The minimum cannot be zero.

Mandatory for layers with `"semi-randomized"` [VariableAmbientSoundCompositionMode](prototype:VariableAmbientSoundCompositionMode).

Applicable for layers with `"randomized"` [VariableAmbientSoundCompositionMode](prototype:VariableAmbientSoundCompositionMode).

Cannot be defined for layers with `"shuffled"` [VariableAmbientSoundCompositionMode](prototype:VariableAmbientSoundCompositionMode).

properties.name: silence_instead_of_sample_probability
properties.description:
A sample replaced by silence still counts as played for the purposes of sequence count, repetition count, pauses, etc.

Must be in the `[0.0, 1.0]` interval.

properties.name: start_pause
properties.description: Pause before a layer starts playing.

properties.name: variant
properties.description:
Index of a layer's variant.

Cannot be zero.

properties.name: layer_sample
properties.description: Specified sample must be playing in the specified layer.

properties.name: weight
properties.description: Cannot be zero.

properties.name: conditions
properties.description: Transition to `state` is possible only if all conditions are met.

properties.name: state
properties.description: Name of the state.

types.name: VariableAmbientSoundNextStateTrigger
types.description: Defines how a transition to next state is triggered.

options.description: Next state is triggered when all specified layers finish playing.
Next state is triggered after a set time.

properties.name: end_pause
properties.description:
Pause before a layer finishes playing. The layer being finished is not counted until the pause finishes.

Optionally loaded for `intermezzo` states.

properties.name: layers_properties
properties.description:
Must contain as many items as there is layers in the variable track. The items themselves can be empty. The order of items corresponds to the order of layers as they appear in the prototype definition.

Mandatory for `regular` and `final` states.

Cannot be defined for `intermezzo` or `stop` states.

properties.name: name
properties.description: Name has to be unique across all states.

properties.name: next_state
properties.description:
Cannot be defined if `next_states` is defined.

Doesn't need to be defined if there is only one state.

properties.name: next_state_layers_finished_layers
properties.description:
List of name of layers used to trigger state transition.

Only loaded, and mandatory if `next_state_trigger` is `"layers-finished"`.

properties.name: next_state_trigger
properties.description:
Mandatory if there is more than one state or if the only state transitions to itself.

Can be defined for `regular` states only.

properties.name: next_states
properties.description:
Cannot be defined if `next_state` is defined.

Cannot be defined if there is only one state.

Cannot be empty.

properties.name: number_of_enabled_layers
properties.description:
Defines how many layers will be playing. Which layers will be playing is selected randomly.

The minimum cannot be zero, the maximum cannot be greater than the number of layers.

Cannot be defined if any of `layers_properties` define the `enabled` property.

Cannot be defined for `intermezzo` or `stop` states.

properties.name: start_pause
properties.description:
Pause before a layer starts playing.

Optionally loaded for `intermezzo` states.

properties.name: state_duration_seconds
properties.description:
Defines for how long this state will be active.

Mandatory if `next_state_trigger` is `"duration"`.

Optionally loaded for `intermezzo` states.

options.description: Only special intermezzo layer plays in this state, the rest is paused.
The track will stay in this state for the remainder of the track's duration.
Transitioning into this state stops the track.

properties.name: alignment_samples
properties.description: Number of audio signal samples (default sampling frequency is 44.1kHz) defining a time grid. Music samples are aligned with this grid when queued.

properties.name: layers
properties.description: Cannot be empty.

properties.name: length_seconds
properties.description: Cannot be zero.

properties.name: states
properties.description:
The first state is used as the starting state and cannot be an intermezzo state.

Cannot be empty.

types.name: Vector
types.description: A vector is a two-element array or dictionary containing the x and y components. Positive x goes east, positive y goes south.

types.name: Vector3D
types.description: If this is specified as a three-element array then the array items are x, y and z, in that order.

properties.name: frames
properties.description: The size of all `frames` must be the same.

properties.name: use_icon_overlay_constant
properties.description: If `false`, do not draw the small "constant" icon over the technology effect icon.

types.name: VirtualSignalID
types.description: The name of a [VirtualSignalPrototype](prototype:VirtualSignalPrototype).

types.name: VoidEnergySource
types.description: Void energy sources provide unlimited free energy.

types.name: WaterReflectionDefinition
types.description: Entity water reflection. [Currently only renders](https://forums.factorio.com/100703) for [EntityWithHealthPrototype](prototype:EntityWithHealthPrototype).

properties.name: lightmap_alpha
properties.description: Value 0 makes water appear as water in water mask, but does not occlude lights, and doesn't overwrite lightmap alpha drawn to pixel previously (by background layer of tile transition, or underwater sprite). Light emitted by water-like-tile (for example lava) will blend additively with previously rendered light. Value 1 makes water occlude lights, but won't be recognized as water in water mask used for masking decals by water.

properties.name: textures
properties.description: Texture size must be 512x512. Shader variant `"water"` must have 1 texture, `"lava"` and `"wetland-water"` must have 2 textures and `"oil"` must have 4 textures.

types.name: Weight
types.description: Weight of an object. The weight is stored as a fixed-size 64 bit integer, with 16 bits reserved for decimal precision, meaning the smallest value step is `1/2^16`.

types.name: WireConnectionPoint
types.description: Definition of a point where circuit network wires can be connected to an entity.

types.name: WirePosition
types.description: Used by [WireConnectionPoint](prototype:WireConnectionPoint).

properties.name: infer_icon
properties.description: If set to `false`, use the icon from [UtilitySprites](prototype:UtilitySprites) for this technology effect icon.

properties.name: use_icon_overlay_constant
properties.description: If `false`, do not draw the small "constant" icon over the technology effect icon.

properties.name: infer_icon
properties.description: If set to `false`, use the icon from [UtilitySprites](prototype:UtilitySprites) for this technology effect icon.

properties.name: use_icon_overlay_constant
properties.description: If `false`, do not draw the small "constant" icon over the technology effect icon.

properties.name: infer_icon
properties.description: If set to `false`, use the icon from [UtilitySprites](prototype:UtilitySprites) for this technology effect icon.

properties.name: use_icon_overlay_constant
properties.description: If `false`, do not draw the small "constant" icon over the technology effect icon.

types.name: WorkingSound
types.description: This type is used to produce sound from in-game entities when they are working/idle.
examples:
```
-- roboport
working_sound =
{
  sound = {filename = "__base__/sound/roboport-working.ogg", volume = 0.6, audible_distance_modifier = 0.5},
  max_sounds_per_prototype = 3,
  probability = 1 / (5 * 60) -- average pause between the sound is 5 seconds
}
```

properties.name: activate_sound
properties.description:
Might not work with all entities that use working_sound.

Unused when `persistent` is `true`.

properties.name: deactivate_sound
properties.description:
Might not work with all entities that use working_sound.

Unused when `persistent` is `true`.

properties.name: extra_sounds_ignore_limit
properties.description:
If `true`, entities playing their extra sound don't count towards `max_sounds_per_prototype` limit. 'extra sound' refers to `idle_sound`, `activate_sound` or `deactivate_sound`.

Unused when `persistent` is `true`.

properties.name: idle_sound
properties.description:
The sound to be played when the entity is idle. Might not work with all entities that use working_sound.

Unused when `persistent` is `true`.

properties.name: main_sounds
properties.description: If this property is defined, all properties inherited from MainSound (and not overridden here) are ignored.

properties.name: max_sounds_per_prototype
properties.description:
Sets a maximum limit on how many entities of the same prototype will play their working sound.

Inactive entities without an `idle_sound` don't count towards this limit.

Entities with their working sound fading out don't count towards this limit.

Unused when `persistent` is `true`.

properties.name: persistent
properties.description: When `true`, working sounds for all entities of the same prototype are combined into one.

properties.name: sound_accents
properties.description: Unused when `persistent` is `true`.

types.name: WorkingVisualisation
types.description: Used by crafting machines to display different graphics when the machine is running.

properties.name: apply_recipe_tint
properties.description: Used by [CraftingMachinePrototype](prototype:CraftingMachinePrototype). Has precedence over `apply_tint`.

properties.name: apply_tint
properties.description:
Used by [CraftingMachinePrototype](prototype:CraftingMachinePrototype) ("status" and "visual-state-color" only) and [MiningDrillPrototype](prototype:MiningDrillPrototype).

For "status" on CraftingMachine and MiningDrill, the colors are specified via [WorkingVisualisations::status_colors](prototype:WorkingVisualisations::status_colors). For "resource-color", the colors are specified via [ResourceEntityPrototype::mining_visualisation_tint](prototype:ResourceEntityPrototype::mining_visualisation_tint).

properties.name: constant_speed
properties.description: Whether the animations are always played at the same speed, not adjusted to the machine speed.

properties.name: draw_in_states
properties.description: Only loaded if [WorkingVisualisations::states](prototype:WorkingVisualisations::states) is defined in the WorkingVisualisations that loads this.

properties.name: draw_when_state_filter_matches
properties.description: Only loaded if [WorkingVisualisations::states](prototype:WorkingVisualisations::states) is defined in the WorkingVisualisations that loads this.

properties.name: east_fog_mask
properties.description: If defined, animation in this visualisation layer will be used only as mask for fog effect and will not render in world.

properties.name: fog_mask
properties.description:
Loaded only if at least one of north_fog_mask, east_fog_mask, south_fog_mask, west_fog_mask is not specified.

If defined, animation in this visualisation layer will be used only as mask for fog effect and will not render in world.

properties.name: north_fog_mask
properties.description: If defined, animation in this visualisation layer will be used only as mask for fog effect and will not render in world.

properties.name: scorch_mark_fade_in_frames
properties.description: Only loaded, and mandatory if `mining_drill_scorch_mark` is `true`.

properties.name: scorch_mark_fade_out_duration
properties.description: Only loaded, and mandatory if `mining_drill_scorch_mark` is `true`. Cannot be larger than `scorch_mark_lifetime`.

properties.name: scorch_mark_lifetime
properties.description: Only loaded, and mandatory if `mining_drill_scorch_mark` is `true`.

properties.name: secondary_draw_order
properties.description: Used to determine render order for sprites with the same `render_layer` in the same position. Sprites with a higher `secondary_draw_order` are drawn on top.

properties.name: south_fog_mask
properties.description: If defined, animation in this visualisation layer will be used only as mask for fog effect and will not render in world.

properties.name: west_fog_mask
properties.description: If defined, animation in this visualisation layer will be used only as mask for fog effect and will not render in world.

properties.name: always_draw_idle_animation
properties.description: Only loaded if `idle_animation` is defined.

properties.name: idle_animation
properties.description: Idle animation must have the same frame count as animation.

properties.name: shift_animation_transition_duration
properties.description: Only loaded if `shift_animation_waypoints` is defined.

properties.name: shift_animation_waypoint_stop_duration
properties.description: Only loaded if `shift_animation_waypoints` is defined.

properties.name: shift_animation_waypoints
properties.description: Only loaded if one of `shift_animation_waypoint_stop_duration` or `shift_animation_transition_duration` is not 0.

properties.name: states
properties.description: At least 2 visual states must be defined or no states at all. At most 32 states may be defined.

properties.name: status_colors
properties.description: Used by [WorkingVisualisation::apply_tint](prototype:WorkingVisualisation::apply_tint).

properties.name: working_visualisations
properties.description: Used to display different animations when the machine is running, for example tinted based on the current recipe.

properties.name: min_entity_count
properties.description: Has to be less than or equal to `max_entity_count`.

types.name: boolean
types.description: A variable type which can have one of two values: `true` or `false`. Wikipedia has a [comprehensive article](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Boolean) on Booleans.

types.name: double
types.description:
Format uses a dot as its decimal delimiter. Doubles are stored in the [double precision](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Double-precision_floating-point_format) floating point format.

May not be [NaN](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NaN).

types.name: float
types.description:
Format uses a dot as its decimal delimiter. Floats are stored in the [single precision](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Single-precision_floating-point_format) floating point format.

May not be [NaN](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NaN).

types.name: int16
types.description:
16 bit signed integer. Ranges from `-32 768` to `32 767`, or `[-2^15, 2^15-1]`.

Decimal numbers are automatically truncated when used in place of `int16`.

types.name: int32
types.description:
32 bit signed integer. Ranges from `-2 147 483 648` to `2 147 483 647`, or `[-2^31, 2^31-1]`.

Decimal numbers are automatically truncated when used in place of `int32`.

types.name: int8
types.description:
8 bit signed integer. Ranges from `-128` to `127`, or `[-2^7, 2^7-1]`.

Decimal numbers are automatically truncated when used in place of `int8`.

types.name: string
types.description: Strings are enclosed in double-quotes.

types.name: uint16
types.description:
16 bit unsigned integer. Ranges from `0` to `65 535`, or `[0, 2^16-1]`.

Decimal numbers are automatically truncated when used in place of `uint16`.

types.name: uint32
types.description:
32 bit unsigned integer. Ranges from `0` to `4 294 967 295`, or `[0, 2^32-1]`.

Decimal numbers are automatically truncated when used in place of `uint32`.

types.name: uint64
types.description:
64 bit unsigned integer. Ranges from `0` to `18 446 744 073 709 551 615`, or `[0, 2^64-1]`.

Decimal numbers are automatically truncated when used in place of `uint64`.

types.name: uint8
types.description:
8 bit unsigned integer. Ranges from `0` to `255`, or `[0, 2^8-1]`.

Decimal numbers are automatically truncated when used in place of `uint8`.

values.name: invalid
values.description: The default destination type of a cargo pod when created runtime. Setting its destination to any other type will instantly launch it.

values.name: orbit
values.description: Cargo pods with orbit destination are destroyed when ascent is completed.

values.name: space_platform
values.description: Only used for sending a space platform starter pack to a platform that is waiting for one. Regular deliveries to space platform hubs use [station](runtime:defines.cargo_destination.station) destination type instead.

values.name: station
values.description: Any cargo landing pad or space platform hub.

values.name: surface
values.description: Cargo pods will switch destination type from surface to station before starting descent if there is a station available and [CargoDestination::position](runtime:CargoDestination::position) has not been specified. Note, setting the destination to "surface" when the surface is the same as the one the pod is on forces it to find and set a landing position.

defines.name: command
defines.description: Command given to units describing what they should do.

values.name: attack_area
values.description: Go to a place and attack what you see.

values.name: build_base
values.description: Go to a position and build a base there.

values.name: group
values.description: Do what your group wants you to do.

values.name: stop
values.description: Stop moving and stay where you are.

defines.name: compound_command
defines.description: How commands are joined together in a compound command (see [defines.command.compound](runtime:defines.command.compound)).

values.name: logical_and
values.description: Fail on first failure. Only succeeds if all commands (executed one after another) succeed.

values.name: logical_or
values.description: Succeed on first success. Only fails if all commands (executed one after another) fail.

values.name: return_last
values.description: Execute all commands in sequence and fail or succeed depending on the return status of the last command.

values.name: character
values.description: The controller controls a character. This is the default controller in freeplay.

values.name: cutscene
values.description: The player can't interact with the world, and the camera pans around in a predefined manner.

values.name: editor
values.description: The Editor Controller near ultimate power to do almost anything in the game.

values.name: ghost
values.description: Can't interact with the world, can only observe. Used in the multiplayer waiting-to-respawn screen.

values.name: god
values.description: The controller isn't tied to a character. This is the default controller in sandbox.

values.name: remote
values.description: Can't move/change items but can build ghosts/change settings.

values.name: spectator
values.description: Can't change anything in the world but can view anything.

values.name: by_anything
values.description: Attack closer enemy entities, including entities "built" by player (belts, inserters, chests).

values.name: by_enemy
values.description: Attack closer enemy entities with force.

values.name: none
values.description: Perform command even if someone attacks the unit.

values.name: disabled
values.description: Used by constant combinators: Combinator is turned off via switch in GUI.

values.name: full_output
values.description: Used by crafting machines, boilers, burner energy sources and reactors: Reactor/burner has full burnt result inventory, boiler has full output fluidbox.

values.name: low_input_fluid
values.description: Used by boilers and fluid turrets: Boiler still has some fluid but is about to run out.

values.name: missing_required_fluid
values.description: Used by mining drills when the mining fluid is missing.

values.name: no_input_fluid
values.description: Used by boilers, fluid turrets and fluid energy sources: Boiler has no fluid to work with.

values.name: no_path
values.description: Used by trains and space platform hubs.

values.name: not_plugged_in_electric_network
values.description: Used by generators and solar panels.

values.name: pipeline_overextended
values.description: Used by pipes, pipes to ground and storage tanks.

values.name: waiting_for_more_items
values.description: Used by inserters when wait_for_full_hand is set.

values.name: waiting_for_space_in_destination
values.description: Used by inserters and mining drills.

values.name: waiting_for_target_to_be_built
values.description: Used by inserters targeting entity ghosts.

defines.name: events
defines.description: See the [events page](runtime:events) for more info on what events contain and when they get raised.

values.name: always
values.description: Game controller will always hover this element regardless of type or state.

values.name: never
values.description: Never hover this element with a game controller.

values.name: normal
values.description: Hover according to the element type and implementation.

values.name: assembling_machine_dump
values.description: Used for ejected items, or items held by inserters that can't be inserted due the recipe being changed with the circuit network.

values.name: crafter_trash
values.description: Used for spoil result items that do not fit into the recipe slots, and for items that are ejected when changing the recipe via remote view.

values.name: if_redundant
values.description: Print will be skipped if same text was recently printed (within last 60 ticks). Used by most game messages.

values.name: if_visible
values.description: Print will be skipped if same text is still visible (printed within last 1152 ticks). Used by some notifications.

defines.name: prototypes
defines.description: This define describes all top-level prototypes and their associated subtypes. It is organized as a lookup table, meaning the values of all the defines is `0`. As an example, `defines.prototypes['entity']` looks like `{furnace=0, inserter=0, container=0, ...}`.

values.name: deliver_items
values.description: Deliver specific items to an entity (item request proxy).

values.name: pickup_items
values.description: Pickup items from an entity (item request proxy).

defines.name: rocket_silo_status
defines.description: The various parts of the launch sequence of the rocket silo.

values.name: arms_advance
values.description: The next state is `rocket_ready` or if the rocket is destroyed in this state then the next state will be `lights_blinking_close`. The rocket is getting prepared for launch.

values.name: arms_retract
values.description: The next state is `rocket_flying` or if the rocket is destroyed in this state then the next state will be `lights_blinking_close`. The rocket is getting launched.

values.name: building_rocket
values.description: The rocket silo is crafting rocket parts. When there are enough rocket parts, the silo will switch into the `create_rocket` state.

values.name: create_rocket
values.description: The next state is `lights_blinking_open`. The rocket silo rocket entity gets created.

values.name: doors_opened
values.description: The next state is `rocket_rising` or if the rocket is destroyed in this state then the next state will be `lights_blinking_close`. The rocket is getting prepared for launch.

values.name: doors_opening
values.description: The next state is `doors_opened`. The rocket is getting prepared for launch.

values.name: engine_starting
values.description: The next state is `arms_retract` or if the rocket is destroyed in this state then the next state will be `lights_blinking_close`. The rocket is getting launched.

values.name: launch_started
values.description: The next state is `engine_starting` or if the rocket is destroyed in this state then the next state will be `lights_blinking_close`. The rocket is getting launched.

values.name: lights_blinking_open
values.description: The next state is `doors_opening`. The rocket is getting prepared for launch.

values.name: rocket_flying
values.description: The next state is `lights_blinking_close`. The rocket is getting launched.

values.name: rocket_ready
values.description: The rocket launch can be started by the player. When the launch is started, the silo switches into the `launch_starting` state.

values.name: rocket_rising
values.description: The next state is `arms_advance` or if the rocket is destroyed in this state then the next state will be `lights_blinking_close`. The rocket is getting prepared for launch.

defines.name: signal_state
defines.description: State of an ordinary rail signal.

values.name: no_schedule
values.description: Doesn't have any stations in schedule.

values.name: starter_pack_on_the_way
values.description: Starter pack is on the way.

values.name: starter_pack_requested
values.description: Starter pack was requested from the logistics system.

values.name: waiting_for_departure
values.description: Platform is ready to leave this planet and does not accept deliveries.

values.name: destination_full
values.description: Same as no_path but all candidate train stops are full

values.name: manual_control
values.description: Can move if user explicitly sits in and rides the train.

values.name: manual_control_stop
values.description: Switched to manual control and has to stop.

values.name: no_path
values.description: Has no path and is stopped.

values.name: player
values.description: These wires can be modified by players, scripts, and the game. They are visible to the player if the entity's `draw_circuit_wires` prototype property is set to `true` and both ends of it are on the same surface.

values.name: radars
values.description: These wires can only be modified by the game. They are not visible to the player, irrespective of the `draw_circuit_wires` prototype property.

values.name: script
values.description: These wires can be modified by scripts and the game. They are not visible to the player, irrespective of the `draw_circuit_wires` prototype property.
